restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content:
Tian Yuan Xiang SG - 田原香 新加坡's drip chicken essence has a sweet light taste to it. Even though it is a concentrated double-boiled chicken broth with no water added to it, it has a clean fresh savoury flavour. Since the best time to consume it is between morning to 4pm, i will usually feed it to the kids before sending them to school.

Tian Yuan Xiang original drip chicken essence  is individually packed in frozen sachets. It only use natural chicken (free from drugs or injections) and the meat are Halal Certified. To consume it, you can either heat it up in a bowl of hot water or simple put in a microwave for few minutes. So convienent.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content:
One bowl a day to supplement original Qi, Strengthen body and  debate fatigue.  I will usually drink it in the morning (or anytime before 4pm) simply by thawing a pack and double boiling it or microwaving it. Fast and convenient!

The best part is that each bowl is made from halal chicken and has a is very pleasant taste with no bitter aftertaste, just like drinking homemade chicken soup.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content:
First try frozen chicken essence
simple into a bowl, steam it in a rice cooker with 40ml of water in the outer pot for 5-8 mins.
bowl of chicken essence every morning,
Give me energies for the whole day! 💪🏻

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: I didn’t like the taste of chicken essence. I had to give it a try when I was pregnant. I didn’t expect it to taste so good.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: The taste is so smooth and so rich. It is easy to prepare and I love to share this with my family and kids.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: What I like about Tian Yuan Xiang Original Chicken Essence is that it is very easy to prepare, and tastes so good! Not smelly at all!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Tried it as Lin Chi Lin is their ambassador. It is super comforting to combat my fatigue and provides me with a high nutritional value without the bad thing. It tastes better with traditional chicken essence. I always pour one bag in my cooked mee suah as quick light meal fix. My life saver during my morning sickness period.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: No unpleasant fishy taste and not bitter at all! So easy to heat up too! Love it helps to boost my body energy and fight fatigue!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Love it! It’s so easy to prepare by just popping them into a pot  and drink it! Taste wise it tasted like chicken soup very comforting! 😍

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content:
Non-bitter chicken essence, tastes like chicken soup.
My kids love it. Definitely worth it!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Really love shopping here plus the customer service is really nice ! The chicken essence is really convenient for a mother like me who needs the extra boost!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Love the chicken essence taste. Unlike other brand that I tried before gt a weird chicken taste. This taste exactly like double boiled chicken soup. Highly recommended it. ❤️❤️❤️❤️

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: The chicken essences really taste good unlike other brands and got me into the pink of health. Customer service was also tip top!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Love the individual sachet. Very convenient and easy to warm up.

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: This one taste good like real chicken soup without me boiling few hrs. Convenient and easy to prepare..

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Very convenient for working mom like us, heat it and drink it just on few minutes! The taste is good too..🥰

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: it's really good and tastes just like chicken essence. convenient to heat up and consume

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Great taste , took it for my wife confinement .. she really loves it , even me also used yo taste and love it !

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: The taste of the chicken essence like real chicken soup. Not like the usual chicken essence i got from supermarket

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Good taste! Very convenient for the whole family too. Will definitely buy again!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Delicious, not oily, it is the first time to drink

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: amazing flavour!

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content: Good

restaurant name: Tian Yuan Xiang (United Square) - Chicken Essence for Pregnancy in SG
content:
(Translated by Google) Unpleasant shopping experience

(Original)
不愉快的购物体验

Remember visiting this place when I was young, recently visited it again and looks like it has had some modern revamp.

Food is consistently good and their usual specials like the Peking duck and popiah skin are a must order. We ordered some other items which were pretty good too.

Service was up to par and staff was on hand to attend almost immediately.

Very tasty chinese food. French bean(干扁四季豆)in particular was the best I have ever had. Also ordered their Zhenjiang Pork Rib (镇江排骨) and Poached Sliced Beef in Spicy Sauce (水煮牛肉) which were both very good as well. Overall a very enjoyable meal.
Had an enjoyable dining experience at this newly renovated outlet. Interesting and delicious dishes. Attentive service from the crew, with Emily leading the team.

Haven't been there in years, and I'm glad they are still around. I was pleasantly surprised to see that they offer DIY popiah, as I don't remember them having it on their menu. We ordered a set to try. The portions were good for 2-3 persons, with 6 popiah skins. I wish they had provided more skins as they tend to break. The ingredients were great, very delicious and fresh. The garlic paste and chilli sauce both pack a punch, so you might want to go easy on them at first. I didn't see any dried shrimp nor fresh prawns, so I think this dish is suitable for vegetarians as well.
The ambiance was very nice, plus the courteous and friendly staff all made dining there a delightful experience. Well worth checking out if you're around the area.

I truly enjoyed the lunch here with family members whom we have not dine together for 2 years! Ordered the set for 10 paxs and portions were huge but satisfying.  The collagen barramundi dish is amazingly delicious.  We were very satisfied. Only drinks could be a little on the high side.

Visited in September 2021 for a family dinner. Service was prompt despite the Saturday crowd, and our orders were served quickly. Food was also as my family likes it, spicy and hot. Would recommend for family dinners or casual gatherings.

(Many of the signature dishes are from Plaza Singapura's Lokkee,  which ceased operations a while ago)

My go to place for quality and comfort food. Standard remain consistent over the years. Love the fried rice as is full of wok hei. Special shout out to Candi for being such a bubbly and attentive server. Thanks for the wonderful dining experience and see you soon at Square 2!
Great dining experience. Every dish was well executed and flavourful. Highly recommended to go with friends or family. Would definitely revisit.

Restaurant has been around for years but revamped menu recently serving dishes fr  Lokkee. It’s lokkee pricing too . The fire cracker chicken is $30. New dishes has up pricing to be on the steep side . It’s chicken bits fried in salt , dried Chili , ginger, spring onions , Sichuan peppers.  The yellow yolk look alike is actually mango sauce .

Special call out to the barramundi fillet atop bed of vege and toufu in a collagen soup base .
Fish fillet was thick, fresh , $88 can feed 4 to 6 pax .

Xiao long Bao was till good , the dumplings in Chili oil was nice too .

Great ambience and food, had the duck which is definitely their specialty, the lamb leg which did not taste like mutton at all  but if you're into that mutton taste maybe this isnt for you. Loved their eight treasures tea as well. The pork ribs were a little too sweet for my taste but if you like sweet bbt this is the dish for you. Also ordered the assorted vegetables and xiaolongbao and pan fried dumplings, which did not disappoint.

My grandchildren got excited with the DIY popiah and the peking duck, hands on meal.

The restaurant also did a salt and pepper fry with the duck carcass so nothing was wasted. However, the peking duck crepes were dry, especially the top layer, perhaps due to poor packing for delivery. The popiah skin was ok and did not dry out like the crepes for the duck.

The dumplings were meaty and juicy. I also like the four season beans with minced meat. The fried noodle texture was a tad tough for my liking although the taste (seasoning) was spot on.

Overall, it was a very memorable delivered meal which we enjoyed.

Delicious food and excellent service! Will certainly come again!

The dishes such as Peking duck, mermaid fish, xiao long bao, rou kan salad and desserts are a must try! Very delicately prepared, intricate and mouth watering!

Service was excellent as well! Staff were attentive and approachable and Emily was great!

Thumbs up!
The service is good and food is quality. Great for family. The restaurant is really thoughtful to allocate us with a room for the big group ❤️
Relocatee. Friendly service. Delicious food. Price a bit steep but mostly worth it. Great for eating with family or sharing.

Ambience: 5 Stars
Food: 5 Stars
Service: 5 Stars (Carol Cheng + Loong Yoke)

always wanted to try LAO BEIJING when they are in velocity, this is our first time trying and needless to say, it was an amazing experience and get our craving for peking duck fulfilled! 😊 what i like about is that i can order half peking duck instead of other tunglok places that i can only order 1 full peking duck. - which allow me and my wife to enjoy not only peking duck but also other dishes 😊 now awaiting for our dessert Tempura Durian to be serve 💕
Lovely place for traditional family gathering. Service was great, food was even better. My mom and my uncle love all the dishes we've ordered!

Lao Beijing moved from Velocity to Square 2. All the favourites in the menu still around.  The new place have more spacious seats. Service still good. Recommended items - Mermaid, bacon bal kwa with Sakad, salad Prawn with melon and walnut, egg white fried rice with convoy, fried French beans, black garlic xiao long bao and for dessert - Red bean pancake with ice cream.

This is my 1st time visiting this restaurant the food was nice and great the service staff was very helpful and friendly I really like the beef hor fun and many other dishes really must give it a try will bring more friends here

The wagyu beef truffle Hor fun … is a must have . The meal was tasty . Also had the braised red Garoupa fish soup with pickled cabbage and chilli . Fish was fresh and soup was good and a tad spicy . Bakes bacon salad Delicious but pricy . Overall I would come back again . Staff was very friendly and ambience was welcoming .

food tasted very average, definitely had better. super pricey and the portions were really small as well. the only good dishes were the xiao long bao and the la zhi ji but the rest were average
service was decent but didn’t feel like the meal was very worth it
Came for afternoon dimsum buffet. Self serve certain items while order ala carte for the rest. Time limit of 90 minutes per table
Good tastes for original Beijing flavour cuisine. Spent S$200+ for 4 people. Xiao Long bao and guoti are also good.
The food is nice. The staffs are very responsive and helpful. Wonderful experience dining here

Great when you need to catch a Chinese meal at Velocity, in Novena area. The beef noodle soup with tendon and brisket was flavorful. Brisket was tender (think it's slow-cooked?) and I usually don't like brisket but finished all of it. The noodle would be even better if the soup came steaming hot, an essential trait for Chinese style noodles.
Excellent service with amazing food. Compliment to Aunty chun Hong, my daughter made the place messy and she was very nice to offer tissue and water for her.
Delicious food with superb service! Definately coming back again!
Had the chow mien which was flavourful and tasty. Service staff was also prompt in taking orders and provided updates on the restaurant's relocation.

We came here to celebrate dad birthday. The food quality is excellent. The staffs are very polite and extremely helpful. They are always smiling, checking in on quality of food, changing plates. The restaurant has a nice and unique atmosphere. Definitely will come again.
The mermaid dish nice. Service crew can be abit over friendly by keep coming to your table to ask if you want to order when you are still waiting for friend to arrive.
go to spot for Peking duck! They also do the duck in other flavours such as the 椒盐鸭 which is a family favourite. Service could be more attentive, hard to get their attention

Recently changed menu, realised they combined the some dishes from original menu with Lokkee which was recently closed down. Liked the wagyu beef horfun. Guo tie is ordinary. The scallion wrap with fish filling is good surprise. Free mango sago dessert from friendly captain, but unfortunately too sweet to my taste.
Had the Hi Tea buffet. Menu variety for buffet was little. In general a nice spread but not as satisfying as it could be (no xiao long baos). Would recommend their ala carte menu instead.
The foods here delicious n good. The staffs polite n helpful. Peking duck is superb. Highly recommended.

Went Lao Beijing to celebrate my father’s birthday and was pleasantly surprised by the food quality. Despite the pricing is not that of a high-end Chinese restaurant, the food is definitely top notch. The Peking duck is flavourful and crispy, and the other dishes were also delicious too. Not forgetting the manager- Emily who has prompt and good service. She is efficient, polite and helpful. I will not hesitate to return for meals.
Great service and the staff were very very good and accommodating to our request. Highly recommanded especially chun rong she was very very good.

Good place for noodles and simple Chinese dishes. Beef noodles is pretty good with noodles having a good texture. Xiao Long Bao and some of the other snacks taste good. The recent afternoon tea ala carte buffet is pretty good too with a nice range of dim sum. Price for the buffet is reasonable.
Always a pleasure to dine here, dishes are delicious and service impeccable.
It is always a good place to eat alone or with your friends and families. Dim Sum here is tasty and juicy~ A very good choice for Cantonese food lovers~

We love the food here! Taste is awesome, presentation is unique, and we really enjoyed our meal every time we are here. we highly recommend the mermaid (fish dish in collagen soup), flaming pineapple, truffle hor fun, and the hanging bacon salad! Great place for family meal and presentable for bringing guests.

This is our first visit in almost 2 years. What surprise us pleasantly was how their service has become more personable.  All the waitresses and managers always have a smile on their face when they approached our table and speak to our children. I have not had such a feeling for a long time and for a while gave up being served.  At the end of the day, there is restaurants with great food and limited service and there is restaurant with decent food with great service. I will certainly choose the latter.
The mermaid collagen soup is rich in taste and  excellent. Must try .
Very tasty dishes and good presentation with visual effects . Please keep up the good work 🙏👍👏🏻
We celebrated our 39th wedding anniversary in this restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food especially the Beijing duck.

Nice setting and Candi took really good care of us. She is attentive to our needs and ensures all our dishes come timely. The popiah and the rest of the dishes we ordered were delicious. Will definitely dine in again!

Warm and friendly service. The online reservation (via Chope platform) is not working so reserved table by calling them. As usual, the food was amazing. Yummy, yummy, yummy. Expect about $25 to $40 per person price range.

We have lunch yesterday at this restaurant. We are happy with the variety of dishes available. The food portion is generous and the food tasted delicious. The service staff are friendly and served with a smile.

The services and the food quality exceeded our expectations and we will definitely return for lunch and dinner.
The bean paste noodle was miserly in portion though price had gone up. Not only was noodles dry and clumpy, the bean sauce was small in portion , hence making the noodles "dry".

Extremely good service and very satisfied with the food. Very tasty and presented well! Perfect location to host family gathering and celebrations! Speed of serving the food and replenishing the tea is amazing as well. Highly recommended!

Had an excellent lunch at the newly revamped Lao Beijing. The service staff were very polite and attentive. The Peking Duck is even better than the version we had at the old place. Highly recommended!

The ambiance is always good even when there are lots of guests. Food has always been delicious. It’s interesting that the restaurant is bold to revamp its menus every now and then. Thank you for being my family’s favourite restaurant.

A simple yet delicious get together dinner with my cousins.
Service staff were polite and helpful. We were shown to our seats promptly upon checking in, and they even helped to change our utensils when we change over for dessert.
The new QR ordering is easy to use and our orders came in promptly.
The automated delivery train is fun and easy to use, thanks to the clear direction indicated.
The highlight is definitely the sweet and sour meat which came in with a grand appearance thanks to the dry ice effects.

Came here for the dimsum buffet. Being a weekday, it was priced at $36.80 (4 diners, 1 diner eats free). The selection was good. However, the eating time is only 2 hours, so it was a bit rushed. The quality of food was normal, reasonable for the price. Good for large groups when u can't decide what to order but not good because of the time limit. Service was good.

Fashioned after a tea house, this restaurant serves dim sum and Chinese dishes. A
Good variety of dim sum available but I think there are better dim sum out there. The best dish were the white bait fish in truffle oil and roast pork noodles. Congee was disappointing as it was bland. Spinach with 3 eggs lacked flavour. Pork ribs had more yam than meat! Egg tarts are bite sized, flaky and warm. We had booth seats which can sit 4-5 people comfortably. The dishes are served using the smart train belt which is quite efficient but not easy for children to handle.
Service was fast and attentive. Overall, a pleasant experience however the food quality not as good as expected.
Our Tim sum place at novena but there aren’t many varieties for Dim Sum. Fried rice with shrimp was nice. Icy sweet & sour pork was interesting for the 1st time but meat was normal.

It’s a decent place. Love the signature Cheong fun, crispy and succulent shrimps. The durian glutinous dessert is okay.
Fully automated using conveyance belt to deliver to you.

The place does a weekend high tea dim sum buffet which is pretty decent and good value. The buffet has a good range of dim sum and other Chinese dishes. Food quality wise, pretty good since this is after all part of Tung Lok. Service is efficient, and ordering is all automated. Prices seem reasonable.

Quite a bad experience over there. Food was so-so nothing too impressive about. We went for the dim sum buffet menu and guess what har gao or shrimp dumpling is not in the dim sum buffet menu and have to ordered separately.

That’s not the worst, the steam fish come with a strong mud smell but they use large amount of garlic to cover the smell.

The atmosphere is not great even though they are located in a shopping mall the air con in the restaurant is high and there is no cooling feeling.

Lastly, the service. The service is not great at all, no one attended to the table service and our emptied plates are all piling up at the table and no one is here to clear the plates UNTIL when we are about to left the table.

Horrible experience definitely not going back again. There is so many more dim sum place better then them.

The hightea buffet is worth checking in. All
the food items are very tasty and couldn’t find any flaws to it. The dumplings with chilli & oil are exceptionally good! They have frozen ones available to purchase too.

Ala carte buffet dinner at reasonable prices. Staff service was good. Dishes delivered via conveyor belt system. Reducing much wait time. Ordering via online menu after scanning a QR code givevn by staff was also quick and simple.
The food was fabulous. Also, the staff are honest and helpful. My friend dropped his credit card. They are guided us to conceign to collect the lost card. Thank you Emily and Li Zhen!

My 1st time here with my friend recommendation.

Food is pretty decent and quite a number of choices from Dim Sum to A la Carte buffet of Chinese food.

The promotion is 3+1 excluding drinks that is 1 for 1 promotion.  Reasonable prices and we spent less than $40/pax

The high tea buffet is super value for money. You get delicious food with freshly made dim sum. The menu is periodically updated so you get new food items once in a while. Fried food is piping hot and on point, seasonings all well done. As it's a buffet, we also love that the quantities are perfect for tasting, just order a few more if you want! We're repeat customers and we'd continue coming!
Chilli crab sauce Lala, Thai sweet chilli sauce crispy tofu, stir fried beef are must orders.

capturing fresh, chewy prawns but somewhat missing the spicy kick of 红油抄手。it's more on the sour and tangy side but I wished it also gave more of that numbing delight. Nevertheless, still plump & juicy

20200816: VERY SNEAKY. Put a side dish say for u and at the end charge u in the bill.
It could have been a gd constant rating for such a top brand restaurant.

Quality of the food is good. Mid tier price range.

This is my first time here and I felt like I have stepped into an authentic Chinese Teahouse in Hong Kong. TungLok Teahouse @tunglokgroup is located at Square 2 which is nicely set against a backdrop of a busy Hong Kong Street. The concept is to re-create the convivial atmosphere where families can gather together while chatting over hearty dim sum delights.
.
TungLok Teahouse is also the first Chinese restaurant to launch the automated tray delivery system. Basically, once your order is ready, the food will arrive via the delivery track that is beside your table. You will pick up the food from the delivery track and you had to press the red button to have the tray return to the kitchen.
.
The menu features an array of exquisite handmade dim sum selections as well as Chinese favourites and Teochew cuisine
Food is generally good, the Bbq pork a bit expensive. Will come back to try the staff’s highly recommended dinner buffet

The dimsum buffet was priced ($26/pax) reasonably for the quality of food and convenient location though lacked variety. Some hits and misses, the prawn wrapped in beancurd skin was probably the best item in menu. Siew Mai was average, a tad dry, shrimp dumpling was also tad dry and the dumpling in red oil wasn’t good. Chee chong fun, egg tarts and har gao were missing from menu. Saved by the better dessert and cheerful service staff. Overall experience was good.

Had the Dinner Dim Sum Buffet.

It comes with abalone, sharkfin and a few other dishes on top of their free flow dim sum dishes.

However, not all dishes are worth the order.

For instance, prawn paste chicken tasted bland and felt more like a KFC crispy chicken with very very subtle/non-existent praen flavors.

Their charsiew and chicken, which si their BBQ roast, weren't nice at all. It taste more like a microwaved dish that's dried and weirdly flavoured.

Carrot cake was just average.

Sliced fish (with pork?), wasnt very nice as well.

But that's most of their bad.

So what's good?
Sharkfin literally had sharkfin in it, abalone was nicely seasoned and done. Fried beancurd prawn paste was unique, crispy and flavourful.

Their pork chop with chef's sauce is great as well.
Their spicy vinegar wonton is very nice, in contrast with the typical dim sum stores that barely had any filling, TungLok had it filled with prawn filling and very flavourful sauce.

Siew Mai were meaty and nice, worth the order for any dimsum trip.

Poached prawns are very savoury and fresh.

So is it worth another visit? Maybe? Likely not. It's refreshing to see their dimsum being served by the sushi trains u saw in Genki. But other than that, food wasnt very amazing.
Excellent service from staff Berlin! Having buffet here with a very reasonable price. Surprisingly all the food was amazing and delicious. Look at the pic!

Was celebrating my birthday.  Very nice food. At the first was very nice. But small accident with crocoach when the delivery tray send to my desk. But reported to the staff and they had quickly kill and remove the crocoach.  Didn't take the picture as I respect the owner business.
The Famous Irish Rosted Duck Very Juicee , is to die for, have to try it. Have 2 Souce, Plum Souce is 5 Star, and Sweet and Sour Pork Excellen. Best Service by Alan. 😊👍👍👍👍👍✨️
A rather interesting well decorated Chinese tea house, went there for dim sum lunch, good menu & food.
Fairly good menu choices. Have the usual dim sum choices. There's also a fridge selling some of their signature food in vacuum packed ready-to-heat-up pouches.
Food is nice and fresh! thumb up for the services too! 👍🏻👍🏻 recommend to family and friends gatherings! 😊

Being here for some many times. So I have to review again after last visit. The roasted duck is horrible. definitely not fresh, it come with a strong ransid and a stale meat taste. service standard drops alot as well.
nice place if want to eat hong kong dim sum, there's vip room if more people are dining, the restaurant staff are friendly too.
Always very tasty and delicious. The automated trays add a different experience from other dim sum restaurants.

All the Dim Sum are really yummy! Alan is a nice and friendly service staff. He recommended me a few special dishes for customer who dine in. I really love the special dishes a lot. Will definitely come back here to eat again in Novena Square TungLok Teahouse😊😋👍

At Tunglok Teahouse, Square 2. Service staff especially Alan super friendly and attentive. Will share about the food and chat politely to my 80+ mother, making her happy. But our negative feedback is to bring back the Beef Brisket Soup Noodles, because the older folks prefer that as the meat is softer for them. Hopefully this dish can come back, as my mom really loves it.

Again, thanks to Alan for making my mom happy each time she is here. It is an experience for her.

Food is delicious and served in good portions. Huge variety and value for money! Not forgetting excellent and friendly service from Lisa! My family and I enjoy our time at the dinner buffet very much.

Fun dining experience. The dim sum comes on the train and my 2 year old loved it. Service was good and staff were friendly and polite which, if I may say, is uncommon in such casual dining places in Singapore. The food was good but a bit too salty for me.

Went for the buffet,simply love the food. Quite delicious some of them ended up with yummy desserts.
Staffs are very friendly. Will be back again to try more food from the menu.

Mr Alan who served us is a professional staff. He made good recommendations to the food and was not pushy to make us over order. He continued to serve us with excellent service throughout. Overall the dining experience was awesome. Good customer service, good food.
Nice dim sum buffet and reasonable price

Thank you Alan. Very polite, friendly and offered us with good recommendation. Service was good. Food was served hot, fast was delicious. Really like how they use the serving belt to deliver the food. Very efficient and effective. Thank you.

1/5

Service was POOR, oh wait absolutely no service at all. Yet, there was still 10% service charge. Food was served via a conveyor belt - so where’s the service in that? And they made me queue for 20 mins just to foot the bill? Absolutely pathetic. The cashier was just have a casual conversation with another customer which held up the entire queue. Talk about customer service - really??

As for the food, it completely lacked quality. For the price charged, you’d have a better time at other more establish dim sum places. Ordered the white bait fish which felt like it was just a plate of fried flour. The prawn dumpling was sticky and tasted bland af. The conveyor belt also served one of our dishes to ANOTHER table before sending it back. Come on la

The only saving grace… oh wait none. This place is definitely not worth going - skip it babes.

Very good food, not too crowded for a weekend lunch. Food is not cheap but very tasty and service is good. My favourites were the stir fried  asparagus with black fungus and pine nuts,  sweet and sour pork and various dimsum dishes
Had a lovely dinner and thank you Ms Berlin koh for the awesome service.

Lisa is a very good host and made us feel very welcome. The food is delicious and we have been coming back often to try the dinner buffet. The ala carte items are wide ranging and worth the value. Will come back again for another celebration 🍾

Good variety of food, friendly and efficient staff. The train concept keeps the children engaged and makes dining out fun and different from most other restaurants.

Lost a star as some dishes are on the expensive side - $23 for a beef hor fun dish.

Lisa (staff) explained the details of the membership and she was so hospitable in serving us the food. My guests and I enjoyed our dining experience here.

I would definitely recommend friends to visit TungLok Teahouse.

I would like to compliment A very kind and friendly staff of yours, Mr Alan!

He never fails to greet us every time we visit. In fact, he took the effort to remember us!

Kudos to such an awesome worker of yours. 👍

Today is my birthday, just want a peaceful corner as my little one said she would like to have dimsum.  We ponder around a few areas and decided to go square 2.  Saw this and went to book a space for 11am.  Was there at 10am haha.  Good choice for me as my little one was thrilled by the food sending out to the belt like tutu train style.  We had xiaolong bao, charsiew chee cheong fun, marinated pork ribs,
Custard (minion looking) buns, not so good as the 流沙包is quite dry...doesn't flowed just cute.  Shrimp dumplings is OK.

For that peaceful zone on Sunday  I'm contented with these.
Staff are quite friendly.
Want to give a 6 star review to the staff Alan, he was very helpful and friendly. Food was delicious.  Serving time was fast. Have a pleasant experience.

Icy sweet and sour pork is the must try dish in the house. Nowadays you don’t find this dish easily in town.

三拼trio bbq is also delicious.

Two things could have been improved from the service side.
- not enough baby chair
- we were seated near the kitchen window where cooked food are ready to be served. The kitchen still uses the loud speaker to play alert sound to the waitresses to fetch the dishes to tables. Could be very annoying with repeat alert.
Food is served pretty quickly. Despite the price, its pretty delicious. Service staff is quick and efficient. Server Lisa is very friendly and helpful in recommendation.
Alan was efficient in serving table 35 and even portioning our food for us . He is also very alert to sense I was pregnant. I enjoy the service .
The service is really good. The person who served us is Alan. Such fantastic service. He is polite and attentive. Food here is good. We had dim sum.
Excellent noodles which were not too springy or too soft. We had a great server, Lisa - she took the time to understand what we liked and was attentive and checked if we needed more tea.

Went for their buffet on a wed night, it was almost full house once they start business.

Their dishes serve decently fast once ordered through their ipad.

The prawn dumpling soup is the best for me.

Finally found a authentic Korean restaurant that doesn't sell BBQ food 🤣
Wanted to taste an original black bean sauce noodles, and this is just great. The other spicy seafood and Oyster noodles are nice and tasty too. Noodles more like Chinese noodles than the usual Korean Ramen though.

Finally managed to try it on my 3rd visit as they were closed when I tried to visit earlier.

Try sweet and sour pork as it was highly recommended in  the reviews. Love that they use lean meat and the taste is well balanced and does not feel oily. Although the portion is labelled as 'Small'  I think it is good enough to be shared between 3 to 4 pax.

Black bean noodles is great 👍it is chewy and taste authentic. Portion is HUGE. I think 1 bowl can feed 2 girls or 3 small kids.

Kimchi is great and they are refillable.

Their service crew was quick in noticing that we were having trouble trying to eat the noodles and offered us a pair of scissors to cut them.

Will definitely go back to try other dishes.

Slightly on the pricier side but as authentic as it gets.

We ordered Set C (s$46) which consist of a Jjajangmyeon (noodle with black bean sauce), a Jjampong (spicy seafood noodle soup) and a Tang Su Yuk (sweet and sour pork). On top of that we separately ordered another Jjajangmyeon (s$10.80) and a fried chicken with garlic sauce (s$32). This is good enough for 4pax. The noodles were well prepped and flavorful. The fried chicken was really spicy but shiok! Also, they only serve free flow preserved pickles, kimchi and raw onion as side dishes.

This restaurant has no reservation system in place so do visit early to avoid queuing!

Bare minimal decor, the place is hidden behind the bus stop at Novena Regency, is the only place with queue during dinner.

Known for their Jajangmyeon and Tangsuyuk (Korean version of sweet and sour pork). But unlike other places, their Tangsuyuk (from $24/small) is made of deep-fried pork stripes, lightly battered before being coated in a well-balanced sweet & sour sauce. Cut into bite-size, it is pretty addictive to munch on though it’s recommended to eat them hot as it hardens when it’s cool.

For those who prefer something spicy, Kkanpunggi aka Spicy Garlic Fried Chicken (from $32/small) can set your tongue on fire. Deliciously fried chicken, it is enrobed in a red spicy sauce filled with peppers and garlic

Another good jajangmyeon option. We tried their seafood fried jajangmyeon. It's oilier as compared to the usual jajangmyeon as there is chilli oil in it but its more fragrant than the usual jajangmyeon. Not the best but worth a try. We like their spicy garlic fried chicken. Delicious 😋 😋 😋  as its full of onion, garlic and chilli. Mukjja is definitely a korean Chinese restaurant worth a try.

The black bean sauce noodles is delightful! I enjoyed it! Kimchi is very nice!! Thankful for the complimentary barley tea. Spicy noodle taste good as well.
The korean-chinese rendition of sweet and sour pork is interesting. Heavy batter (not a fan of this) but flavourful. I wish it has more types of veg! The black fungus seems to be a bit out of place. However, the serving is too much. I wish they can provide smaller serving at a cheaper price so that patrons can consider other dishes. Halved the portion ($10-$12) will be good for 2!
I would love to come back for the spicy garlic chicken and dumplings. Price is on the higher side but the portion fits the bill. I think smaller serving with proportional price point will attract returning customers 😊

The jjajamyeon here is really the best I’ve had in Singapore! Super flavourful and the noodles is nice and chewy. The sweet and sour pork is really good too. But it can be quite heavy to eat the entire plate to share between two pax. But definitely will be back

Finally found a jjajangmyeon in sg that I really like. Not too sweet.
Sweet and sour pork was nice too.
The only disappointment was the jjamppong.. I really liked the soup but..there were only noodles, tonnes of onions, some bits of cucumber and 1 tiny piece of squid in it.. For the price we are paying..($40 for the set as shown in the photos) just feel that there should be more seafood in the “seafood” noodles.. not just 1 tiny piece of squid.
super good jjajangmyeon!!!! the spicy fried chicken is good too! japchae is on the sweet side. love their kimchi too! portions are huge so good for groups, if not it would be too pricy per pax

recommended only for the black bean sauce noodles. it's super delish! but the ginseng chicken soup can skip.. cos we saw the chef bringing out an instant ginseng chicken soup... the kind you can get from supermarkets or online yourself.

Went at 2pm weekday Wednesday and ordered Set C. It consists of 1x Jjampong(spicy noodle), 1x Zhajiang noodle(minced pork dry noodle), 1x large plate of fry Sweet sour pork with refillable simple banchan of kimchi, onion and pickles. Jjampong was spicy taste good but only onions and 3 small pieces of squid. The dry noodle was atad too oily but the crunch frehs kimchi and pickles neutralise it. Sweet sour pork was medicroe nothing to shout about. Overall costed $50 but would not go back to have as tried others w similar Priceline in sg with much better taste and more ingredients(eg. Hwang sil).

We ordered the jjm, dumplings, seafood stew and the must-order sweet n sour pork.

The pork was a little expensive given the portion (had alot more veggie/onions so the plate itself looks quite full). Dumplings and jjm were average to me. Pretty decent seafood stew but again too much onions for my liking.

An after picture would better represent what we thought about the restaurant!

Authentic noodles, or at least I came for the noodles. Jajiangmien was really nice, sweet and fragrant, chewy noodles to complement, meat, bean and onions all mashed up in a beautiful dish. Japjae was sweet despite not being cooked with any meat. At least for me, this was a little treasure at a lesser known corner in Novena.

Decent, homely! The zhajiang noodle is AMAZING. U should really try it if u are there. The fried rice is decent because of the after taste. When I first bite it, nothing special but I like the lingering after taste. The sweet and sour pork is a little too sweet for my liking. Too much sauce.

The fried dumpling, I love it! Overall ,not bad but the beer is really expensive

Our favourite Korean-Chinese restaurant in Singapore. We visit this place very often and each time it never disappoints us. Out favourite is black bean noodle (짜장면) and samsun jjampong (삼선짬뽕). Service is good and price is reasonable for authentic Korean foods.

Have tried Set D - Sweet & Sour Pork + Stir fried Seafood Black Bean Sauce Noodles (Jajangmyeon), the food portion is big and should be enough for 3 persons with normal appetite. Authentic Korean food as the restaurant is opened by Korean, especially the Jajanhmyeon is a must try. The food is a bit pricey and the variety is not much, topokki is not available too.

Average at best. Set C came up at a total of $50.6 which is overpriced for the quality of food. Every dish there comes with an abundance of onions in them with the seafood soup with only two slices of squid in it. The bean paste noodles also has very negligible amount of meat bits in it. Sweet sour pork was also not crispy at all. Overall it’s rather disappointing.

My 2nd time eating Korean Chinese restaurant. Would say this place is the best value for $$. Ban Chan is good especially the Kimchi. Best dish of the day is the Tangsuyuk followed by Jjajangmyeon and Jjamppong.
For Tangsuyuk, the sauce and meat is better than the 1st. Jjajangmyeon the 1st is better but the onions in the sauce is more. Jjamppong tasted average. Ordered a set C for a young family of 4 is just right.

First time 'seafood noodles' only had 1 seafood item - sotong. Seafood means minimally prawn and sth else but not even the sth else. Omg and it's $14. Quite disappointing. And the sweet and sour pork is not say very tasty or special. It's just normal. Zhi char has better kolo meat I feel. We always see queues during weekends. Now I don't understand why.

Absolutely love the black bean noodles and sweet and sour pork, can really taste the authencity! The portion for the set meal is great and really worth the money. Service staff were nice! Food was served promptly! Will visit again👍 Thank you!

We ordered their tangsuyuk (sweet & sour pork), jajangmyeon (the noodle with black sauce) and jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle). They are all delicious and at a reasonable price. Definitely will return again. They're pretty popular these days, we were lucky to get the last table on dinner time.

Ordered Set C, which consisted of Tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork), Jjajangmyeon(black bean sauce noodle) and  jjampong (spicy seafood noodle).

The sweet and sour pork was too oily, we ate two to three pieces and it was too ‘Jelak’ for us. The pork was also not crispy and not appetising, the whole dish was ways off….

The Jjajangmyeon has only onion and nothing else, it was also too greasy. The jjajangmyeon tasted and looked like those packaged Jjajangmyeon you can find in the Korean food section in Cold Storage. There are other restaurants in Singapore that serve much better Korean black bean sauce noodle than this shop.

The spicy seafood noodle was also a huge disappointment. The soup tasted like instant noodle soup. We ordered ‘seafood’ noodle but there was no seafood at all, there were only three pieces of cured squid pieces with lot of onions. The noodle was also not authentic and not freshly made.

Definitely, will not visit this shop again. My advice to the owner or the cook is to go thru the YouTube, there are many channels that teach people how to cook simple Korean food. Please learn from these channels on how to cook proper Jjajangmyeon and Jjampong.

The jjamppong and jjangmyeon we ordered were really delicious and noodles were cooked to perfection. However, I have to say that the taste has been adjusted for local taste buds. The jjamppong would have tasted better if it was slightly spicier and had more "wok hey". We ordered their fried Mandu to try and finished everything as well.

Rebranded from the one that originally located at CQ Central. It might be my failing memory but had thought the taste was not up to mark after relocating to novena. While it tastes great (and sticky), the tangsuyuk had a lot of bites. But at least it reminded us to chew well before swallowing. Jjajungmyun will feed you well and at $11++ per bowl, it's probably the cheapest from a restaurant. The dumplings are a hit or miss with a price tag of $10++ for 13 bite-sized ones.

Nice selection of food. Taste of authentic korean food. The jja jiang miang taste super good unlike some places.

But I ordered wrongly. I didn't know the seafood soup got noodles too. Ended up I overflow myself and bill cost more for 1 person due to my own wrong order.

They also have free flow side dish available.

As many have commented, the black bean sauce noodles are good. Price increased by a lot (set C from $46 to $53) before service charge, and this just happened this month I think. I saw some reviews had bad experiences with the aunties and that happened to me too. Place was 20% full and what’s the issue with us shifting to a bigger table when the small table was not enough to accommodate our food comfortably? It was Sat evening but still early at 6pm. When we left at around 7pm, there were still 2-3 empty big tables. It’s a turn off when these ppl can’t even display some proper service and had to argue with the customers over such petty stuff. That auntie was sarcastic too and said we requested to change the table a few times, that was due to her poor Eng and comprehension that the first table near to entrance had hot and cold air alternations whenever the front door is being opened and we wanted to shift inside to another table (also 4-seater which she rejected and insisted for us to move to a 2-seater). After sitting down it felt too small as the set consists of two bowls of noodles and a big plate. The neighboring table (4-seater) also had 2 customers seated there ordering either similar things or lesser. So why the fuss about the move in order to “reserve” it for bigger group?

Eat at your own risk. I’m not sure what’s the rave’s about. Bill was $42, if you wan to Taobao, they charge a hefty 50cents+get.   :( service was good as they noticed we had kids and required fork and spoon and scissors. Food was not nice though. The sweet and sour pork was so so and the veggies were not cooked. The jjm was very salty and not much ingredients. Seafood food had a measly 2 pieces of squid as seafood, not even fake crabmeat or frozen shrimp. Everything was just full of onions. Lastly is the side dishes, only kimchi, nothing else. Me and hubs got diarrhoea and vomiting after eating here. Sad

Ordered the half jampong n half jajangmyeon.
The portion is huge and almost x2 of normal size. The jampong is spicy and jajangmyeon has strong taste of onions as the sauce has lots of onions.

While the taste is authentic but the cooking taste is not my preference.

However I like to say the customer service is very good. And a lot others seem to like as its full house even on wkday lunch.

Place is kinda packed during lunch and dinner time. Food is not bad but a little too pricey. Went 2 times.

Ordered the glass noodles during my first visit. Not too sure why there isn't any sliced pork in it when it is clearly stated on the menu that there will be sliced pork. Ordered the jajang rice too. The looks of the jajang rice is pathetic. Just a plate of rice with a fried egg + the sauce. If I remember correctly the glass noodles is 18 dollars and the jajang rice is 15 dollars. Also ordered the sweet and sour pork. Pork hardness is inconsistent. A good portion of it was hard af and the rest were just nice. Can't remember how much was it but it's definitely more than 20 dollars.

Ordered jajang noodles the 2nd time I went. Not too sure what's the hype about. While I feel it does taste better than the average jajang noodles you can find in Singapore, it certainly isn't very special or unique. Also ordered some spicy garlic chicken. It's better than the sweet sour pork. Costs 35 dollars and it's not even the big size. It's small size which is meant for 2 to 3 pax.

Overall I feel this place is overpriced. Food taste slightly above average. But for the price I'm paying I'll be expecting more than just slightly above average.

Visited the restaurant on Wednesday Night, we needed to wait for about 10-15 minutes since all the table were full at that moment. Ordered their set menu, comes with 2 bowls of Jjajangmyeon and one bowl of Tangsukyuk (sweet and sour pork), ordered one small portion of Fried chicken with soy bean sauce, portions are generous. Comes with free flow of drinks, kimchi, radish, onion and the small dot of black sauce.

Nice location, authentic food, good service.

The 2-3 pax black bean noodle set is truly sufficient for 3 men 🤤 Good value 👍🏻👍🏻

The give pickles and kimchi for side dishes, but they tasted really good.

The tangsuyuk was very good. Shaped more like a fry than a cutlet it was crunchy. Had an argument with my hankok gu because she ordered the original soju flavour when I wanted the blueberry flavoured one. She called me a noob. Tmd. Dulan. Team blueberry pls like my review.
The stir-fried Jajangmyeon tasted alright and I think they can do an option so that you can order a smaller portion for cheaper. The ginseng chicken soup was great 👍

Definitely the place to go for good jamppong and jajangmyeon. Waited for ard 30 mins to get a table on a Sunday afternoon. It was raining that time which might have resulted in a shorter queue. The noodle is really good. Jajangmyeon is almost similar to what I have tasted in Seoul. The tangsukyuk is less crispy than some other stores in Singapore, I guess it owes it to lesser batter used, but still, their tangsukyuk is pretty good too. Didn't received the 'excellent' service as many had reviewed. We were the only table not served with barley tea and finally served when asked. The table that came and ordered later than us got their food earlier than us. There was a lapse in their food hygiene - i found a strand of hair in our bowl of jajangmyeon, what an anticlimax after all that waiting to dig in. Fortunately, the staff were sincerely apologetic and replaced with a new one immediately. Definitely would go back again if i didnt find the hair in my bowl of noodles, ewww.

I ordered seafood fried rice but it was super disappointing. It costs $15 but looks so poor in terms of ingredients. I probably could get better seafood fried rice at any hawker center less than $5. Please do not order seafood fried rice.

If u want to enjoy something very Korean Chinese food, you must try here.  Every time I visited here, all the menu I tried made always me feel I was at home, Korea.  Still keep exploring other different dishes, nothing let me down so far.

Adding on Sep 19th, 2020
This restaurant seems to have become more popular these days.  The hall is full of local young generations at 11:40am and even such a long queue outside.  Hope this one keeps the same quality forever.

Tried Set C which consisted of the jjajangmyeon, jjampong(seafood noodles) and tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork)! 3 of us shared the set and food portions were definitely sufficient. Liked the jjajangmyeon and tangsuyuk the most; the jjajangmyeon sauce was savoury enough but not too jelat, and the tangsuyuk was nicely fried and went great with the sticky sweet and sour sauce! Will definitely come back again :) the kimchi was great too - crunchy texture and really good seasoning

I was so excited to chance upon Mukjja and amazed to learn that this is the ONLY Korean Chinese restaurant in Singapore that makes their own noodle every day! That explains extra chewiness and authentic taste of their signature black bean noodle (jjajangmyun).

Though the typical jjajangmyun uses pork, they also serve seafood version, unlike few other rivals, so my mom could finally enjoy it to her heart’s content.

I was there on the opening week and felt the spicy jjamppong was way too spicy. We provided feedback and hope they have tweaked the spicy formula a bit.

My son who never touches any dish with sauce totally loved the sweet and sour pork. It was softer than other place but easier to chew as a result.

Highly recommended!

Really delicious and authentic Korean food!!
Jjm was worth it, cause $11 for the big bowl.

If you want black bean noodles (jjajangmyeon) this is the place to go to! The noodles were springy and chewy and the sauce was smoky and complex.

But take note of the long queue. I had to wait 45 minutes for a table on a Friday evening. The queue only got longer later into the evening

Jajangmyeon is very good and the serving size is quite large. The service standards at this restaurant surpass most others: the staff pays close attention to your dining experience and would attend to you automatically. Dropped a chopstick and they will automatically pass you a new pair, automatically replenish the side dishes, ask you whether you'll like raw onion to go with the food etc. Will come back again for the jajangmyeon and good service.

Was skeptical about this place initially as it was introduced by one of our friends who sometimes make poor choices when deciding on food places.
She has proved us wrong this time.

Ordered a few dishes that evening, and the 2 dishes that left a deep impression was the Jajangmyeon and the sweet and sour pork. Super tasty! The first thing we complimented was not the food but to our dear friend who chose this place for dinner.

We did not have to wait too long for our food to be served. Service was excellent and the staff were very attentive to our requests.

As a local food critic, I will rate this place 9.43 out of 10 (give face abit and rounded up to 5 stars in this review). Highly recommended 👍
Had the Jajangmyeon and the portion was huge. The noodles were chewy and delicious. Loved the tangy kimchi and pickles which helped to balance the meat sauce.
The jajangmyeon tasted a little different from Tae Woo’s to me, but their sweet & sour pork was much better than Tae Woo’s.
Honestly speaking nothing to shout about! For the price point you can get better Korean food out there! For e.g obbjang or SBCD. Can come if there’s  no queue

I always go to eat there for years, I likes the food even though the boss go back Korea and close the restaurant without noticing. Until now, they asked me to stay outside for takeaway. There isn’t by government regulations and there no guest except me. It’s hot and no chair outside , I’ll never go back…
Jjm is decent, but not the best, however, their sweet and sour pork surprised me, highly recommended..99/100! Simply can't stop 🤩👍

Was previously an avid fan of obba.jajjang but after I visited this place!! I’ve never visited obba!!!
Their price point is more affordable than obba $11 for Jajangmyun (didn’t take note for the tangsuyuk and jam pong) but other than it’s price it’s one of the best Jajangmyun I’ve ever had!! (Even compared to those I got delivered to in Korea). You can tell that the sauce was home made (or at least I feel so) because it’s light and had a unique flavour. The jjampong also blew my mind with its milky seafood broth. The tangsuyuk is to die for esp with the portions and ingredients. I love the black fungus they generously added in!!
I think overall what I’m most impressed about is that most food I eat outside (obba included) leaves me thirsty however for mukkja amazingly it doesn’t!!

I even brought over my parents who hardly live outside food out and they approved!!!

Only have good things to say about this restaurant and would recommend to anyone who wants to have a good hearty bowl of Korean Chinese food.
If you stay more than 3 minutes after you finish eating, a staff would discomfort you, saying wants to clear the table while she is staring at the waiting queue despite 20 minutes of eating.
Generous servings and good service. The side dishes are delicious and also the sweet & sour pork

Overdue review.

Probably gone on a wrong evening when the aircon was not working and the place got stuffy very quickly when more customers came in.

Ordered so many dishes, though only 3 of us but sad to say we enjoy none

Found this absolute gem of a place at Balestier which has amazing Chinese cuisine at affordable prices. The dumplings can rival those at Whampoa food market. 3 dishes for $30. Quaint setting. Will visit again.
Very delicious with fair price. I would came for every week. strongly recommend you try this restaurant.
Food was really delicious, lady boss recommended the steamed sea bass as it was fresh. Absolutely wowed by the veggi dumplings. Will come back again.
Have been here a few times and will definitely visit again! The food is really tasty and at a very good price. The staff is helpful and the service is very quick.
My go to place for delicious Chinese food. This place is run by a nice Chinese couple who are always ready to recommend their best dishes.

Very friendly staff, nice variety of mainland Chinese dishes, including Sichuanese, Hunanese and dongbei food.  Not earth shattering, but generous portions, good value and very comforting.  (And open until midnight!)
Nice Bak Kut Teh and other Chinese traditional cuisine. I was already several times and the service is also very good.
Rare gems, surprise taste and fairly priced. Will come again!
Enjoyed this quaint  northern Chinese restaurant in Balestier.  Worth the travel!
My all time favourite Chinese diner! Tried almost the menu and all taste surprisingly good! Highly recommended!
Fantastic food and we especially love the chilli chicken signature dish. Such a friendly restaurant run by a family. About $12 per dish which will feed 2 if u order rice.

Good authentic Chinese food, friendly staffs too.
Mapo doufu and Dry-Fried Long Beans are some of my personal favorites, they do takeaway delivery too with Grabfood/Foodpanda
Value for money.  Skillful chinese cooking.  Good selection of authentic china chinese dishes to choose from.  Food portion is good.
Mutton soup with lots of veggies. Perfect as simple lunch or dinner. Highly recommended
We love this restaurant - the food quality, taste and service are well worth a visit.
Hands down the best home-cooked northern Chinese food you can find in SG. And they just reopened!
Excellent and authentic
Excellent food and very reasonable price
Love the food here is clean and hygienic!
Great taste.. friendly service.. Value for money
Love this place! Home cooked
👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 this is a treasure.

(Translated by Google) The store is easy to enter even by one person with just the right distance to the store and the customer service of the store owner.

(Original)
店構えも、店主の接客もちょうど良い距離感で1人でも入りやすい店

(Translated by Google) The first time I gave the evaluation because I have never had a meal and I feel sad... I like to eat garlic water spinach, but I didn’t expect it to be made like this. All are leaves and the stems are small. Obviously the dishes are not fresh... Garlic... Mapo tofu feels like boiled tofu with bean paste... It doesn't have any spiciness... I'm disappointed that it should not come... I hope the store can treat consumers more sincerely. I have a few comments, I hope it can be improved.

(Original)
第一次给评价因为从来没有吃饭吃到难过... 很喜欢吃蒜蓉空心菜，但没想到做成这样，全部都是叶子，梗也很小，很明显菜不新鲜...而且没有啥蒜... 麻婆豆腐感觉像是豆瓣酱水煮豆腐... 一点辣味都没有... 很失望应该不会来了... 希望店家可以更真诚地对待消费者吧，这边提出一点意见，希望可以改进.

(Translated by Google) After several times, I finally decided to give it a try today.
The conclusion is: an unexpected surprise. The food is delicious. The price is very reasonable. Will bring family and friends over.

(Repeated to go back with friends and family several times, everyone loved it. Attach photos here)

(Original)
经过几次，今天终于决定试一下。
结论是： 意外的惊喜。食物很好吃。价格很合理。会带家人和朋友过来。

(重复与朋友和家人回去了数次，大家都很喜欢。在这附上照片）

(Translated by Google) The restaurant located at a corner location at balestier and you may not spot it immediately after few pass-by. Had a really great and authentic Chinese dinner for Dong Zhi festival with nice dumpling and sweet sour pork here.

Will definitely come back again!

Passed by numerous restaurants near my home, I decided to have a meal during the winter solstice. The portion of the Northeastern cuisine is really big and honest, and the taste is very homely and authentic. Baobao meat is the most delicious thing I have ever eaten!

The proprietress is so kind and very nice, and eating at the winter solstice really brings warmth to the wanderers in Greater China. I hope the business of the boss and wife is prosperous!

(Original)
The restaurant located at a corner location at balestier and you may not spot it immediately after few pass-by. Had a really great and authentic Chinese dinner for Dong Zhi festival with nice dumpling and sweet sour pork here.

Will definitely come back again!

在家附近路过无数次的餐厅，冬至决定吃一顿。东北菜分量真得大得实诚，味道也很住家地道。锅包肉是我吃过最最最最最好吃的！

老板娘好亲切特别好人，冬至来吃真的给大中国的游子带来满满的温暖。希望老板老板娘生意兴隆！

(Translated by Google) A more authentic Chinese restaurant, covering a wide range of cuisines, including dishes from the north and the south. The dishes are delicious, and the pot of pork and scallion pancakes are recommended. Fish-flavored shredded pork with less sugar has no sweetness. If you are not used to it, you can consider some others.

(Original)
比较地道的中餐店，覆盖的菜系比较广，北方南方的菜都有做。菜都很好吃，锅包肉以及葱油饼比较推荐。鱼香肉丝加糖少没什么甜味，不习惯的可以考虑点其他的。

(Translated by Google) Love the food here, the owner and the proprietress are very good, the restaurant is clean and tidy!

(Original)
喜欢这里的食物，老板和老板娘非常好，餐馆干净整洁!

(Translated by Google) Fine Chinese food!

(Original)
Finom kínai ételek!

Ordered for delivery the Gam Heong Bee Tai Mak with prawns spicy and fried rice with pork chop.

The pork chop was not too well marinated and tough .

The bee Tai Mak was awesome and among the most tasty and filled with wok hei, definitely a must order !!!

Prawn paste chicken wings was well seasoned  was fried till crispy.

Ordered Pork Chop fried rice with fish roe. Fried rice is good. Its taste like zichar style and seems similar to King of Fried Rice. Wasn't expecting the server to hand me a tissue but it's a really nice service.

Overall a disappointment. Though the fried rice was fragrance but the rice were way too meshy, probably an off day for them but I can only rate what was served.

I also decided to add a squid cutlet to the fried rice instead of the usual chicken/pork cutlet but it was pathetically bite size yet cost much more than if ordering the chicken/pork cutlet fried rice combo.

2nd visit:
A much improvement over the 1st visit, maybe cos I have it on site this time. Also only after the meal then I realised they actually have an indoor dining area which is hard to notice cos the kitchen is right in the middle between the indoor and outdoor seating.
Fried rice was oily and awesome. Exactly how a fried rice dish should taste like. The wok hey and the fragrance makes it so delicious!

I've ordered from friedrice.sg 17 times using FoodPanda and direct from the restaurant. It's been great every time. My go-to is the kam heong/gam hiong prawn fried rice with a ngoh hiong on the side. For my last order I also got some kong ba pau & they were amazing. 100% recommended!

Blown away by the smell of the fried rice when i opened the box, it smells so nice.

Taste is just as good as other famous fried rice places.

A pity this place is not as famous, will come back again to try the other menu.

Ordered gam hiong prawn fried rice ($8.90), using the advance order. The whole process was very smooth, and I got my order on time, and my fried rice was still piping hot. Generous portion of fried rice, and I counted more than 6 prawns (amaziiinggg), and wok hei was there! 👍🏻

Very very very good fried rice, chilli and pork 😋 Novena is quite far for me but I will come back just for this!

*Shoutout to Shinjin for recommending this

Was in the area at abt 2.30pm and read the good google reviews. Hence decided to try out as the place was empty too.

Ordered the $5.50 egg fried rice and pandan leaf chicken. Cashier mistakenly keyed as pork chop fried rice. Nvm I just go along to see if the higher price of $8.50 is worth it.

Verdict: Overrated & overpriced food for total damage of $10

Pork chop was really tough, not crispy at all and taste bland.

Fried rice got nice 'wok hei' yet was bland as well. Normal coffeeshop tze char's fried rice taste better at lower price.

Saving grace was the pandan leaf chicken which was not bad. But it was a extremely tiny piece which didn't justify the $1.50 price.

Furthermore, even if u dine-in, the food is served in paper boxes and disposable cutleries are used. Might as well do take-away only.
Good plate of fried rice. Just abit wet but the rice has strong wok hei. Pricing is very good. Love the chicken cutlet. Overall will be back!

Ordered egg fried rice and chicken cutlet fried rice. The rice is fragrant and tasty. Chicken cutlet is crispy but not much of flavour. What surprises us was the signature 'kong ba pau' which turns out to be good.
Fantastic! We loved the gam hiong fried mee tai bak, fried xo seafood rice, pork chop rice and fried chicken wings. Yummy!! Loved the wok hei and the sambal on the side.

Nice fried rice, not too oily and won't feel jelak.
Ordered pork chop fried rice delivery and it was packed separately from the rice.

Bought C10 Tomato & egg fried rice at $6.90, after paying I realized I should have ordered the Egg fried rice at $5 and add tomato $1. Felt a little rip off haha. Tasty fried rice with lots of eggs and not so salty which I like. But towards the end the rice was soaked with yellow oil which was kinda off. Maybe when I'm around Novena again I will order it with less oil request.
I thought it had some decent wok hei. Nothing special but a bit better than the wok hay around the corner.

I had the Italian herb chicken fried rice and it was very tasty! Rice was very flavourful on its own and luckily the cashier lady told me to have less chili for this. Totally agreed with her after tasting the rice. Chicken was tender and not dry. Other half had the smoked duck fried rice which tasted better with the chili but still good. Definitely would return again to try other dishes.
Very good fried rice! Fav - Gam Hiong Prawn Fried Rice $8.90

Chicken cutlet fried rice: Serving was generous, especially that of the chicken cutlet! Asked for less oil less salt to the fried rice and still found it flavourful. The chicken cutlet was really fried upon order so they came piping hot, which was great, but if they let the oil drain for a while longer I wouldn't have felt it too oily for my liking. I found that the rice used was more fluffy and moist than what I remembered of King of Fried Rice, so that's a plus.
Loved the rice. Decently priced. Dishes fitting of the term "wok hei". Top up $2 for a drink and a side. Not bad.

My gf had Gam Hiong Fried Rice and she felt it's 5 stars for the flavor, I had Venison Fried Rice and it would be 5 if not for the slightly overpowering ginger taste... Pork chop was well tenderised but not enough to wow in terms of taste, still need to work on the marinating sauce combo... Overall above average and will be back!

Ordered the chicken cutlet fried rice with sambal. Very delicious and serving was generous. Fried rice was well done, not too oily while the chicken cutlet has just the right amount of crisp to it! Will definitely come again for more!

Full review of my takeaway dinner from this quaint little store.

Pork Cutlet Fried Rice $7.90.
Super generous portion, fried rice is super fragrant, pork cutlet is large and flavorful. Good amount of eggs and abit of veges too..
Score: 8/10 for me.

Mushroom and Edamame Fried Rice $7.90.
Again, generous portion of fried rice. I was extremely surprised by the amount of vegetables, compared to the pork cutlet fried rice, the box is filled up by 20% more just by vegetables. Mushrooms had good chew and flavor, Edamame was cooked just right, and added good crunch to the rice itself.
Score: 10/10.

Ngoh Hiang $2.30:
Tastes homemade, flavor is good, not overly salty skin and meat, very good as a side.
Score: 7/10

Squid Roll $2.30:
Another surprise, the texture of the squid meat and the seasoning is spot on. No fishiness, and surprisingly super tasty.
Score: 9/10

I am most definitely coming back to try more menu items. Overall, amazing value for money and taste for something so simple.

Had the pork cutlet fried rice, squid rolls and Pandan chicken. Everything was cooked to perfection, while the fried rice was fragrant and freshly cooked. The secret however, is their sambal. Tinges of lime mixed into the sambal did the trick, and I’ll be asking for an extra helping next time!
Staff were really friendly, and the location right by the bus stop on the ground floor really helps.
Looks like I’ve found the go-to place for lunch/dinner. Prices were absolutely a bargain for the quality of food on offer. Will be back soon!
Ordered chicken cutlet and pork chop fried rice. Too salty for our taste. Generous portions of meat but overall the taste becomes too much. I hope to try again with more subtle flavours

Ordered Gam Hiong Prawn Fried Rice via grab to Thomson medical centre yesterday.
Top with prawn paste chicken.
Both dishes were very fragrant and tasty!
Oh the chilli was awesome too. Surprisingly came with a coke.

Choose to try this because of the awesome review and replies from you guys. No regrets! Keep it up!

Side note, if the drink is part of the meal, can explore giving option to choose between a few drinks?
Generous portions and chicken cutlet that was not overly oily. Sambal has kick.
Found this place in a corner when I was looking around trying to get a quick bite. Service was fast and tasted better than I expected. Price was also reasonable. Will come again for sure.

The pork chop is hard... Not soft and tender as the king of fried rice..

The only flavorful is the rice has strong smoky charcoal taste.

Overall, I rather go for king.

Great food and service! The man (perhaps the owner) was very helpful and provided tissues when we were done.

Will certainly recommend

Very slow service. Ordered at 12.30pm and got order by 1.10pm! Waited so long took my whole lunch hours.

Update: the food is quite nice and tasty! Generous servings. Only the cooking time can be improved. 👍🏼
we had italian herb chicken fried rice and tomato and egg fried rice, large portions, tasty and value for money.
Enjoyed a late dinner with Smoked Duck Fried Rice and Gam Hiong Prawn Fried Rice. Generous portion and definitely value for money.
I tried the herbal fried rice and recommended kouro pau, I love it and also dapao for my family. Will revisit the shop when I am nearby Novena.
New kid on the block, with fried rice that packs a punch
They took more than 40 minutes to serve my order. How could you let someone who is dining in wait for more than 40 minutes? I lost my appetite.
Had Italian herb chicken fried rice. Best I have had so far!
Just try the italian herb fried rice is really very good
Almost perfectly done chicken cutlet in generous proportions!
Love the gam heong fried rice!
Super yummy fried rice ,must try 😋.
Great fried rice!!!!! I like
No point ordering. Tried for one hour to get my delivery. No support, nothing. Very sad as we used to like this place. Sad.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: This was quite an unusual experience. Yunnan cuisine. Not sure if it’s authentic but it’s different from usual. I had the minced meat and salted veg soupy noodles plus set meal. Minced meat reminded me of zhajiang mian minced meat. Bowl was huge but mostly just soup. Soup was mild to medium spicy. But had the salted vegetable taste. Not bad. Egg was kind of hard and dry. I guess it’s their style. Different from the Japanese style. Dessert was a bit like ice jelly without ice. Not too sweet.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Came during the lunch rush hours… the servers are very attentive to the customers… ensuring that the waiting queue gets updated on the seating arrangements… orders are taken prior to sitting to save time… my favourite dish though was the pumpkin cake… will have to come try the other dishes…

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
You can customise your bowl here . Option of thick bee Hoon noodle,  flat noodles , glass noodles etc

Soup variety pork bone , spicy yunnan pickled cabbage  , tomato 🍅 and another pepper version .

I got the yunnan pickled cabbage , it’s tangy , sour and very appetising .

You get to select the ingredients you want to add such as vege , meats, fish ball etc

Giving 5 star due to the customer service crew, food will be 4 star.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Not sure if this is authentic yunnan rice noodles. But it sure taste good for me. The soup base is full of flavor, noodles texture are just right. And the rest of the add on ingredients are fresh and good.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
My colleagues and i decided to try this. I ordered a bowl of customised tomatoes soup w pork ribs, beef ball, luncheon meat, quail eggs, tofu skin. The soup was diluted. Pork ribs were mini and tough, did not find my luncheon meat, miserable piece of tofu skin.
My colleague's chicken is as miserable. Its like mini chicken carcass with some meat. My meal cost me $17 and definitely not value for money nor satisfying. It will be our first and last time ordering.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
We had a few tries in this Restaurant over the past 3 years. I would say the settings and food was much better prior to the pandemic period.
The restaurant went tasteless and dirty post second lockdown. But since the recent reviews aren’t bad we decide to give it another try.
It is not too bad actually, and I appreciate the free choice of none spicy at all. But add-ons is to be avoided: we paid $2.5 for dried braised beef and get literally 2 slices of 3*3cm sheer sheet. I’m being specific beer as it is a nonsense money value proportion compare to their own dishes. And not mentioning how big portion you could get from other Chinese restaurants.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Tried a few items on their menu like their signature rice noodle, their braised chicken rice and their lu rou fan. They are really good. Really liked the pumpkin dessert as well it is really addictive. Opens early at 10am and service is really fast. Will definitely try again if possible.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Very JENG yixia worr... I very likey the signature pork rib soup. $12.90 for standard product which come with 12 ingredients... Very FRESH too the seafood 🐟🐟🐟🦐🦐🦐

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Wanted a drink while waiting for my appointment. Order soy milk but no more. Waitress is nice, she give suggestions recommending 八宝茶which is not in the menu. Taste great.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Comfy food during raining day.. I ordered the original and the soup broth is clear and nice. Doesn’t taste much MSG.. ordered a set come with a drink, an egg and a dessert. The prawn is fresh, shelf removed for you and left the head and tail. Give it a try!

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Had the braised intestine vermicelli 红烧肥肠米, the intestine was soft and well braised, no funky smell or whatsoever, vermicelli was soft and silky unlike our local thick bee hoon. Soup might look spicy but it's not, the colour was from the braising sauce of the intestine.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: I am not sure if the cook is having an off day but this was what came to me. It looked like the left overs of a meal. I was pretty disappointed. The soup was diluted, and the ingredients were so stingy. I asked for two portions of corn and got about 15 kernels. Would not come again.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Prices are low and portions are big.
Taste is decent but nothing to shout about. Soups were abit diluted, partner's mixian was cooked to mushiness, but mine was fine.
Ice jelly was a let-down, tasted just like regular jelly. Probably will not return.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Nice Yun nan noodle place in Singapore. So unique and tasty.

I had the sour and spicy soup, which was good and compatible with most of the ingredients. The soup taste was just alright, not too spicy, not salty.

Just a little feedback:

The noodle was too slight, probably it was soaked in the soup for some time before serving to me.

The fish slices and some ingredients were with bones. Suggested to substitute with boneless meat.

Other than that, all were perfect. Interesting interior design and attentive service too. Portion looked big but just alright for me.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: If you would like try a different kind of normal noodle in singapore, you might want to try this noodle from yunnan. The biggest bowl of noodle soup i ever see with plenty of soup to satisfy anyone.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Over the bridge noodles are served here. Drinks include Roselle tea. And dessert is a chilled fruit jelly.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Convenient place to walk from the MRT. Ordered the signature rice noodle. I like the lightness of the broth. You can tweak the spicy level by adding their in-house chili sauce. Overall unique Chinese food, which you don’t find in other places in Singapore.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Second visit and looking forward to a third! The service here is always excellent. I cannot vouch for their noodles but the set promo ($9.90 includes chicken, veggies, rice and a drink) is super tasty especially their house special mala chicken in a pot. Enjoy it with a hearty dollop of their homemade chilli paste/oil and the rest of your day will feel simply perfect!

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: The signature rice noodles was freaking weird to me. Pork rib, prawn, Shao Rou, stewed chicken, fish... A failed exploration

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Friendly staff and delicious soup (it’s the diluted kind but it’s kind of just right for us). The pork were majority fats though. I love that we can DIY our own soup base, noodles, and ingredients. Will probably do that the next time we’re back.

We ordered signature rice noodles soup (with Spicy Pickled Cabbage Soup) and Fried Pork Rice Noodle (Tomato Soup).

8th May 2021
Fang Ting and Wei Liang (lunch)

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: My husband and I have been hunting for an authentic Yunan crossing bridge noodles in Singapore since we tasted the original ones during our visit to Yunan. Nothing has come close till we visited this place. The noodles and soup are good but the best are still those in Kunming.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Second time visit this restaurant. Love the noodles and warm hearty soup. The ingredients are fresh and the portion is big. Worth the price. Would definitely come back again.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
The cutleries are beautifully decorated, food is presented pretty before you mix the food together, the wooden furniture and decor gives a nice feeling.

Service was prompt and I noted they have chairs available for children.

Food is mediocre to my personal taste. The overall taste is light. While the noodle is springy and nice, the broth and the rest of the ingredients doesn’t seem to come together well.
