And the dish has abundant of soup compared to the contents (the vegetables floated while the rest of the ingredients drowned underneath) so a bit of stirring and searching may be needed to find the part you want to bite. The vegetables also look more like garnishes except for the bean sprouts (eg. Coriander, chives, spring onion, flower petals).

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Mixed bowl noodles, is taste-less and not the mushroom cut until so thin slice. A bowl of the noodles with 2 bird egg, 2 slice of fish 2 pieces of prawn.... etc and drinks add up to be about $17. Which is not worth the money.
The staff there rejected rudely from counter shout to the table "sorry, cannot" As they don't allow outside food although she have family members eating inside.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: I had the fried pork Noodle. The broth was delicious and there was a good amount ingredients in the dish. However, there were parts of the noodles which were clumped together and was undercooked and inedible. The fried pork that came with the dish although was cooked and tasted good, had slices which were just the fats.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
I am not a big fan of Chinese food but I have to say, this is one of the most satisfying lunch I hand for a very long time.

I wanted noodles with lots of vegetable options. When I look through the menu, the tofu noodles catches my attention and  so I place the order with the plum drink and the black fungus starter.

Never I expect to be surprised by the balance taste of the noodles. It was really really good. I never thought I could finish such a big bowl considering the size of it.

The starter is another pleasant surprise, so crunchy and I love every bite of it.

I will definitely be back for more....

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Interesting Yunnan style eaterly. Nice presentation, and taste delicious.  Except serving for dessert a bit small. Anyway, the Cross-bridge rice noodles reminded me of my Yunnan trip many years ago.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Agree with the comments that the broth was bland, especially the tomato one that I had. A tip: there’s house Chili on every table and putting that into the soup can elevate the taste! Otherwise price and service was decent.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Super delicious noodles! Authentic taste with lots of options... My friends had the signature rice noodles and I had the pudding rice noodles - both were extremely good...will definitely be back soon :)
Service was also very warm and friendly.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Big portion for the price. Value for money. Drink is nice also. Would come back again

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Me and husband like this place a lot
Generous portion of tasty pork bone soup- prob twice the size of a normal bowl of ramen - more then enough soup for 2 adults
Can customise carbo with toppings
Reasonable pricing
Every bowl is freshly prepared and consistency is there each time!
Will recommend esp if u have a friend or partner! Otherwise 1 bowl might appear daunting haha

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Big bowl of soup and noodles as expected from yun nan 过桥米线，it has its own twist which is the chrysanthemum. And do beware because it has a layer of oil it keeps the soup hot so when its first served to you, blow to allow it to cool down first before you sip it.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: The only disappointment is that the soup is not hot enough after we poured everything into it and it's at the temperature of tongue. Chilli oil can be much better and sesame oil should be provided too. My 2 cents.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: I always go for their Yun nan mi xian (glass noodle soup in a giant bowl). I’ve also tried their minced pork rice set. Tasty meal, very reasonably priced.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Decent place for yunnan 过桥米线. Customised my own with pork broth, rice noodles, 4 vegetables and one meat for $7.20. The broth was really good but I felt the rice noodles could have been better and the portion of the ingredients could have been more generous. Service was prompt and there was just enough seats to hold the lunch crowd.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Very big bowl. Reasonable priced.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: The portion is huge!! Signature noodle is not bad. Didn’t get to try others. Interior deco is interesting. Service is good.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: The rice noodle set is presented nicely, but taste was ok only, nothing extraordinary. Price is expensive if there is no 1-for-1 promo. Sour and spicy noodle is much better and half the price of the rice noodle set.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Nice and affordable breakfast and lunch place!!! You are also able to customize your noodles (though I felt like trying their rice instead). Will be back to try their cross-bridge noodles 😁

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Yummy authentic food!! Their mala tang was so aromatic. House chili adds great flavour to the non-spicy pork broth option. Ingredients are a bit pricey for some items (e.g. chives and beansprouts) but since those are obviously not worth it, I did not add to my DIY bowl. Other than that, portion size is big! About 4 pieces of meat for each kind of meat that you pick.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Is from Yunnan? No, I don’t think so! Totally different with Yunnan Ricenoodle. But as a food yes can eat, at least is hot. What I need mention is oil Chili source, very traditional Yunnan style.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: 6.8SD for such a big bowel of rice noodle! Plus quite tasty ! Can’t believe it’s so cheap ( In singapore)

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Great location, easily access through public transit. Food is delicious and portion is big, esp given the price u have to pay. Highly recommended!

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Very soothing for stomach and price is reasonable.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content:
Good authentic yunan food.
Great price.
Good environment and lovely staff as in lady boss and kitchen staff.
Good location.
Located 5 mins away walking distance from novena mrt

A must visit for local Singaporeans and also a must visit for tourists transiting Singapore or visiting Singapore as tourists.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Decent food decent price! Great Beancurd noodles.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: I find the soup not enough taste. Too much water diluted the taste.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Love the freedom to choose different vegetables or meats items with selected soup and noodles.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: Noodle soup was good. The noodles is probably the highlight here. Unique texture - soft and slightly chewy..you can taste the separate strands.  I ordered the chicken noodle soup but requested a hot version which was available. The chicken pieces could be chopped more cleanly as I found bone fragments. The eatery is offering a free drink which each noodle soup ordered. Service was fast. No GST, service charge. Good service. Will try the noodle item which comes with 12 side dishes in future. Another favourite is the hot and sour glass noodles. Fave app offers a 10% discount on your next visit.

restaurant name: 唐大小姐过桥米线Mademoiselle Tang Noodle
content: They used to have very good broth of pork ribs, even the original-flavoured mixian was tasty. But now, the original broth just gives a taste of salt.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Five stars for the service. I think the food was above average. Plenty of parking at basement, so if you're driving to this restaurant there's parking at the restaurant. I love the panfried oyster cake! crunchy on one side - but need to wait about 25 minutes for this to be serve.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Nice ambience for a chinese Teochew restaurant. The braised duck is my favourite. Ordered the Chinese New Year braised sea cucumber, mushroom dish which is good. And of course, the steamed lobster is fresh and so good. Will come again just for the braised duck.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Service was far better than Jumbo. Quality of food very tasty n fresh.. Really a hidden gem in a Teochew club. Zui Teochew Cuisine should be very good too. All super yummy food.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
I went on a Sat and got seated at 1730hrs as it was fully book for the later seating. As we ordered quite a lot for 4 pax, we left at around 2045hrs. In between we still add dishes and that's why it took longer for us to finish it. There were very professional and only tell us that they needed the table back during dessert time.

Their food still taste the same as olden times so there is nothing to rave about. It's still as good as ever. If you have foreign guests can bring them there as it's quite traditional but yet classy due to the decorations. Its one of the more expensive place in town.

Ordered: ($370)
- mixed platter
- pomfret (700g)
- drunken chicken
- pork ribs (4 pieces, must order individually)
- fried kway teow
- french bean
- 4 individual desserts
- pot of tea

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Came to this place to try traditional teochew food and was pleasantly surprised!

Food. The standard must order dishes like the ngoh Hiang, braised duck with tofu and orh nee were good and on point. The other dishes like the drunken prawns, trio egg vegetables , I'd probably not want to order them again. Furthermore these aren't traditional teochew dishes.

Service. It's very hard to catch hold of the staff as there were so many people. My advise is to order all your dishes at one go.

Additionally, you might want to make a reservation instead of coming to queue. Very packed for a Friday night.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
I generally liked the food here. The appetizer plate was well executed and they were still hot when served.

The Compoy with braised vegetables and steamed threadfin also left a lasting impression. Really liked the umami from the Compoy dish since most of the ingredients were naturally high in umami.

I think one very strong area for improvement is their service and attention to customers, which is the reason why I didn't rate them 5 stars. When ordering, we informed that one of our dining party was still on the way and requested for the food to be served later. 5 mins before she reached, we informed one of the staff to serve the dishes, but half an hour later, nothing was served. When we checked in with another staff, he had the cheek to tell me that we had requested for the food to be on hold even though our party had been there for a good half hour.

We also placed an order for the threadfin subsequently. However, 40 mins later, this was still not served and we had to check with the staff on the status. Because of these delays, we had to spend close to an additional hour at the restaurant. The service aspect really has room for improvement and to caveat, I'm not expecting service standards at a Michelin star restaurant.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Came here with my family, was here many years ago but decided to bring my family to try the Teochew cuisine. We ordered those dish with great reviews and recommended by other reviewers. I must they they don’t disappoint, all the food we ordered were really good. Specially the braised duck, slices so thin it almost melts in the mouth. Don’t be deceive by the Ngoh Hiang, it looks normal, but just wait till you bite into it, makes you wanted more. The fish is really fresh and cook just nice. The vegetables is ok as I am not a fan. The Oyster omelette is really worth the wait, I was wondering why it took so long, it need skills to cook a simple dish to taste so good. Finally my all time favorite, Orh Nee, I have love it since young and none is better than this. Will come back for more in the near future. Highly recommended.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Attended a dinner function here and I must say the food standard was really good. It's located in a pretty secluded location and I have never noticed it existed until I was invited to this dinner function. There Chinese design building architecture was unique in that locality and it can be mistook as an exclusive member only premise. However, it's also a Teochew restaurant open to the public. They serve dishes like Buddha jump over the wall, king prawn with broccoli, braised abalones with shiitake mushroom and spinach, signature Yam paste with gingko nuts and etc... My favor was the yam paste, sweet and flavorful. While the building look small, it's has ample parking spaces in their basement down to B3. Parking charges was also inexpensive. Go discover the great food within this quiet location.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
One of my best Teochew cuisine in Sg. (I’m a Teochew 😅) The roast piglet is pricy, but it’s so worth it.
Other than roast pork, the authentic fried kailan kway Teow and Yam Paste are not to be missed! We called it 古早味。实至名归。
Pricy, but if you willing to part $$, a meal to you will not forget.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Excellent Teochew cruisine, arguably the best in sg.  Tried a variety of their signature dishes and the sea cucumber, crispy on the outside and soft inside really stands out.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: After waiting for over 2 years due to Covid-19 to dine-in, the dishes are delicious, service is superb as always.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Lovely food and good service. The lobster is very fresh and it is paired well with the sauce.

Promfet fish is fresh and we'll steamed (firm meat). The teochew style steam I think it's slightly too sour with the salted plums.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Old school traditional teochew cuisine. Pricey but I think the quality of ingredients and mastery in the cooking makes it worth.

Good to come as a family to celebrate special occasions. Please get the fried sea cucumber and fried pork rib you will not regret it!

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: The dishes were excellent - the cold crab, braised duck with bean curd (which was boneless), conpoy braised with eight vegetarian treasures, and yam paste with pumpkin and gingko nuts (seems to use pandan syrup instead of lard). The oyster omelette was good.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Must order - oyster omelette, fried sea cucumber, cold crab and duck! We enjoyed the meal, would go back again

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Tried their 4 pax set meal around $350++ plus their famous duck and fried oyster. Overall I like their garlic lobster and spinach with abalone. Their CNY Yusheng also quite special, unlike the conventional one.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Food is okay but service is average (maybe business is too good). The restaurant missed my reservation. I learned upon arrival (I have called in 3 weeks before). They then made arrangement for empty hall area at level 2 for lunch.

During this point of time the max number is 5 pax allowed per table and amazingly their set lunch menu only have 4 or 6 pax (maybe they dont care or can't be bothered).

I feel there are better choices out there and will skip this place for lunch next time.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: My fav teochew restaurant at all times! Still good quality and service top notch! High price though but worth it!

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Food was pretty good but some dishes were pretty expensive.

A portion of chives + scallops was $60+

Tot the best dish was the cai Po Hor Fun

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Thank you B1 personal staff to attend to my dad’s guests this evening. Your service is excellent! Even though we had numerous requests, you did not falter and accommodated to our requests; even taking initiative to cut the cake after the celebration. Thanks for being part of this good memory of my dad’s 70th birthday. Sorry I did not manage to get your name. Kudos to all the staff who were helping in one way or another, even though the place was full, you all were polite and approachable. Food was great, everyone loved it. Even the vegetarian food was done very well. Thank you!

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Excellent restaurant! Both the ambience and the food were great. The suckling pig is the star of the show! Very crispy and delicious skin. It will definitely be a dish to order. The braised duck was juicy and succulent as well. The rest of the dishes were really of high quality taste.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Three words:Taste, freshness, quality. Service is attentive as well

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Authentic teochew dishes. Refined dishes. Worth a visit.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Difficult to get to, food quality is good, the place is trying to cram too many tables in resulting in super narrow walking spaces which is a hazard for kids and adults. Kids tend to walk around table to different adults but it's too dangerous for a proper family meal. Also witnessed an elderly being knocked flat on the ground with her shoe coming off a distance from her. Not sure what happened but sure looks painful next to the metal trolley in the small narrow pathway. Service staff moving too fast, rushing us to eat fast and clearing the plates before more companions come. Food came very fast though. My family enjoyed the braised beancurd and salted egg prawn.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Great food. Very polite and attentive wait staff even when it's full house. Must try their orh-nee (yam paste dessert), braised duck with tofu and ngoh hiang (superb on its own or with the plum sauce). I don't usually fancy fish dishes but theirs is so fresh! Highly recommended.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Very authentic food, taste is really good, among the best Chinese food I had in Singapore. For someone who is tired of crowd & popular business place, long queue, noisy environment, restaurant chain with same taste everywhere you go, this is a perfect option. Away from main business, a quiet & peace hidden gem near Newton MRT & Newton food center.

Very nice atmosphere with friendly service, provided separate wipes for cleaning utensils and hands, also provided welcome tea before the meal & Ginseng Oolong tea after meal to clean the taste from mouth.

Meat is well cooked and tasty, vegetable is fresh; fried rice is really large portion that allows 4 people to share. Tea is nice too, good quality Chinese tea with extremely good value, $3 for a whole pot. Waitress is very helpful in providing suggestions, service is always on time.

I would definitely recommend this place, and will come back again.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: We went to the restaurant with Jumbo’s birthday voucher (200-100). The dishes are delicious and the portions are quite generous. I think it’s a good place for family gatherings.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Had my birthday dinner here, Nothing to complain about
Quality of food is top notch, chef’s culinary skills is undoubtedly good
Service is super fast and pretty good, I mean like really fast.
Price is very competitive for the quality and environment, as proven by the full seating.
had the broiled chicken, stir fried mee sua, braised duck, lobster porridge (whole lobster), vege, salted egg yolk prawn with tea- only 55pp after tax

Will definitely come back again!

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
We had a delectable meal in this Teochew restaurant. The service was excellent too, attentive and prompt despite it being so crowded. The cold crab was my favorite. I love the freshness, plus the meat was thick and firm. Yummy indeed.

A delightful place to spend your Friday evening.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Although the food is good, the service is subpar. I had a reservation for 5:30 and was informed that dinner would last 1.5 hours. After our first dish was served, it took them 40 minutes to serve the subsequent dishes. One of our dish, the steamed fish, apparently lost in the ocean. We finish our dinner by 7 o'clock even though the fish dish is making its way from the ocean.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Teochew cuisine and service were fantastic. Thanks to Liu Lei who was serving us. The roasted suckling pig exceeded my expectations. Other dishes were good too.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Great service from Alfred Chia.  Personalised, professional and yet makes one feel so at home.  Dishes are still great standard (like before Covid).  If not for a bad customer experience with Veronica who ignored my help when I left something behind at dinner, I would have rated this restaurant 5*.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: This place serves very authentic Teochew dishes. Many of the dishes you don’t get to taste elsewhere! Brought my Teochew parent and they totally fell in love with the food here and walked out really happy!

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: V teochew clan establishment with many familiar dishes

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Food is good but expensive, and servings are small, even for medium order. Don't ever order the Cuttlefish sauteed with XO sauce. $24 for a small serving. The cuttlefish can hardly be found, as there are few thin and small pieces, overwhelmed by the onion and bell pepper. Kailan stir-fried with dried sole fish is $24 for a small serving. Service is poor, as most of the staff are badly trained. I didn't feel satisfied.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: I won't say there is any ambience...this is a traditional large spaced restaurant. However, they make it up with pretty quality for the food they serve-food not that cheap. A bit hard to find for first timers, so WAZE up. Parking not cheap-I paid $8 for my lunch hours. I would bring the older folks for that touch of the old days

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Very nice clean restaurant for meals with friends during this covid period. Driving there will be preferred as you will need to walk of you want to take public transportation. If you like teochew dishes then it's a recommended place for it.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Quite a nice place to bring my old folks here. Good restaurants and good wedding halls

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Very nice Teochew dishes! Portion is not very big. Prompt service and staff were helpful. We were given a private room and all utensils are available for us to self help. But the entrance of the restaurant can be confusing. Overall experience is not bad. Total damage for all dishes = $700+ as we ordered roasted pig. The lobster dish is not worth I feel as it was full of garlic. The rest of the dishes are good.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: It was a horrendous first dining experience at this notably renowned venue for Teochew cuisine. Regrettably I should have known from the deteriorating quality mentioned in earlier Google reviews. From the start, we had made a reservation via phone call for 9 persons, but we were shown to a table for 8 persons (7+1) When we questioned about that, the lady serving us had no answer and basically just replied that it’s okay they would add one more seat to a smaller looking table.  It was strange but I thought nothing of it until almost towards the end of the meal when we were again asked whether they could serve mixed fruits platter. That was when it hit me that they had mixed us up with another bunch of guests. Despite repeated complaints, none of the staff looked sincerely apologetic and merely was in a rush to turn over the table for the second round of diners. Apart from that, the quality of food served tonight was not outstanding, and service was rushed and nobody bothered changing plates or pouring tea till we asked for it. The pomfret appeared to be not cooked well, there was redness and toughness in some part of the meat. It is definitely not a place worth the premium paid for food, service, decoration or anything at all. Atmosphere wise, the place was noisy and warm with spot lights all over and little aircon. It was supposed to be a nice welcoming dinner for our guests but tonight it was nothing short of a disaster with the premium paid for dinner; total damage (bill) being more than 500 dollars. Consider seriously, if you really want to come to dine (unless you really have the cash to spare or prefer to take photos of the food presentation). Note: there was no service recovery done at all.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
I happened to choose Fathers' Day to have dinner there with an old friend so there were two seatings for reservation: 5.30pm or 8pm. I booked for 8pm. We (group of six) were seated in a hall at L2. There weren't many people though i heard the restaurant at L1 was full.
The food was delicious. We had braised duck with beancurd (卤鸭拼豆干)，deep-fried ngoh hiang (五香枣)， Teochew steamed pomfrey (潮蒸鲳鱼), Teochew Puning fermented-bean chicken (普宁豆酱走地鸡)，wok-fried mee pok with braised duck with X.O. sauce (X.O.酱卤鸭面薄) and yam paste desserts (with hashima / slice of pumpkin). Two persons complemented their meal with a bowl of rice.

As my children were allergic to prawns, the waiter quickly came back to us when he found out the ngoh hiang contained prawn (he thought it only had pork).
My fav was the fish, and my friend (who hadn't been there for  quite a while) particularly liked the fried mee pok (i thought it was unusual too cos it's usu fried mee). The ngoh hiang was crispy and fragrant The yam paste was good (smooth, not cloyingly sweet or oily). Staff were helpful.

All in all, it was a pleasant meal.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Food is decent but on the pricey side. Paid $200+ for 4 pax. Ordered 3 main dishes, 1 noodle dish and 1 dimsum appetizer.

Service is average. Asked for a nicer table during reservation as it was a special occasion, but the restaurant didn’t make any effort here. They even sat us super near the kitchen.

Paid $3.50 for single entry parking.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Decent food; but a little pricey for the seafood. Like the Fried oyster, braised duck with tofu (tofu is really tasty), sea cucumber and cold crab. However, the server is a little pushy on the order - keep telling you to order the lobsters, goose, some special fish etc. Be wary, a single order of lobster can be 300++ after 50% discount, crab is about a 100 etc

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Really awesome Teochew food but not the easiest place to get to by public transport. You probably need to drive there but it's worth it. Atmosphere is good and food is even better, especially their braised duck

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
A relaxing place for chinese food., Dishes are beautifully balance in taste. Refreshing pickles/fermented
plum n salty vegetables in steam fish/ chicken, a grade above. But expect to spend a bit above the average resturant prices

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content:
Nov 2020. Another birthday celebration leveraging on JUMBO's J$. Teochew cuisine had always been one of my favourite Chinese culinary dominations. Ordered Pomfret, Tofu in Crab meat, Pig Trotter Terrine etc.
The staff were cold though.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: The food was excellent! Impressively done by the chef, and as far as Chinese food goes, especially during crowded festive season, they sure maintain a high standard.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Delicious food. Asparagus is a must order. Fried meesuah is superb! Braised duck, especially the sauce, was yummy with rice. Braised tofu was fresh and tasty. Abalone recommended. Ngoh hiang the five spice taste is too strong, so only order if you like it strong. Pomfret fish is very fresh but tastes bland. Cai po fried kway teow was overcooked, too bitter as it was cooked beyond the wok hey stage. Oyster omelette was good. Appetiser tea was great. Salted egg prawns were brilliant and a must order too. Would come back again to try other dishes.

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Great place to bring parents & families who love good quality chinese food. The place is known for their "orh lua" and cold crab 👍 If you're into desserts, try out the bird nest served in almond & coconut (pretty interesting and palatable!). Overall great service, highly recommended ☺️

restaurant name: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine 醉花林品潮轩
content: Nice place having lunch with business partner.

From review, this restaurant seems good so here we are to try.

Indeed the food is good and not crowded too:)

A lot of variety towards the food:)

Most importantly, a good chance to chit chat with family:)

I was there with my family for the dinner ala carte buffet. The variety of dishes though not considered extensive, was pretty ok as the dishes were Chinese tzi char type and you won't aim to eat every single one 😅

I like it that the serving size is small, but just enough for the number of diners indicated. This allows us to order a particular dish again if we really like it and not to forcefully finish everything if it doesn't suit our taste buds. It also allows us to try out more of their dishes too without getting full just eating a couple.

There were a couple of dishes that I particularly like...eg fried hot fun and the fried fish. The rest were just very average and some coffee shop tzi char stalls have better to offer.

Service wise was slow, except for the first round of one time order dishes, the rest took a long time to be served and certain dishes were never served despite us having to keep checking with the serving staff. Most of the staff were friendly and responsive, with the exception of one who was pretty rude, and wasn't very willing to top up the tea or take any new orders, but was always busy walking around.

Though pricing wise, it may appear to be lower than many other restaurants serving buffets (note that tea and wet tissues are charged separately), overall I doubt I will be back in a long time as food is just average and nothing memorable.

This is our first visit, u need to be extremely patient when ordering ala carte buffet. Food portion was nice and small(i.e. 2 person gets 2 piece of prawn and so on) so no wastage. However U have to wait for like 1-1.5 hr for the food to be served. I don't know if it's a norm at this restaurant but seriously we were there from 11:30 til 2:30, some dishes we ordered st 12 noon just got served at 2:10 just now and we told them we are full and it got served too late so they took them back to the kitchen.
With the bill add up to about $190 for 4 adults I think next time we'll just go to Silk restaurant instead.

Definitely value for money type of place.
Food is not bad, average but most buffets are like this - you go for quantity and not quality.
Value - for less than $40, u get abalone, shark’s fins, steamed fish, fried fish, decent sized prawns and whole lots of other choices.
Service - great people. Very attentive and really wanting you to have a good time. Staff are very stressed as it was very busy that day that I was there, but they still tried their best to accommodate. Food serving is rather slow, probably due to the crowd.
My family had a great time. Thanks for hosting us today.

Food portion is small and cold. Waiting time for food is damn long. Food taste is horrible. Not worth to try. Overall, worst experience.  Even a plain roti prata taste better than all the dish served!!!

Compared to other Chinese restaurants (eg: Tunglok, Peach Garden), I would say this restaurant beats them all in terms of the quality of the food served and service provided. My whole family enjoyed our dinner buffet where we were impressed with most of the dishes and left with a full and happy stomach.😋

Had dinner buffet with my family last Saturday. Worst experience ever. Thought of giving this a try even though the reviews were not good. There's only around 7 tables for buffet and some tables I believe it's under the tour group tables (set meals mostly I observe) but the staff arrangements is so disorganized! The supervisor or is it manager I am not sure,keep giving instructions to the waitresses but this particular waitress probably new, keep serving the wrong dishes to the tables and she accidentally knocked over the hot tea at our table which thankfully didn't scalded my dad.After the first round of the 7 dishes(served one time only) second round onwards they just keep forgetting about us. Until I had to asked the manager /supervisor then they serve our dishes out. One of the kitchen server ( she's not in uniform but white t shirt) came out and saw our table is empty and said oh dear I will check for you with the kitchen.One of the fried dishes was cold when my folks bite on it,another dish was the long beans and was already very soggy("old veg" not my words,but the supervisor/manager's )  At $46.80++ the menu is not extensive and some of the dishes are not served even though we asked again. So tired of waiting and chasing after our food. The food is nothing to shout about and seriously is it because it is buffet so we shouldn't be requesting our food to be serve warm and cooked nicely?

There were in total at least 8 dishes including the dessert (Mango sago)
The food was tasty, though abit inclined towards salty side. Overall the food is delicious 😋😋😋

OMG!! Went at 6pm, the first batch of food served at around 1.5-2hrs later. After we went off around 9pm, 3 of us were not even 3 quarter full. Reached home & ate tibits some more. This is really too much!! Being a restaurant at hotel, the quantity & quality of food should not be like this. I thought that the chefs are really very busy cooking so by right, the food should be very hot when served, right? but surprisingly the food are cold??!! What happened? Some more the taste is not flavourful. In my perspective, I have got feeling that the restaurant direction is… you, customers come in, welcome you, being seated, my premise is big enough, you wait for your food to be served, I have plenty of time, but I’m not sure if you have the time, I will serve the food very slowly, if you cannot wait, please settle the payment & proceed to the door. As for the food, for instance, crispy fish skin, obviously it is purchased from outside & not prepared by the restaurant. When asked for another plates, they told you… no more Liao. To be frank lah, anyone wants to treat ne to the restaurant again, thank you and I will say NO! Can you imagine, went for buffet & yet, eat until no full. Si buay ke lian
Unable to choose portion size. Its a buffet but portion size is fixed by number of pax. Some of the food taste stale. Not worth the price and poor experience

Horrible service staffs.
After the 4th dish, there was an unexplained 1 hour interval. When the final 2 dishes and dessert arrived, the table was a mess. After I took some noodle, the service staff asked if they can clear the table then they just proceed.
The food was below average. Suckling was dried and hard.

The only thing acceptable was the red bean pan cake. Not too sweet.

Food is awesome. And service is fantastic. It's really good for family gathering or reunion with friends. Ambience is good. They have a karaoke system for a great time. Wide variety of food to choose from. We ordered fried mantou too. Thumbs up!!!

The food is very fresh especially the fish and prawn is good.
We find the taste is just nice, not salty or the msg.
Is good to give them support and help them to pull through tis tough time.

Will give 0 star if its possible.. see the review 5 stars so when ahead to try their ala carte buffet, but then to my horror, food taste horrible, food is all reheat, it was so hard to eat as in literally solid hard food that it is inconvenient for my parent (which is elderly) to eat.

Order their duck meat and worst, is was still raw,which then i told their manager, female waitress which wore a blazer. She just reply "Oh we cut out from the peking duck." and walk away, but so what? it is still raw!!!!  It was so bad that even if free i wouldnt go back.

If you are considering to bring your family or friend over, can just forget it. there are plenty more buffets or resturant are cheaper and taste way better then their. Dont get bluffed by the 5 stars review. who knows if it their own people

No photo provided as i wouldnt want to review but the more i think, i feel that this have to be reviewed

Went to this Happy joy restaurant yesterday night for the 2nd time with my family for the buffet alacarte. The food was nice and worth it for $39.80++ in hotel atmosphere. Restaurant was big and serving was good.There was an event held at happy joy restaurant therefore we need to wait for our 2rd round serving about 15-20mins.But it's OK,as we understand the crowds and nowadays traditional restaurant are only a few now and now things are very expensive and we are surprised that they never even increased their price.Keep it up Happy joy restaurant 😀

Went on 1st May.  Manager say chef is struggling to cook the food . Took approx every half hour to serve 1 dish at a time but the food came is cold and horrible. By the closing time cannot feel at least half full. Feel like been cheated. Blacklist big time.

Just had my buffet dinner yesterday with my family.The restaurant was full and the staff explained to us that the food will be slightly slow as there are walk in and events going on.My family decided to wait and surprisingly the staffs were also doing their best to speed up our food.Will definitely support them again with their coming set menu.
Foods nice n service good.

I was having dinner with friends at Happy Joy,and the food there was tremendous and we really had a sumptous meal.The Service was great and the waitress were helpful.Thanks for great meal there and keep up the good Service.Will catch up again soon.

We got the buffet. The food was cold and tough. Service was appalling-  first time seeing a manager who shout back at a customer. Staff only able to speak Mandarin.
My suggestion is to go somewhere else.

It's quite an old establishment. When we went there, there was some event going on and book the whole place and no restaurant reception so we found it strange and confusing since we also booked a table for family reunion dinner. After much trouble, they allocated us to rooms behind. Not a good start. Food was normal. Service was normal. Will I come again? Probably not.

Probably my first & last time eating @this restaurant. Had dinner last night, sad to say, the restaurant was unable to cope with the promotions. Observed some customers started to complain on food serve not hot, flow is slow and potion is miserable. Some even left without waiting for the 2nd round of order.😢
One of oldest Chinese restaurant in Singapore.  Foods are delicious and reasonably priced. Service staff are friendly and helpful too.

Miserable food, lousy taste, extremely small portion and poor service. Takes more than 20 mins on average to serve up a dish. This is preposterous that such quality is served. To be frank if I can choose to input zero star, I definitely would.

came on 18/3/2022. food took very long to be served. every plate that came, only had 5 pieces. in addition, food was extremely cold and below satisfactory. i am very disappointed. it would be only a 1 time visit for me.

Quite expensive compared previous years...they mixed those not fresh prawns with the fresh ones, can tell below photos show prawns not fresh and stale...the chicken not roasted not very tasty....the louhei so-so....quite waste of money....

Apparently Mr T**** L** likes to remove and delete comments from their facebook page. So i’ll write my reviews here. Had dinner for pax of 5 on 21st march 7pm.
our table rejected almost every food that was served to our table because it was cold. Even the fried food, when questioned the staff say "oh fry alrdy but maybe never serve so become cold" another said " fried food is already pre-fried beforehand. once theres an order the chefs will fry again thn serve. maybe chef forget to fry and just serve like that" another said,
“Aiya u know usually chef see alot of order they just want to clear fast maybe forget”

Paid additional for the peking duck. no issue on the skin but the remaining duck meat which was served seperately after was bad. it was cold. whats worse is BEFORE the staff could ask me whats wrong he saw the duck and said this "oh i know the duck was left there for quite sometime" i will go make hot for you.

We left soon after and didnt bother to finish the duck. What was suppose to be a birthday celebration didnt turn out to be a celebration at all.
Good food, good service. Value for money for chinese buffet.

My parents have been bringing me to this restaurant ever since i was a little boy and now i am 28 and they are still bringing me there. Their standard have not dropped once. I will highly recommend this restaurant

Came here for the Ala cart buffet.  1st round of food served but not all the ordered items arrived.  Waited very long for our food to be served.   Though the waitress and waiters were friendly but the  waiting time was really disappointing.  Will not come again.

Had a highly enjoyable dinner here. Fantastic value and freshness for an ala carte buffet. Dishes are all cooked upon order and are zichar classics.Dishes all come in tasting portions so you have a chance to order from the wide range of dishes. Highly recommended. No photos this time as was too busy eating. 😄

Talk about kicking it old school and going through a timewarp.. dang...

The service is great. Food is delish.
But really like timetravelling lol
Plenty of items served in suitable small quantity.  Dishes are good and comparable to other reputable restaurants.  Price for the CNY buffet lunch is reasonable.  Service is good too.

The comments only for their ala carte buffet.
1st the planning of siting is very bad as the place is big but alot of empty table in between so the server had to run the whole place to send the food , even worst can see that they are under staff.

2nd Waited 20min before they take in our order .After our 1st order , waited another 25 min before 1st dish was serve. Then was told that the signature items they forget to key in n had to wait again....

3rd Beside their signature items all other dish was serve cold (room temperature food plus in Aircon room). Really feel that the Zi char in coffee shop will taste better than most of the food .

Lastly can see alot of ppl was complaining and there was 2 table that left eating halfway saying that they will still paid . (Had been waiting for more than an hour and only 1/3 of their food serve.

Btw this was on the 1st of Jan Saturday dinner.
Unbelievably slow and dissatisfied with service provided. 90% of the food arrived was cold and service is extremely slow. Despite good reviews in the papers, service is below average and disgraceful.

Good value and delicious ala carte buffet with generous portions. Seeing previous reviews, they have stepped up and the food was served to us hot and fast. Star of the menu got to be the soon hock fish, ee fu noodle and the sharks fin. Our table of 5 never stopped eating. Highly recommended.

Had ala carte buffet dinner. Service and ambient are decent. But most of the food is cold. Signature dishes are so-so. There are many coffeeshop Tze Char taste much better than this restaurant. Totally not recommended.

1) Ala carte buffet with super long waiting time for your order.
2) Food portion small (Example 5pax = 5 prawns per order)
3) Bad customer services from manager to staffs
4) Totally not recommended
5) Totally waste people money and time
6) The worst restaurant ever been.
$39.80++ (min 3 pax) for the Ala-Carte Buffet, you can eat till you drop, but quality wise it is just average, noting to Woh or Wah about it.
The service is extremely bad. Food is atrocious, every dish comes out not even hot. Worse kind of food I’ve ever had in life. Highly not recommended.

Was having reunion dinner
Tables were spaciously spaced apart and comfortable seating,
Baby friendly seat and utensils provided
Food was fresh but portions were small.
Dishes were served at long intervals
Was amazed at how my tea was not refilled a single time during the 2 hours seating
Buffet food are yummy and delicious.very reasonable price and good service .
Good worthy food. Great taste and excellent service.  Keep it up!
Had the buffet which is very worth it. The taste the portion all excellent.
Good service and traditional feel and taste! Old traditional restaurants are always more tasty compared to those new modern types. Had a good birthday celebration for my dad. Highly recommended

i have never been to this restaurant or hotel. However, recently, i need to organise a little gathering in this vicinity. Happy Joy came up in the search. So i took a gamble. Ah Heng has been absolutely professional and helpful, not only in the arrangements, but his recommendations for ordering of food. The coffee pork ribs and the fried egg white scallops turned out to be really superb. The cuisine is Cantonese and though the pricing appeared steep initially but the servings is pretty substantial. Am glad to find another awesome restaurant in the vicinity. Thank you, Ah Heng!!

Now with the pandemic and looking where to bring my parent for dinner? I know my parent will love this traditional chinese restaurant since their relocation from Bukit Merah to Newton. I didn't know until my parent told me Happy Joy almost 40 years in the market! Comfortable dining as tables are spread a distance away and don't feel crowded. I called to make reservation and understand that their buffet dinner at $39.80 per pax, promo 4 free 1 promotion until end of June. It's an absolute steal for this price! I will be back soon.
What can we ask for with this price that includes peking duck, abalones, shark fin, superior treasure pot, soon hock fish and more...Great food, great price and indeed great nice people in the restaurant.

The staff is helpful and sent me their set menu with mini birthday buns, I will be back for my dad 70th birthday!
bad service, long waiting time for food. leave customers unattended. those who came later was being served first.

Just visited today @ 7 May 16 (7pm-9pm). Foods is good.

Service is disappointed on the last part during bill payment. They have counted wrongly for my bill.

When I seek clarification on the bill. The lady staff insisted the bill is right even we pointed out the mistake.

No choice we have to ask the manager who taken our order to verify. We are right n correct.

The lady stuff show No sense of remorsefulness, No apologize and No smile.

Just pass back us the corrected amount of Bill and walk away. Just like pass money to begger.

Totally disappointed.

Very unhappy customer
Good and delicious food at very affordable price....

Place is a bit of a mini disaster when it comes to service. It does have enough staff who seems genuinely nice, but they all run around like headless chickens. Orders take forever to come after multiple checks with staff, and the place wasn’t even too packed. Food is nondescript and portion sizes are pathetic.
Tables are limited and luckily, I went there after lunch and managed to have a seat. Nice selection of food to choose from. Enjoyed my late lunch.

A small eatery serving Putien, Nanyang, and some local specialties such as hainanese chicken rice. Service was good and fast. Staff are friendly and patient. The place is small and a little cramp. Very open and near shoppers passing by. Ordered the Putien Lor Mee, kang kong, crispy baby squid and xiao long pau. Food was reasonably ok. The xiao long pau was good but I've had better. The squid was crispy but packed the semi sweetness it needs. Noodles and veg were good. Tasty.
Come here for dinner. Pretty good place for Xinghua cuisine. Simple and nice. All dishes that ordered are good.
Came with a 10-month old baby, the staff was able to give us a corner table and baby chair. Food was hot and nice portion. Staff was friendly too.

French toast was good.
Others r ok.
Yummy! The pork rib soup is nice. Herbal taste just taste great. Fried yam is great too. Really like it. Worth coming back

Ambience wise nothing to shout about .
Order the fried tengiri , do eat when freshly fried else the fishy odor comes out .

Xing hua fried bee Hoon and stewed toufu was nice .

We tried the outlet at Novena and was disappointed with the food served except for the cold dish appetite, pork slices which is surprisingly tender and the sauce combines well with meat. The beef rendang was tough and the tofu kai lan was salty. Rice was not properly cooked as well. They appeared to be short of staff, and food takes quite a while to be served. The seating area is quite cramped as well.

Service was really slow, even if it is lunch hour, I don't find it acceptable. Order taking was fast but I had to wait near to half an hour for my food to be ready. I ordered Yuan yang too, this Yuan Yang tasted like water. I think I can make better tasting instant coffee than this 🙄 FYI they use a drinks machine to dispense the coffee/Yuan yang and what not. Counter clerk did not even say thanks upon collecting payment. I need my Yuan yang from Xing wang right now!

Both of us have been loving their food since we first patroned tiong bahru mall outlet. My second time trying out at Novena Velocity outlet and they have even more varieties! Yummy food and drinks at affo|Singapore prices! Recommended their fried rice, xinghua beehoon, garlic cucumber, teh c and kopi c😍

Quality Xing Hua food at affordable prices, food servings were just like their other outlets. Service was well trained and had celebrated our gathering successfully. Definitely to come here again soon.

First time dining there last Thursday and it was a wonderful experience because all the (aunties and uncle) staff were polite and I felt that they provided a better service than many waiters and waitresses at a lot of the restaurants my family and I had been to in Singapore. We had a toddler with us and the staff were patient despite him dropping some things on the floor a few times. They also came over a few times to check on our toddler and to play with him. The food was delicious and portion size was fine except for the Bian Rou dumpling soup as it the dumplings were pretty small and there was very little vegetables in it.

First time trying their food. Ordered a pork chop fried rice, both the fried rice and pork chop is tasteless. Wok hey easily taste so much better. And they charge 50 cents for a regular take away box. Take your money somewhere else.

The lor mee was nice as described. Never order drinks from there especially Milo and coffee. My children ordered Milo and I saw the staff making out from 3in 1 packet and it was very diluted. The staff told me that the coffee was from the coffee machine and hence I didn't order. But she didn't tell with regards to the Milo. I should have guessed.

The clams soup and yam are so yummy. We queried why the clams soup did not come with vegetables as stated in the menu, the chef and manager came over to verify and gave us a new bowl... Very caring and conscientious.

Food is actually good, and there are some decent staff who are genuinely nice. But avoid coming at peak periods they cannot handle the crowd. Food takes forever to come. Clearly forgot one of my orders when a dumplimg soup took 40mins to come - way after everything else was served. If you are in a rush for lunch, you will not make it back in 1hr.

Service is efficient, dishes served quickly especially at peak lunch hour. Heng Hwa bee hoon tasty, though a little too oily, and has sufficient ingredients and condiments added. Stir fried razor class gong bao style was enjoyable as they were willing to tone down the spice. Bian rou soup was alright though not very impressive.

Giving 1 star for the soup dish @ 18.90. Supposed to be Chinese cabbage, clams and taufu soup. No Chinese cabbage at all. Ingredients are so little. DO NOT order the soup dish. Order those lor mee and fried mee Hoon is much better. Wasted trip, money and time 😞

Meticulous service with tasty heng hwa food! Mum and I enjoyed our lunch tremendously. Heng Hua lor mee was cooked well and tasty. The peranakan stir-fry veg was cooked well with wok hei and had yam bits! Fried fish is crispy and nice. Thank you.
Worst meal ever! The Chicken was ice cold and the 酸辣粉 was no where near anything I have eaten before (and I spent 17 years living in China)
Affordable meals and tasty lor mee

Horrendous dining experience, do not order their drinks, Teh O ice super black and tasteless with no sugar. Their putien noodle has no taste and very little to no meat. Worst restaurant! Don't waste ur time and money here
Good very yummy, a lot of varieties

Don't know whether they get their friends help with the Google review. Order 6pc Xiao long bao + soup spicy soup. Taste like microwave food  and even worse than kopitiam food. It costs me 18+. Very expensive. Very long waiting time although it is not peak hour.

Better to go DTF or other Chinese restaurants.
Recommended, nice food and friendly service.

This is my first visit to Xing Hua. The first thing that attracts me is the simple but clean and bright interior. Also their variety of dishes esp the Heng Hwa bee hoon & Putian dishes are mouth watering. I was there at 4.00pm and their staff services were very friendly and professional. I will bring my family next week for lunch.
Repeated visit to this restaurant for its tasty food and great service. Good food recommendations offered! Will patronise again.
Food was delicious. Customer service was friendly and excellent. It was a happy experience dining here.
Food and service exceeded my expectations. Really like their Red Wine Chicken Meesua!

First and last vist here for sure ! The service is atrocious, called 3 different staffs (guy with green hair, old aunty with short hair, prc lady with pony tail) at different intervals to check on my seafood noodles but none of them bothered to respond, just simply brushed me aside. We waited for almost 40 mins and my noodles is not served still. I now asked the 5th staff whom checked with the tall dark colored skin non chinese looking lady at cashier then informed us its coming. After waited for another 5 mins, the noodles just never arrived ! I was visibly super upset and proceeded to cancel order. The taste of their XLB is nothing spectacular, you are better off with DTF or Daxi @ Velocity which served better dumplings. Foods are NOT authentic Hokkien, nor authentic Putien, neither are they authentic Peranakan ! They have lost their identity, as rojak as Singapore. You have a better deal eating at real Putien franchised restaurants @ Ion, Vivo, Kitchener Rd. The taste of their food, and presentation is just about another wannabe Pu Tian, you dont even wanna see how they pack your food if you order via grab/panda, really dont even talk about service which is way below sub-par. You are definitely happier dining @ Hans or Mun Zuk porridge next door ! Spent your $$$ there at your own risk !

Staff absolutely have no idea what is on their menu and got me the wrong order for takeaway. Even the refund process took some time and I was not allowed a refund because the kitchen is already preparing my item. Total waste of time and ruin of appetite

The service staff were very polite and professional even though it was packed with customers and all the tables were full

The food was served hot and it was delicious with many varieties of Putien and Hokkien cuisines to choose from.
Overpriced and food quality is bad, their xiao long bau and siew mai taste like some frozen section products and re-sell it to customers at a higher price. Would not come back again
Awesome food. The marinated clams were really tasty, n their signature bee hoon was good.
Very yummy beehoon. Well fried. Truffle mushrooms were very tasty. Exquisite pork buns. Good service.
This is my sec time here, I enjoyed the food very much, service is very good, I would like to come back here again.
Good, affordable Hokkien style dishes. Had the red wine mee sua - perhaps one of the few stores in Singapore that does this dish properly.
really did not disappoint me the food is delicious and the service style is very enthusiastic❤❤❤❤

Agree with other reviews that this restaurant is a disaster in the service. All staff ran around and didn’t reply when checking on the order. Not sure if they don’t care or just plain rude. One bowl of noodle took more than half hour.
good ambience and fast serving . The menu is wide spread , love the yam and bee Hoon ,lor men.
First time trying out the food. Like the food, its variety and service at this outlet.
Very good service and wide range of food selection.
Reasonably priced n all dishes ordered were very tasty.
Great service and food. Portion is generous and tasty.
Food is nice and price is reasonable. Love the prompt and friendly service too.
Good food, great service and nice ambience. Small but cosy place.
Good place to eat. Nice environment. Good customer service 🤗
Waitress are all very friendly, food taste good too!
Good place to eat. Affordable price for one portion.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Not good. Not bad. Just very average. Definitely overpriced for what it is.

Two things entertained me about this place:

1) We overheard a young girl telling her father “This food is disgusting” - that cracked me up. Her father and I exchanged a chuckle.
2) The restaurant is for some reason using a large amount of space, right next to where the customers are sitting, to store boxes. It just looks funny! Attached a picture to illustrate.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Quality of food had gone down. The tomato egg dish is horrible. Price is high.... Soup is not hot and too sweet. The first 2 dishes came quite timely, the last 2 dishes were served 25 minutes later. Not a good dining experience. Not recommended.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Nice tasty and reasonably priced food, service staff rushing you to finish quickly;
Almost feels like being chased away by telling you "we want to leave the restaurant by 930pm"

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Had dinner at the United Square outlet. Great food and even better service. All the staff that served us were polite and helpful - if only all restaurants and service staff were like this. My wife requested for a knife to cut the sautéed broccoli we ordered as she found the pieces too big to chew. Even though they didn't have a knife, the manager kindly offered to bring our broccoli back to the kitchen and to have them all cut into smaller pieces. And all done with a smile. It was a very pleasant dinner and we'll definitely be eating here again soon.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Awesome Samsui Chicken. Visited 2 decades ago, tasted the same. Except the ginger paste slightly less salted. Well done.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Value for money set lunch. $12.90++ with a choice of rice bowl and a soup. Top up $3 for dessert and a tea. Service was great and friendly.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: This is overall my family's favourite Soup Restaurant outlet. Taste and quality of the dishes are consistently good, and the restaurant managers Bobo and Joanna Choong are always warm, friendly, attentive and accommodating. Their service is top-notched. Highly recommended for a cosy delicious family meal.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Servicewise, still excellant. However,their samsui chicken is now very tasteless and texture is just wrong. Not half as addictive as before and i lost interest completely after eating the 2nd piece..even dunking it in the ginger sauce didnt help any.
The medium size ah por fan shu vegetable was very small in portion as well,and was limpid and bland tasting..
Their specialty hometown tofu had no special taste nor texture to it,and their fish slices with ginger were insipid and tasteless.
My all time favourite of olive fried rice was clumpy and yet superbly oily.
I have been a long time fan of their brand but i m beginning to think if i should revisit and revise this fact.
Paid quite a lot for this bill and yet went away feeling pretty shortchanged and disillusioned with the meal.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Individual set meal of ginger chicken rice portion was small. Individual set of sweet sour pork rice was sufficient, the chrysanthemum drink that came with the set was super diluted like water. Old cucumber soup n cordycep soup were just average. Will not order again.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Britney is a cheerful staff and she has a wonderful memory. She got all our orders correct even without writing them down. Fast on her feet and courteous.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Super love their partnership with Grab, where you're able to order on the Grab app and picking the food up afterwards. The samsui ginger chicken is definitely a house favourite, but also their fried baby kai lan with tong kwai. Had a food-takeaway done from this Restaurant, to enjoy the food at the comforts of my home. Especially love the ginger scallion sauce! Even ordered extra box of that for the next day.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
The staff at the restaurant are outstanding. I have known regulars like Ms Leong Tai Yoke for more than 20 years and the service has always been excellent and friendly.
Soup Restaurant serves comfort food at its best. I will be back.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Extremely happy with the service served by Mdm Leong Tai Yoke.
She advised us not to under nor over order when we decided to go for the set lunch; as a result we ordered 3 pax set though we have 4 persons.
She’s also quick to help us to clean up our table and asked us if there’s anything we need and if we are happy with the serving and service.
Aunty Leong 加油 - we applaud for your service. Btw, she’s also very 亲切。

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Very enjoyable meal in a clean well managed restaurant with lovely friendly staff. We had  ginger chicken, fried rice and a couple of other vegetable dishes, all delicious 🙌

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Bo Bo and Leong Tai Yoke were serving us. They are very patience and very polite to us. We have a very pleasant and enjoyable dinner. Will surely come back again.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Very overpriced for this range and quality. This particular branch’s food quality is exceptionally poor. Chicken is dry, venison tough, food and tea is not warm enough. Service also lacking. Disappointed. Not the usual soup restaurant standards.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Service crew has always went above and beyond to ensure a good dining experience.Food quality is good. Highly recommended!

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Quite expensive, food were good. Service is bad. Server don't care much on service and 10% service charge.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Food was tasty. Ambience was good. And service staff were friendly and helpful.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Great samsui chicken and hearty Chinese herbal soups. Perfect for family dinners and a cosy get together. Food often consistent. Queues expected on weekends.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: I have always received excellent service from Bo Bo. She is very knowledgeable and polite in her work.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Food was decent. Ordered the Salted Egg Chicken with Fries Rice set lunch. The chicken was yummy, the fried rice was a little bland, and they gave a lot of rice (like 2 persons portion). Had to wait a long time for the soup (soup of the day) and my food to come. Quite surprised by the wait cause usually set lunches allow restaurants to narrow down the food preparation and serve quickly.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Nice food, but kinda ex..

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Ordered delivery for dinner, and food quality was as good as dining in. Highly recommended 👍🏻

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
This store at United Square is warm and friendly. The captain that served us has been very accommodating, letting us have seats of our choice, and served us politely, professionally.
The store manager also did her best to arrange the dishes in a way that suits our style. Lastly, one of male staff attended to our needs every now and then.
Really customized service!
The ambience of the restaurant is great too, where a section actually faces a garden.
Overall, great experience!!

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: The staff were very polite. Especially the store manager vwry attentive. Always a great dining experience at this branch.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Waitress was prompt and attentive, cashier was kind to advise on the current promotion for enjoying the discount. Dining experience is  awesome!

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Mdm Leong was a great host and the food was super good as always 👍🏻

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Very nice ambience and nice food. Staff very polite and helpful - eg. Benyathip

Will come again.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Yummy chicken with ginger sauce. The set menu is quite a good selection, and decent value for the amount of food you get. Make sure to order the XO chilli sauce, it goes well with everything.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: We had one of the set dinners for Fathers' Day. Food was excellent, service was good.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
United Square is a little quieter than usual due to the opening of Velocity. However, the food at Soup Restaurant is the same. My in-laws loved the food.

The manager is also very friendly and even guided my father-in-law to the taxi stand as he had trouble walking.

Will definitely recommend this outlet to my friends for the customer service provided.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Soup restaurant is situated inside United Square mall in Novena area. We have 4 adults seated inside the corner cubicle. Their famous chicken, tofu and sea cucumbers with mushrooms are recommended. Their soups are slightly salty. Overall we enjoy a good dinner there.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Went to United Square outlet. The staff is very friendly and helpful especially thanks to Choy Men for such a good service.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Crocoach under table. Server aware of this and just shaking her head and say...ewww...

Food quality is declining

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: the cadyceps (?) soup was the highlight. very very good. the rest not too memorable

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: their samsui chicken still as good and quite a Q to wait during dinner time.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: The wait time between dishes during the dinner is an absolutely disappointing experience.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: The chicken, soup and toufu were tasty although on the pricey side. However, before the meal, i discovered a cockroach in my Pu Er tea. When we told the staff, we did not even get an apology. Well, you won’t see us back there anytime soon.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Quite a long wait for the food. Seem a little short handed and the service staff seem flustered. All items were delicious though!

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Famous local steamed chicken with ginger and lettuce to wrap it or with steamed rice. Nice try and the steamed minced pork with salted fish also taste delicious.Very good selections of food, also with a good service. I was accompanied by a local colleague speaking Chinese so I have no idea if English would be a problem. Anyway, nothing to complain, I recommend it.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: I ordered the traditional soup of the day, on a Friday which was stated to be Lotus root soup. However when it arrived they gave us a different soup without informing us. When I questioned the manager about it she told me that they do not need to inform customers about changes of the soup of the day and that nothing would be done to rectify the situation and that i would still have to pay. On top of that she was rude about the situation and she asked me multiple times if i ‘understood’ the situation and what was going on. Poor service and average food.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Soup Restaurant is one of our favourite places for family gathering. Along with the popular Samsui Ginger Chicken, soupy dish like the Baby Spinach with Century Egg, and the "wok-hei" Hometown Fried Fish Belly are our best-loved. Menu was designed to order the food in one glance and get it served quick. Very cheerful group of service crew. Like the traditional dining tables that come in different shapes and sizes. Special thanks to Jonathan for the birthday cake preparation and related services. Well done!

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: This popular chain restaurant never fails to impress with its Samsui Ginger Chicken. In fact, every table had the dish on it. Spread the chopped ginger on the succulent and tender chicken pieces, wrap them with lettuce leaves and we have ourselves a bite of its signature dish. The order taker was very helpful in recommending a few dishes once we told her of our dietary requirements. The Claypot Salmon could do with a little less salt, but that is just my opinion. Service was efficient with our chrysanthemum tea constantly being refilled.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Soup Restaurant @ united is pretty good. The staff there are quite service pro esp the uncle but it is chaotic on busy nites. Food is tasty and consistant. You can eat big as in group or many dishes or small but be prepared to order double or triple portions for a group as some dishes are small ones. Any soup of the day is fine by me and if you're hungry the full platter of white/steamed chicken slices will help fill you up easy, I love the ginger paste it comes with. The steamed minced meat with salted egg n water chestnuts is a winner in my books.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: The signature samshui chicken was succulent and as always, its standard was maintained. Tried a new dish, the Ah Po Ginger fried rice. The amount of ginger was just nice and the rice was fragrant. The claypot tofu deserves a try too.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Ordered the set for 3 (although there's 4 of us) with soup, Samsui chicken, fried rice, potato leaves in sambal, tofu and dessert. Great meal at reasonable price.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content:
Tasty food that feels home made at reasonable pricing.

Love the samsui chicken, eggplant claypot, broccoli with mushroom and beancurd skin and deep fried fish belly. Nothing lacking on food at all.

The service was also very prompt. The cashier somehow remembered my name at my second visit, which was impressive. The staff is also responsive and attentive to your requests.

Definitely a place to return for many years ahead.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: Consistently good Chinese food! The Samsui chicken with a generous portion of ginger and lettuce wraps is a must have. Also good is their selection of soups and claypot rice dishes. I really liked the steamed minced pork with water chestnut as well.

restaurant name: Soup Restaurant 三盅两件 @ United Square
content: The service is excellent, food arrived quick & timely.  Love the signature chicken dish...it is to die for.  The only trouble, the price is a little steep.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Went on a Friday afternoon for lunch, was crowded. We order our usual dishes. Food was not bad but the rice lack the fragrance which it used to have. Something might be missing. Surprisingly, other outlets rice tasted differently from this particular Thomson outlet. Hopefully, the rice can be improved.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
I would give 6 stars if I could. This place is mind blowing good. I guess it’s the curry fish curry and chicken rice rice combo for me. Everything else was the supporting cast because those 2 just stole the show in my mouth.

Nonetheless I enjoyed every other dish as well. Will be back if I have curry fish head and chicken rice cravings!

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
I was very disappointed with my visit today which was a stark difference from my last visit a few years back.

The single and most important part of chicken rice has got to be the rice. What we got was a plate of undercooked rice that was bland as well. The roast chicken wasn't any better as the meat tasted dry and overcooked.

The Kang Kong and hot plate tofu were decent and the saving grace of our dinner was probably the prawn roll. Service standards didn't do them a favour either. Don't think I'll be back here anytime soon.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
This is the first time I got here. For lunch, it's better you go before the lunch time, example 11 a.m. So you don't have to que.

I ordered:
1. BBQ Pork Dumpling Set
2. Roasted Pork Vegetable Set

For restaurant, the price is affordable. And for the meal, it's delicious.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
We found this place was fairly well rated and their pics looked pretty good too, soo we ventured out to give it a go - boy, we were so happy we did!!
.
The decor isn’t like super insta-flashy or anything but that made it appeal even more to us as a place that just did good food well 👍🏻
.
We were surprised they did crabs 🦀 as well so definitely had to give them a go too. We ordered:
~ 2x Singapore Chilli Crabs
~ Whole Hainan Chicken
~ BBQ pork
~ Belachan Kang Kong
.
Let’s start with the crab. It was amazing! Loads of roe, meaty and the sauce was epic. It was perfect to soak up with the fried mantou (buns). Luckily we got 2 cos we completely demolished them (probably could have done another 2 lolol 😏🤭)
.
The chicken was good too, most of it was super tender, just a few breast pieces that were a touch on the “well cooked” side but overall tasted great 👍🏻
.
The kang kong veggies were super yummy too. Love eating these kinds of veggie dishes in Asian countries cos it’s super inexpensive but very very yummy and full of wokchi 🔥🔥
.
A lovely place that we’re glad we tried out and to our surprise had amazing crabs 🦀 as well as the chicken 🐓

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
As I live fairly nearby, my family and I used to patronised its outlet that was located along Thomson Road.

Ever since it shifted to United Square, we have not try.

We came this afternoon and there was a Q. We waited in line for about 10 mins and was ushered to our table.

We ordered:

1. Chicken for 2pax
2. Mixed Roast pork & Char Siew
3. Prawn roll (small)
4. Sambal Kang Kong
5. Dumpling soup (6 pcs)
6. 1 plain rice
7. 1 chicken rice

Total damage: $54.15

Food reviews (subject to personal taste):

1. Normal chicken - doesn't give me the smooth texture or tasted succulent. Cucumber not even whole slices but within the big slice, sliced up even more

2. Roast pork tip didn't have that crunch which was disappointing. Char siew was little chunky sliced up and not much of charred flavour

3. Prawn Roll dish was decent for me

4. Sambal Kang Kong came out extremely salty and had to send back to change another. When returned 2nd time, it was still salty. Staff shared with sambal is such and is salty. We didn't want to comment much as for those who cook, is the amount of sauce/salt that a chef adds. Thus is adjustable.

5. Dumpling soup was decent
7. Chicken rice didn't capture the essence of chicken stock(if they use to cook)

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Recommended by son, as I have not heard of this chicken rice before. (I am not a chicken rice fan)
And was surprised with the high rating. So we went with high expectations.
Rice was fragrance and came quite a small portion.
The roasted chicken meat was soft and tender. The sauce was too sweet for my liking.
At least there are some dishes that we can order beside eating chicken meat.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Price has been up abit. Dinner for 2 pax $33 max full, chicken taste same as most other foods hawker centre. Kang kong very nice but $9 is expensive, sambal very nice. Dumpling soup nothing special to me. Place very warm traditional style, good for family weekend dinning.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
