content: Wee Nam Kee is a well known Hainanese Chicken Rice restaurant that also serves other Chinese dishes in its menu. However it’s really known more for its authentic and delicious Hainanese Chicken Rice. The chicken is tender, juicy, fragrant and cooked to perfection. The rice is also just right, not too oily and has enough flavor and fragrance. A Chicken drumstick set includes choice of steamed oyster vegetable (Kailan) and/or pork dumplings. I opted for both! The set also comes with either lemon tea or barley (choice of hot or cold). Superb! 4/5!

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: They got the order wrong. We got the normal chicken breast instead of drumstick. The breast meat was dry. BBQ pork was red and not charred enough  However the rice and chili were on the spot for us. Veg cooked perfectly. Can skip the dumplings. If you come in a group, order their other ala cart dishes. Taste good on ours and looks good on tables across

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Missed the traditional old taste although it is getting pricey. Service is getting worse. Arrived at 7.30pm, wanted to order chicken drumstick but was told unable to do so unless I order half chicken. Curry fish head is too salty as well. Sambal kangkong is at $9.10 for a very small plate. Hope to see better service and improve taste in the future.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Prices has gone up abit, but I guess that's happening everywhere. The chicken rice set (be it dumpling soup or vege set) are now $10.50 but a drink (barley or lemon tea) is added to it. Food standards still good.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Chicken Rice (SGD $6.40) @ Wee Nam Kee Chicken Rice.
.
Founded by Wee Toon Ouut in 1987, this beloved brand is today among the most popular and accessible around, serving a good rendition along other home-style comfort food.
.
The chicken has a tender, juicy, slightly springy chew, with pleasant meaty sweet savoury flavour, enhanced with a touch of salty sweet savoury nutty notes from the gravy.
.
The poached chicken is more clean-tasting with a thin gelatinous layer beneath the slippery skin, while the equally popular roasted chicken has a faint smoky aroma and a slightly crisp skin.
.
The long-grain rice is soft and loose, gently slick but not overly greasy, with lovely grainy savoury sweet flavour. The sliced juicy cucumbers and crisp spring onions lend vegetal sweet flavour.
.
Served with dark sweet soy sauce with salty savoury sweet flavour, crushed ginger with herbal sweet spice notes, chili with spicy savoury kick, and a clear chicken broth.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Enjoyed the chicken rice and dishes. The chilli with ginger was fantastic. Roasted chicken meat was delicious. I usually judge the chicken rice by the soup and this was tasty too. I asked if I could top up the soup and they said yes!  I like my chicken rice with gizzard and liver and was happy to have these options. We added crabmeat omelette and prawn fritters which were yummy too. Recommended. Will be back if I need another filling of chicken rice.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
With so many good reviews, i can only guess we may have ordered the wrong dishes.

Btw the even the chicken rice is lack of fragrance.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Overall Great 👍. Gong bao Ji ding was on the sweeter side. Lesser sugar
Would have been better. Rice was very good, so was barley drink

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Old school chicken rice restaurant. The roasted version is especially good with the sauce. The white version is very smooth.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: chicken rice overalls ok. but roast pork belly totally disappointed. taste dry, no crunchy, cold like bring out from freezer. is overnight left over. will no more next visit.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Chicken rice - The dish was good but the chicken meat was not as fleshy as before and the portion was smaller.
Dumpling soup - There were 3 dumplings, which were ok. But the soup was salty and did not have much other flavour.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
We visit this restaurant often. Cos we live nearby, They've raised 5% service charge and GST since 7th April. That's fine, but they have provided lesser portion than before. Which does not justify the implementation in service charge and gst.
Very disappointed

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: When less crowded you get to enjoy more time. Being chase when there is queue. For a restaurant it is not very customer oriented place

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Love steamed chicken more than roasted. Staffs are friendly and helpful.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: This was the menu at the Marina Square location that we went to. It all looked SO TASTY when we went to visit back in January 2020 but I couldn’t taste any of the food being so sick on that trip. Can’t wait to come back and give this place a try!

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: A good efficient dinning place that serve good standard chicken rice and assorted food at reasonable prices. Set meal are good option for a full meal. Here the chicken is tender and sauces are on par. Dumplings soup dumplings are generous in fillings. Dining ambiance is good enough and air condition . You go , order , eat and run.  No frills.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Order for take away a bit uncomfortable as no menu to view and "waiting area" is kind of no area to wait.

Food is definately good. Will go back for the food.

Service can be improve as staff that serving food seems very tired rather than pleasant and enjoying....

Not too crowded and spacious space.

Entrance is located outside of mall.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
So so, nothing special.

Average per pax $15, acceptable range however quality dropped significantly especially the chicken itself.

Salted egg pork ribs and Sambal Sotong doesn't impress us as well, especially salted egg pork ribs a bit disappointed as other outlet at Yishun much much better taste compare with this outlet.

In overall, 3 Star for the food quality, 4 Star for the warm services and spacious environment.

Sadly to say, I won't recommend this place to others. In fact, we grave for their signature chicken but maybe, we just shouldn't pay too high expectations.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Still the best chicken rice in Singapore! They do also have a decent zi chat menu that offers the usual dishes you would expect with the sweat and sour pork chops and sotong you tiao that you might want to try. Good service and it’s usually quite busy in weekends.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Service was good and care was taken to ensure safe distancing, hygiene and sanitising (and temperature taking). Ambience is cozy and good for family dining. Food is OK but there's a certain fishy taste in the dumplings which is not the usual typical teepo fish taste that I'm used to. Lunch that day was just a "get stomach filled" experience. No socks off!

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: A long standing Chicken Rice establishment in the Novena area. Rice is quite good and chicken is decent taking into account the current supply constraints. Above average overall and one of the better ones around.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: We ate between lunch and dinner, so the restaurant was empty except us. The service was very quick and the chicken rice was absolutely delicious. The waiter was a little curt, which was off-putting.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: The best place for chicken rice in my opinion. My kids love this place. All their dishes are good. Our fave are the roasted chicken rice, hot plate beancurd, baby kailan, fu rong omelette.. somehow this outlet's food is far better than the Northpoint outlet.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: They say one of the best Chicken Rice place. Hummm. I expect high but the outcome is below par for great chicken rice. I am not saying bad which u can see I still give 4 star. Just they cannot be regarded as best chicken rice. Their chicken is good and food is nice. Really worth to come. However for best chicken, u need some good cooking method and the tender of chicken must be smooth rather than a bit rough. Otherwise other food was also good.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Went with a friend from out of town who wanted to hv some chicken rice in a comfortable ie aircon setting. The chicken was tender and rice was tasty but I'm not sure I'll be back. There's too many chicken rice stalls sans a/c that taste as good.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Portion is pathetic. Was given a few scraps of meat that look like leftovers from an unfinished meal.  Whats more despicable, is the raising of price without updating their menu price or informing customer (due to chicken shortage so they claimed). So disappointed as i used to frequent them in the past, but food is now mediocre with questionable bussiness practices.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Favorite chicken rice place in SG. Quality has lowered slightly since they sold to Jumbo and moved from their original location nearby but still good. The roast chicken, rice and sambal is still good

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Busy but awesome spot for chicken rice with other side dishes as well. Lines up are usually pretty quick because they server fast and prices are decent for a full sit down. I usually come back here when the stalls don't cut it - enjoy

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: This is a very busy outlet but you can be guaranteed of consistently good chicken rice that is so fragrant and chicken that melts in your mouth. The fish head curry comes recommended and I like the freshness that tasted directly from the sea. The supreme pork chops and prawn roll are tasty.  Recommended to make reservations if coming in large groups.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: The rice is nice and fragrance but a bit disappointed with the chicken as they are not tender enough. The price is on the high side compare to other shops. The chilli is nice but the ginger is dry and not fragrance.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Had a good dinner here with my family. They only had white chicken left though as we came pretty late ( around 8pm), so do come early if you're eyeing the roasted chicken or roasted pork. Ordered some sides as well,overall quite nice for the variety it has in addition to some pretty good chicken rice.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Since the closure of Tian Wai Tian at 226 Amk, I tot i could never find another good sweet and sour pork .  I have found my replacement finally here at United Square - Wee Nam Kee! We loved the claypot tofu too.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
V tasty chicken rice, char siew a bit tough and a tad sweet.  Soup very tasty with lots of ingredients too.
Place very crowded and noisy.  Have to come early.... to queue.  Will definitely come again

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Delicious Singapore style chicken rice (roasted and white). Free soup served with the meals. Also ordered the cereal prawn dish which was crunchy and delicious. Come on weekdays, reservations needed for Friday and weekends. Good for large groups.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Back here two years after leaving Singapore. Wee Nam Kee used to be my go to local chicken rice place. I came here almost 2-3 times a week even even try were still up in their old location.

Yesterday we ordered all the good stuff I remembered and taste as well as quality wise they are still keeping up their same high level as ever before.

To my favorites belong obviously the roasted chicken, the chicken rice, their sweet and sour pork, baby kaylan with garlic and the mapo eggplant dish. All of which were support delicious. I don't know why we didn't order the bbq chashu as I remember that being fabulous too but I guess we already had more than enough food.

Wee Nam Kee still my favorite.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: I have eaten at Wee Nam Kee for more than 10 years and I loved the chicken, the rice and the condiments. Unfortunately, this time I didn't quite enjoy the meal. Perhaps I should not say why as the taste for food is very subjective.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Quite simply, amongst the best chicken rice I've ever eaten. And the char siew and roast pork is sublime too. Don't let the naysayers put you off!  The crowds of regular customers is testimony to the quality of the food.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: The service is good, the waitress are friendly eventhough they're extremely busy. Price is affordable and the venue is fully air conditioned. The food however is a little bit of a let down, but don't let my review stop you from going there, as they say different people different preference.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content: Never gets disappointed when having meals in this place. The soy sauce chicken is one of the best in Singapore. The hainan rice is delicious

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Food so good, the owner is so nice n hospitable. He speaks English well. We paid $20 for 2 sets.
Satisfied with this!

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Fast to get seated due to ample seating spaces even during lunch time today. Only about 10-15 mins to get our food after ordering.

The meal which comes with either an oyster vegetable or 3 dumplings is very good! Always order extra rice because their rice portion is smaller but their rice is so yummy. Sticky and fragrant, addictive!

Although the bill came up to $20 for two because we added extra char siew and gizzard to our chicken rice sets, it’s totally worth the money for such a satisfying meal. It’s easy to spend $20 in town on food that’s way less satisfying or quality.

restaurant name: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant
content:
Just sharing my opinion. Haven't been there for few years. Today, All food served cold. Not worth going anymore as it's totally different from years back.

Used to have second helping for the fragrance rice but it is now taste like raw flour. The Char Siew taste like you're putting sugar in your mouth as it's overlay sweet. The roast pork in the market taste way better than theirs. Ordered quarter Chicken but given all breast meat which used to be tender and tasty but not anymore.

All of the above is even more obvious when our "lie detector" didn't even finish half of his favourite fragrance rice 🤭
Underrated place with extremely legit and affordable Sichuan food. 烤鱼 and 辣子鸡 are must-trys!
Friendly Chef , can customize spiciness. Tasty n economical Sichuan food

Foods are very good. My favorite is fish soup 👍👍 but Whampoa is one of the dirtiest food court I have seen in Singapore . Very few staff to clean tables. If they can provide better cleaning in that food center would be so good place to go.
Great place! I ordered the chongqing chicken. It is amazing and the amount of chicken is very generous. If you like spicy food this is your dish.

Do not visit this shop. Very poor service, did not inform about waiting time for order. Ended up waiting for an hour since refund for order was rejected. Got partial refund for order in the end. Food was not so great as well.

Went on a Friday night around 7pm and there are 1-2 seats left. Service was okay. You can order your food via QR code.

Ordered the pan fried buns, minced meat noodle and pork fillet. Pan fried buns were good though the base of the crust is rather on the thicker side. Noodle was okay nothing amazing. Pork fillet was pretty oily and didn't have much taste.

Will probably return for the pan fried buns.

Good for casual dinner with family .
The drunken chicken was not chilled enough and chicken were chilled into too small bits .

The noodle was ok but nothing unusual .

Fried pork on skewers was too overly sweet .
The skin of the  pan fried bun was too hard.

One major comment was after consuming dinner I was overly thirsty, too much artificial flavoring.

Decent food, but still finding their footing.

Meat noodles are satisfying and portions are generous. The chicken and beans cold dishes are so-so, the dumplings are a bit lacking in soup and meat.

They also ran out of many dishes by the time we went, but to be fair the restaurant was packed full since lunchtime and we only went for dinner.

Hopefully in the future they will have more dim sum varieties!

Pretty unique foods not frequently seen in SG. The pan fried bun signature of theirs is very good. However the other dishes are quite average tasting.

Service was very good, and food came quite quickly.

Went before 12pm and was able to get a table.

The Shanghaiese pan-fried buns looks, taste amazing, although I think there is just too much dough.

Same for the xiaolong baos.

I am from Shanghai family and I feel I'm qualified to comment.
First, I was attracted by the menu as I can tell immediately many are Shanghai home kitchen type dishes that only serve in Shanghai street style small restaurants, like curry beef, sticky rice stick.
Here are the comments:
Service - robotic but no real customer attention.
Xiao long bao and Sheng jian bao - not good the meat is too hard, like a meat ball, and not juicy enough.  I don't agree with one review that it is too oily.  First the "juice" is not oil, it is pig skin boil long enough to become collagen so if anyone has tiny little common sense will know these bao is good for skin and beauty.  If you think it is oily then you better go eat burger.  Here the XLB skin is so thick and dry.  The SJB is not hot and bottom not crispy, just like toast.  The pork not only hard but with no pork taste.  Very disappointed, and if a restaurant will have signature dish disappointed, I can write off this restaurant.
Curry beef rice vermicelli - surprisingly good and authentic and it gives one star in my overall three stars ranking.
Last, as from photo, I am also very disappointed they put the vinegar on the Xiao long bao, do they respect the food or have any sense of hygiene?
Definitely no need to come again.

Was excited to see Shanghai pan fried buns! However we left that place disappointed.

Shanghai buns were oily and skin was too think and doughy.

Xiao loong baos had thick skin and oily inside probably due to the fatty meat used.

Tried the dry minced meat noodles and was doused in oil too.

Tried the sour soup wasn’t great and should be served piping hot which wasn’t.

Service was no frills but fast. And for the price we paid, 28 bucks is rather cheap. Guess you pay for what you get.
Shanghai soup buns. Steamed to perfection with crispy base. Bite in for the hot and flavorful meat juice! Super recommend, come early to beat the long queue. 👍🏻

Shang jian bun skin is too thick. Pork chop fried rice is deep fried with powder coated different frm usual and rice is tasteless. Barley is cheap and nice. Guo tie and XLB so so only.Wine chicken too salty. Price is reasonable and service is good.

Fried rice has no taste. Better go to wok hey.

Mince meat noodle is too salty. Hair will surely drop.

Pan fried bun.. overpriced, over hyped. Doesn't taste like much.

Didn't finish my food. And I'm not even particular about food.

Went on a rainy Friday night.

Food wise,

▶️ Hot and sour soup, served warm and wasn't spicy nor sour.
▶️ Xiao Long Bao was also served warm with barely any soup in it. I believe the photo would be about to justified my comment.
▶️ Sliced pork fried noodle was really salty.
▶️ Ice barley was super diluted.

✅️ Luckily service was ok💪

Really decent pan fried bun they did, juicy with not too burnt bottom, obviously can’t compare to Yang’s dumpling in Shanghai but one of a decent one in Singapore

Chicken is a 2/10, too plain taste of the sauce ( maybe expensive wine in Singapore ) and the texture of chicken  is really so so

Decent food at affordable prices in Novena!
Should expect huge lunch crowd, it’s a staple for the Novena office workers.

Must Try~ Spicy Pork Noodles (dry): the noodles texture is amazing, cooked to perfection. Sauce is flavourful, abit too savoury with a hint of spice. Pork is succulent and flavourful as well.
Pan Fried Buns: It’s like Xiao long bau combined with a fried bun. The bun contains flavourful soup with a crispy bottom.

Authentic and affordable shanghainese street food in a chic, modern compact setting. Pan fried buns and the drunken chicken were the highlight of the meal. The food here does not align with local taste buds, and hence the poor reviews. So come in here with an open mind and you'll might begin to appreciate true shanghainese cooking style. Fast and efficient service, it has one of the most intuitive qr ordering system I've ever came across.

💗Check out nomninjas on instagram and Facebook💗
✨credits when photos used✨
…
It’s interesting how the place is narrow with limited seats and casual fast food feels but there is a open view kitchen with the chefs in high hats (professional) 👨🏻‍🍳😂 they have other Chinese dishes like la mian and XLBs which I would definitely go back and try 😍🌟 can pass on their fried glutinous rice (literally a whole stick of rice 🍚😅)
📍: Shanghai Tan Pan Fried Buns (Novena)
💰: ~ $10-15

Very AUTHENTIC Shanghainese taste. The quality is good. The first on the pan fried bun... Oh gosh! The meat 'gravy' in the bun just ooze out. You cannot just eat it with chopsticks. You need a spoon while eating the bun. As for the 'gravy' that ooze out on the spoon, well. Drink them! It is not oily and it is clear. VVFM. (Very Valued For Money)

Will give four stars coz hope they will continue to maintain their standard and strive to better.

Ordered the Sheng Jian Bao and soya bean drink for lunch. Loved the slightly doughy buns that were bursting with delicious meat juices. It was a lovely and refreshing lunch, especially when paired with the ice cold soya bean drink on a hot day.

Went back again for dinner with family. This time, ordered the Sheng Jian bao, Xiao long Bao, noodle soup with preserved vegetables and pork and noodles with pork in spicy sauce.
Family likes the buns- both the fried and steamed ones. However, the noodles were a disappointment.

Service was excellent and attentive. However the tables were placed too near to each other. Was not comfortable dining next to another customer who was sniffling away the entire meal and he was seated less than a metre away.

As a Shanghainese, I am very satisfied with their fried buns and xiao long bao, it is the taste of my hometown. And I am sure only they offers pork string in Singapore. I will visit them again with my children in the coming school holidays.

Went there with my wife and 3 daughters, ordered their Signature Pan Fried Buns, XLB, Noodles With Spring Onion Oil and steam buns. The food is delicious which all of us like it. We will definitely visit again.

If I could I would give 2.5 stars.
Rounding up because this place is new and I understand they are finding their footing.

Visited on 8 June
Ordered Pan Fried Bun (4pc $5.80) and Xiao Long Bao (5pc $5.80)
It's nice that the listed price was the price I paid, no GST, no service charge. Not sure if this would change.

Pic: Unfortunately found a hair in the meat filling of the pan fried bun.
Pic: panfried buns as served + vinegar colour
Pic: discolouration on the white base piece of xiao long Bao tray

Vinegar provided was very diluted and ginger strips very very mild. I love my vinegar so if you don't you would not mind.

Pan Fried Bun - bottom is definitely nice-crispy, dough to meat ratio is not that bad. My issue was more how to consume it because I wanted to drip vinegar inside + eat as a whole to enjoy the different textures.
Butbthe filling was quite hot (mine were served fresh&hot, some reviews mentioned lukewarm food) and I didn't want the soup inside to spill out so it was a bit awkward trying to bite the bread part open and cool the inside down. After which it was still slightly too big to stuff the whole thing in my mouth.

I cannot speak for authenticity as I have not been to Shanghai to eat the panfried bun (nor to any part of China unfortunately).

Next, I will compare the xiao long Bao to the OTHER brand I visit (Din..).

BY COMPARISON, this one is cheaper, slightly bigger (I say so because I usually put the whole XLB in my mouth) but like a rougher made cousin, skin is not as thin and tender which speaks of lesser skill from the maker, meat is also less "exquisite". For instance, when I bite open Din's XLB, I never see the cooked blood on the filling (that jellyfish, smooth, patchy thing?).

ON ITS OWN, I'm happy to eat it. Would I go back? Not on my own, very unlikely. If my friends wanted to try it, I would go along and be happy/have no complaints, I would take the chance to try another dish probably. Perhaps it's time to research good pan fried bun in SG haha.
ordered the pan fried buns and xiao long baos. both dishes arrived very quickly upon ordering but the pan fried buns tasted better. the xiao long baos were quite average.

Veru doughy and thick skin for both xlb and jian bao. Feels like eating dough instead of the actualt dish. The vinegar condiments given was diluted with some other liquid which makes it not go well with the jian bao and xlb
Go for the Shanghai 生煎包 which is bursting with juices. Other items such as the dry noodles are also worth trying.

Excited to see shanghai dim sum resturant open close to United Square,  so can eat Shen Jian Bao nearby instead go to Ding Te Le which is far away from center.  Tried Shen Jian Bao and Xiao Long,  both nice and similar standard as Ding Te Le thats all I need.
I really like the fried bun as it tastes really good! I like it! Also, the 甜心八宝饭 surprises me too as I have never tried this kind of food before. Will definitely be back to eat again!

Came in due to curiosity. Regretted it. I think the cooking style and taste is just not our style. Most are overcooked and average tasting. I totally did not like the pan fried glutinous rice. Too hard and sticks to the teeth.

The pan-fried buns are really good! Better than the No Signboard chain.

The soup dumpling is lacking flavour though, especially when eaten with strong-flavoured noodles or other spicy dishes.

5 Stars if you order both types of 生煎包.
Four stars for all the other types of food except for noodles which I've yet to try.
It's authentic but the QC leaves some room for improvement.
Overall I still gave five stars because the price is very affordable!

Ordered Egg Fried Rice with Pork Chop and Prawn Pan Fried Buns. Pork chop definitely pre-cooked, froze and re-heated. So it is mushy and without the usual meat fibre texture. The egg fried rice has no wok-hey at all. The dish is bad. For the buns, the filling tastes ok but the skin is way too thick and doughy. I think they used the wrong type of flour or rather the flour mix is not good. Overall, food is bad and totally not worth the money.

I do wonder if some of the 5 star reviews are friends and family of the owner.

Fried rice was bland, pork chop tasted like its re-fried and oily af. Their signature 生煎包，was weirdly sweet, as many previous reviews pointed out. Only good dish was the sweet and sour soup but even that was served luke warm, not hot.

Scallion noodles were okay, and the dumpling with chilli oil was bland as well.

Will not recommend. Although its cheap, the quality is really food court quality or worse.

Came across this store and thought to give it a try with my friend since it was new. Even though the images on the menu looked promising, we were disappointed because

1. Fried rice was so pathetic that I’d rather use the money to buy wok hey which is of much better quality. The fried rice tasted bland and the quality of prawns were BAD. Fried rice didn’t have spring onions but pathetic peas and carrots. There weren’t large chunks of eggs either.

2. Their wanton soup is of what you can easily get at the coffee shop for $3. The meat fillings were seriously pathetic and there were no seasonings. Soup had too much MSG.

3. Skin of the pan fried buns were too THICK

4. Sausage was supposed to be glazed, but it was very watery and the skin was 90% peeling off. There was no meat in the sausage and it looks dehydrated. My friend felt like she was having starch sausage.

Even though service was prompt, I wouldn’t  recommend this place because the food quality is THAT bad. I believe there are much better Shanghainese food places out there than this. At this point honestly just go to Ding Tele / DTF.

Looks nice from the outside and the restaurant is full of people. We had high expectations when we went in, however we were rather disappointed with the food quality.

Xiao long Bao was not hot, just slightly warm.. seems like it has been pre cooked and left in the kitchen for quite sometime.. skin is thick and the pork just tastes weird.

won't recommend. new place so thought to try this place. hugely disappointed with the food quality. we order the fried rice, and when it came, i asked my friend is it with cheese cause it's sticky when i tried to stir it. then i smell it and it stinks. rice already gone bad and the stench was so obvious.

signaled to this young lad which could be the boss, and he denied and said cannot be, and say their rice is ok WITHOUT even smelling it. he left the plate of rice on our table still, went to the kitchen to ask his guys, came back to take the rice, and then came back super apologetic and said the rice turn sour cause it's very hot inside. 😶‍🌫️😶‍🌫️😶‍🌫️ puzzled right???

anyway the food wasn't nice at all. the buns skin were super thick, the noodle drenched in oil.

hope the owners do something about it. the menu and photos looks promising but we left disappointed.

Wife went into the shop and told me to meet her there. I read the reviews here and told her not to order so much but she missed my message and ordered the fried rice with fried pork chop, xiao long bao, pan fried buns, gyoza, drunken chicken and barley. I had super low expectations but when the whole restaurant was seated, I wondered if the existing Google reviews were harsh. The fried rice was tasteless and the pork chop though nicely fried, was strangely sweet. The pan fried buns/gyoza/xlb all too, tasted weirdly sweet while the drunken chicken. The only thing that was supposed to be sweet - the barley drink, was tasteless. I've eaten local cuisine in Shanghai before and the food doesn't taste this way. Might be a failed attempt to localise the flavours. Wouldn't recommend.

We ordered 4 dishes to share for 2 pax. Yangzhou Fried rice was a decent one, not as tasty as the famous DTF style but still acceptable.  I was very delighted when I see they have this Qi cai dumplings 荠菜馄饨红油抄手, but the taste is not what I expected, skin too thick. Both my colleague and me found it good was the drunken chicken (with strong shaoxing wine taste) and the duo fried dumplings (prawns and pork). Service was good, hope they maintain it. We spend $32.20 for this meal, without beverages.
The dumplings are just the right amount of thickness and the soup is good. Recommended to try this, especially if you have been to Shanghai before and are craving the authentic dumplings there
Their scallion noodles are nice. For Shenjian Bao, skin is too thick. Still prefer the one at Jalan Besar.

best shengjianbaos I've had in Singapore! Even their xiaolongbaos are really good. also love their side dishes especially the 大四喜. only thing that I didnt enjoy is their 酒酿圆子 dessert. Salted egg sesame balls dessert were also really good but quite oily.

Went during lunch hour.

Ordered the xiao long bao and the spicy noodle.

Xiao long bao’s meat was thick like the normal meat bao. And the noodle’s soup is quite tasteless, the meat in the soup are just pork cubes.

The upsides are the food are prepared on the spot and came hot. And they are quite affordable.

However also to note during my visit, the staff asked me to leave to make way for a group of customers that just came in without enough seats. I havent finished my drink at that point. So that wasnt pleasant. They could have managed it better.

Delicious meals are tasty especially the Pan fried bun & Shanghai soup bun really suprised me its so yummy😋
Food serve quite fast n service was good too👍🏻
definately will come back here again.

The shanghainese drunken chicken & black fungus in vinaigrette are decent. The xiao long bao & prawn dumpling are disappointing. Meat too tough, skin too thick. Prawn dumpling tasteless. Don’t be fooled by the drink “green bean smoothie”. It’s not smoothie. Just crushed ice in green bean water. V thirsty after eating. Overall, will not recommend.
I think food here, it’s authentic enough by Shanghainese standards. The fried bun taste really as good as anywhere you can find in Singapore.

Initially when I saw all the bad reviews about this place in Google and all the good reviews in Xiao Hong Shu, I thought this must be a case of non Chinese nationals disliking authentic Shanghainese flavours. So I decided to give it a try. I was wrong.

First there was the long wait, which is expected for a new restaurant offering Shanghainese food. We were a group of 3 and when it was our turn, we were seated at a table meant for two only. Just make do, we were told. If and when a table frees up, the waiter promised to shift us. Never did, even after more than one table frees up.

Food wise, we ordered the Sheng Jian Bao, Beef Guo Tie, Scallion oil Noodles, Chilli Oil Dumplings, Crab meat dumpling soup and Drunken Chicken. The dumplings, Sheng Jian Bao all tasted sweet without the umami of meat juice coming from steamed fresh meat. Someone in the kitchen took the idea of adding a little sugar, to elevate the taste of the dumpling filling, too far. The scallion oil noodles had too little scallion taste as the noodles was a disproportionately large serving. Only the beef potstickers and drunken chicken impressed, the former because it is a rarity and the latter because it tasted genuinely good. And I should know because I lived in Shanghai for almost 20 years.

Service was polite but inadequate. We were left sitting there to twiddle our thumbs for 10 mins without menu nor means to order using their QR code.

Not coming back anytime soon.

Great food and service. We had great experience there.

Xiao long baos were juicy with super delicate skins thin, a little elastic and soft.

Regarding the Shen Jian Baos, from their skin to the filling everything about this dumpling is perfect.

The drunken chicken was succulent, juicy and tasty.

Will come back soon!
The food was indeed good as what I had in Shanghai. Waited for 30min. but it’s ok as no need to queue up outside, they will call back.
Order yang zhou fried rice, but it served cold, and don't even bother to fried the rice with vegetable and prawn together.
Waiting time was long, but deserve it. Drunken chicken, curry beef soup and spicy pork noddles were decent and delicious.
Overstocked salt from Covid ah? Pan fried far cry compared to Ding Tai Le
Recommended by a friend! Their pan fried bun is tasty and extremely juicy. Must try!

fried rice a little bland.
but overall, 生煎包is good, xlb is decent (skin on the thicker end)

Ate halfway then realised forgot to take photo. Overall it was tasty and portions are quite generous but slightly expensive for a restaurant like that.

Fried rice - for 1 pax and 4.80 the portion was huge that it can feed two pax. However, i have had better tasty fried rice before

Cereal prawn - I think one of the best dish of the 4 dishes I ordered. Expensive but prawns were HUGE and fresh! I couldn't eat the tail part even though it was deep fried. They didn't really deep fry it properly. Not sure if it's like that but I appreciate if I can eat everything when it's deep fried. Cereal was sweet and tasty

Yam ring - I liked it as well!

Scallop and broccoli - disappointing scallops. Tasted rubbery and a lot of ginger. Broccoli was ok.

It's nice and probably I will come back for prawns if I crave. Didn't manage to try the crabs, will see how

Opens till 11pm. A viable substitute for the Whampoa food centre if it’s closed for cleaning or for the day. Beef hor fun had some wok hei. But spinach isn’t a good substitute for Cai Xin. Wrong texture.

I hardly give 1 star reviews but this place deserves zero — if there was such a rating.

Mediocre food with poor service and presentation. We ordered fish head noodle soup, hotplate beancurd, ngoh hiang, gong bao frog and curry fish head. The fish head noodle soup was tasteless unlike what was shown on the menu. The hotplate beancurd had the worst presentation by far! The curry fish head and ngoh hiang weren't too bad.

Service was horrible because I brought my grandma, but I think they just weren't welcoming or lacked situational awareness that they couldn't bother opening the doors for me to wheel her in. The waiter was also engrossed in his mobile phone game instead of giving food recommendations, and just left us halfway to "let us sort out our thoughts".

With such lackadaisical attitudes and lackluster food, I won't recommend anyone to patronize this place even if you're staying at the nearby housing blocks.
Portion is small, even for a lady. Zero wok hei, taste is average. Horfun with gravy came very fast.

Utterly disappointed with this family restaurant. Maybe because family so waiter & waitress who looks like bro & sis are super grumpy and rude. You step into the restaurant and no basic manners to greet customer. Nevermind. Tell them number of pax and get rude reply. Maybe they are not short of biz. Prices are not cheap for a hdb restaurant. Would not recommend.
Best home cooked meals EVER! Sweet and sour pork & the ginger onion with fish were amazing.
Food is quite value for money. Flavour is ok.  But dessert is disappointing

Serves a wide selection of local zi char stall dishes. There are several popular items which are not shown on the menu. Taste is great overall and so is the pricing for majority of the dishes. Prices of those seasonal dishes like crab etc, tends to be higher.

Recommended me to try their crab and said that it is fresh. When the crab is served, the pincer was so watery with little meat like an empty shell. When complaint to lady boss, she just look at it and walk away. The rest of the food there are just normal.

one star purely cause prices are on the lower side. else probably 0 stars to be given. food was BAD. tried twice and both was equally bad. food generally tasteless. no idea why people are queuing for this was the food is terrible. food from the veg rice shop is way better and cheaper.
Look at the chunks of white rice. You call this fried rice? Speechless. 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼

Pin Hsiang Family Restaurant is an air-conditioned place where my family often goes to for affordable and tasty meals.

The prawn rolls are crispy and goes well with the sweet dark sauce. The texture of the omelette is nice and it's one of my favourite dish. Fish is served with mushroom but the taste is slightly on the bland side. Broccoli with scallops are ok. They served homemade barley. The rice portion is on the high side for me to finish one plate. You can consider sharing the rice if you are not a big eater.

Service of staff is merely taking orders and serving which could be improved simply by giving a smile to customers.

#ILovePinHsiangFamilyRestaurant
Surprising nice food at neighbourhood. So far all the dishes I tried are nice. Bring your own catch fish to them for cooking in your preferred method for $15
A neighbouring restaurant caters to family and individuals. Although the space is not big but it is aircon and price is reasonably ok as compare to others zi char restaurants
Affordable zhi char stall that has a Air con setting! Food was slightly above average but pricing was reasonable.
Nice little family style Chinese restaurant. Typical Singapore dishes prepared just like home cooked food.
Simple zi char, decent portion sizes. Sambal belacan chilli is good.
Good food in my neighborhood. But, the server working there is dismally unhappy.
Others ppl wrong order serve to us.. terrible.. food is cold too!!!
Reasonable food and pricing.
Authentic family zi char restaurant.
Good old family style zi char
Nice food with reason price
Food cheap but tasteless, rude!
Nice zi chai..good service
Simply yummy
nice zichar, friendly auntie
Very local,deep in the corner.
Cheap and good food

Always enjoyed the Peking duck here. The platter with all the sauces and condiments is something which we  don’t see in other restaurants. Restaurant was very busy during our visit and service was a bit slow but overall, we had a good time. Will visit again.
Great service by tunglok. Food is good as always. Up to standard. Lobster porriage is very good, sweet and meaty big lobster.

Newly opened outlet. Great environment, great service and great food. Peking duck was very good. Good to order it in advance or you'll have to wait for 45 mins. The wagyu beef cubes  with truffle oil is a must try. The nai bai with sakura prawns was very good too.

Good to make a reservation. 69922777.
The duck was fresh and meaty and the food was decent. The staff here are very service oriented, helpful and friendly.
This restaurant was awesome! Fantastic service and the food was exceptional. The duck will leave an impression, in fact everything will.
Good service . Food are pretty good . Personally , I like their 梅菜扣肉 and fish .recommended to come
The food was so good they even give us mala duck bone at the end for free, damn good siak

Yesterday, my family and I went to your restaurant for lunch. The food and ambience were nice. The Peking Duck is a must-try. I like the way they cut out the meat and serve it. It's so different from other restaurants as I can eat the best part of the duck meat. The service crew are friendly, especially Daphne. She is very good, cheerful, proactive and experienced. She explains my questions in detail, and I like the photos that she took for us. The shots and angles are so nice. Dong Dong is very helpful too. All my requests are well attended to. I would like to compliment their service. The only thing to take note of is that they serve the dishes super fast, so you must not order all at once, as the table is unable to accommodate all the dishes at once. This makes us a bit too rushed to finish the dishes instead of slowly tasting the food.
Good food and friendly service. The peking duck was excellent and delicious.
Good food, great service, already planned to come back. Lisa was very patient, helpful and informative.

Went for lunch at the tunglok peking duck outlet at Novena Square today, but the standard of the peking duck is totally no consistency. The peking duck is soooooooo oily!! Paid $98 (havent incl. GST and service charge) for this to drink oil? It is really disappointing!! 😡😡 I got video of it too!!!
Food was great, especially the duck. Service was excellent too.

Had dinner last time here. I am pleased with the excellent service. The staffs are very attentive in the name of Ivy Zhang .Table settings are nice and clean. The Foods are great and amazing. I will visit it again soon. Enjoyed it so much. Im giving 5 star. Would recommend it to friend's. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Great experience dining experience! Peking Duck was cooked to perfection, the meat was succulent with a natural sweet aftertaste! Customer service was top notched too! Will definitely be back again.

Excellent place for having the Pequim Duck.
People very nice and polite. Lovely place

Ridiculous service. We’re the first customer and we waited very very long for the first dish that we’ve pre ordered. Upon checking 4 times! With different staffs nobody get back to us to why it was not serve or why food was delayed. Will NOT patronize again.
Good services and good food. Really friendly staffs
The dinner was wonderful. Service was excellent too.
Food & Service was great! We'll be back again soon!
Friendly and attentive service, quality food, clean and comfortable environment. Complimentary birthday dessert a bonus.

Pretty decorations in the restaurant.

Foodwise the dishes are pretty awesome. Tried the 4 pax set c and the portions are super abundant.

Highly recommend Daphne's service!
Excellent service. The staff were friendly and accommodating
Chun Rong has been an exemplary staff, friendly, attentive and Knowledgeble of the food. The lobster is great. Will be back for the duck
Food is on point and in-line with the 313 Tung Lok restaurant. Peking duck is excellent. Come and support the team.
Daphne did very good job and we are very happy with the quality of food and friendly service. Thanks
Good not bad , services is good, clean nice new environment
Food quality is good only problem is shortage of staff and food serving is small.

Came to have dinner today. Didn’t get the duck but the other dishes like the lobster mapo tofu, and the fish maw soup were delicious. Chun Hong was serving us and was very attentive and cheery.

Thanks for the wonderful dinner.

2 consecutive days at this TungLok for dinner. The food is good but the service is horrible.
1. Slow
2. Only 3 staff are running the whole restaurant with a manager, Zhang refused to do anything!

Believe it or not, we as customer have got to clear our own plates and piles of Bones stacking on our plates and when asked that manager Zhang (a lady) and she just refused to lift a finger!

Pity the 3 staff were running around the whole restaurant to set up table, to take order, to serve and clear table while the manager was standing like a vase!
chun rong was very cheerful and helpful, service was very good

Only saving grace was the service provided by our server (despite the lack of staff), and the average food quality.

Other than that, horrible experience & will never go back again. Food took so long to be served for the set menu for 8 pax. Ordered a separate portion of fried rice without seafood due to severe seafood allergy at the second course & we did mention it to our server. But it took 1.5 hours to be served! What's worse?! It came with crab meat in the dish! Luckily the diner noticed it or she would have ended up in the hospital already!

Before that when I went to check if the fried rice was ready due to the ridiculously long wait, I saw 2-3 servers picking out seafood from a plate of fried rice (I thought it wasn't for my table hence didn't say anything). Hello, do you guys know what is severe seafood allergy & how serious it can be how?! How can you just freaking pick out from the plate of rice & serve it, misleading customers to think that it is cooked seafood free. But thankfully because you guys just picked out the crabmeat like that, the diner still managed to spot leftover huge chunks of crabmeat before she took more than one bite or all of us would have ended up opposite at TTSH worrying for her life already!

Poor diner only had dessert to eat for the entire 2.5 hours. Thanks for the "wonderful" experience that we would never have imagined to receive from such a well established & famous restaurant.
Chuan Rong has good service attitude, friendly and on task. Peak performance
Service excellent. Dong, Ivan, Ivy,yy
Love the peking duck, will definitely visit with my friends again!
I have been calling for a few days to make a reservation for 10 persons but no one picks up the phone.
Very rush to cleaning table , no one introduce menu , table small and tight
The food was really good.
Excellent food and service
peking duck is nice & delicious 👍👍👍
Professional services. Helpful staffs.
Not bad at all
Very tasty
Good service

SO
YUMMY
Nice
yummy

Good food. Excellent service. Nice environment.

Shout out to Daphne who provided outstanding services.

Excellent Service by Daphane. Everyone loved the Peking Irish Duck which was served 4 ways, especially the skin with the popping candy. Fish was very fresh and the Salted Egg Cereal Prawn was done very well   It was my mum 70th birthday celebration and Daphane placed the free longevity buns around the cake that we bought creating a very appetising.
Always my biz lunch option. Wonderful service and great food.
Delicious food and good service! Thank you!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: A no non-sense Chinese style “street” food with a little restaurant flare.  The “San Lao” Hor Fun is a must try (stir-fried flat rice noodles with fish & bean sprouts gravy sauce).  Expect a little waiting time if there are a lot of people.  Pass your time waiting for food by watching the service ladies talking (or shouting?) to each other in Chinese.  Recommended for cheap, local eats.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: I love the food here , cheap and good reasonable price and delicious . My favourite is Hor Fun 4.5 $ serving in a full plate , The aroma of rice noodles stir-fried is so nice.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
We are their old regular customers for 3-4 years. My family ( 7+2 ) always spend hundreds of dollars per meal.

They make an mistake and served wrong food but expect us to pay. Even raised voice at us “ you ate the food, you need to pay”. If that’s the case, the staff shouldn’t even put the food on our table right? We even did the right thing by informing you that u served wrong however some of us ate it as we didn’t know what our dad ordered

Didn’t even bother to give discount or apologise. Btw that horfun worth$18 lol and taste super bland. There’s isn’t wok hey taste either. Definitely will never come back and support them.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Clearly the food here is pretty good, especially the fish soup bee Hoon. The other dishes such as Thai tofu is nice as well. Downside of the place is that the seating comfort is pretty poor. And staff service is just simply atrocious, rude and unwelcoming. And food serving just takes such a long time despite the place being quite empty.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Tried a plate of their 三捞河粉. Plenty of fish slices, hor fun had nice wor hei and flavor was just right. Probably one of the best I had tried. Will return to try other dishes.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
We have eaten here many times over the years. They have good days and bad days.

Tonight's food was excellent, but possibly because dining in was disallowed, so the chef has time to cook slowly.

The Prawn Paste Chicken were very crispy, and juicy on the inside. The oil used weren't stale.

The Beef Dried Hor Fun was also done nicely with wok hei, yet not too oily.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Reached at 11.30am when there's only 2 small table of people. Waited 45 mins and 6 fish soups served at 12.25pm. staffs simply ignore queries when we followed up with the order. Demand mandatory tracetogether check-in, which we did as required. Demand social distancing for family of 8. We have to rush to attend event at 1pm hence we left at 12.35pm with two pending San Lou hor fun that is not ready (even dabao not ready). Lol. Overall fish soup is yummy and good experience as mentioned above. Also seen two tables of customers left angrily as they were ignored by staff for 10mins... Try it once at Least. We just sat patiently and waited the whole time, followed up every 15 mins. They will also ask patrons to change seat or tables as they wish. Just be prepared to wait and get your table chairs shifted once awhile. We are regulars.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
Second visit here and still tastes good!
We enjoyed every dish we had and will be back to try other dishes!

The chicken wing is yummy and the curry fish was great too!

Previously I ordered steamed meat with salted fish and it was enjoyable.

Parking may be a bit challenging.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Staff rude attitude, poor service & unfriendliness. We had 9 pax dining in, however they refuse to use the larger table top despite the cramp small table and further giving ridiculous reasons. For the sake of your dining experience, dont consider dining here!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Tried their famous Fried Fish Beehoon with XO sauce, it was really very delicious. The fish slices were fresh and thick. The fish broth coupled with the milk, was very flavorful and of course with the addition taste of XO, it enhanced it totally, making the fish soup so fabulous. Definitely worth coming down here for their Fish Beehoon with XO sauce.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Bad experience today around 11.30am, ordered 2 bowl of fish soup noodles , waiting for almost After 40min wait , asked the waitress abt my order of two bowls of soup noodles She was rude to say that I need to wait longer. But  I saw they served those expensive dishes 1st to the customers that came later than us . My point is they need to inform customers about the long waiting time before they take orders. Don’t let customers wait for too long as they may have other appointments.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Extremely rude waitress who thoght no end of herself! Placed order via foodpanda with pick up scheduled at 1246, 1 skinny sharp voice waitress in her 50s shouted at me that they didn't follow foodpanda timing, they had the choice to delay my order by 30mins! Don't understand why the restaurant paid such a staff to chase customers away!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Signature dish - big chunk fried fish meat XO beehoon. Love it to the max. Been frequenting their sister branch at Changi Road for years. Same old great taste. Best with cut chilli padi.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: The hor fun was passable. The salted egg sotong did not look so authentic but turned out to be not bad. Wanted to try the crab beehoon and found it too expensive for 2 pax.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: My fav fish soup in Singapore. Big pieces of fish and the xo soup is delicious. My wife loves the prawn paste chicken. Here we ordered medium fish soup $12 and small prawn paste chicken $12

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: This place has a great food with Low price ! The place is rather hot. We love the san lau mee, the shrimp paste chicken is so so this time round. The sotong kang kong is salty. Good for gathering. Seats are limited so go earlier if you can. Gather a few friends and go and share dishes. This time round we didn’t order prawn roll which I love!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: One of the better "Hong Kong Street" food in Singapore. Most of the dishes are pretty good, except the Assam Fish head. It is really bad.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Love their fish soup. Fish slice is very thick and soup base is flavoured and nice. One of the best Culttlefish samba kang kong. Fish head curry, hor fun and many other food are nice too.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: The food is alright but during lunch and dinner time you may expect to wait very long . If you intend to eat their pomfret steamboat you need to wait at least 30 to 45 min just for them to thaw the fish.Service so so don’t expect too much

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
Yam Cake ($20) • First time having this dish. Not a fan of yam but I really enjoyed this dish. There were fresh prawns pea cashews and a lot of mushrooms.

San Lou Hor Fun ($12) • We revisited this place because the previous we were here everyone ordered this dish and it looked so good. But sadly, it wasn’t up to expectations..the one at Upper Thomson had a better texture and more gravy.

#letsguide #burpple #foreverhungry #singaporeeats #instagood #chope #hungryeatwhat #hungryeatwhere #foodie #foodiesg #hungrygowhere #chope #entertainerapp #sgfood

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Yesterday's Fish Noodle Soup was a bit saltier but still taste good with added cooking wine.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Looks tasty but decieving. Taste is too bland. And the fish meat noodle was fishy despite having such big slices of fish. Somehow the taste is lacking in all three famous dishes that u have ordered....

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
It would be better if I didn’t hv to queue for that long. Their signature are all indicated in the pictures that r posted on menu.
Mine is beef noodles. Beef texture is like a bit hard but seasoning wise is okay for me. Maybe could use some salts.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
Went there to try cuz always loves to eat fishhead noodles. It was quite normal only. Went for friend's birthday lunch, it was a small coffee or restaurant as it is called so table for 5 pax is possible. Foods are all very normal just like any neighborhood zichar. Had more better ones compared to this. Will only visit once. Staffs was friendly and very fun-loving with jokes. Bill was cheap tho - $60 for 4 pax

IG: mommyserene

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: BAD STANDARD OF FOOD AND BAD SERVICE! Ordered a medium portion fish mee sua, requested for soup as it dried up even before we stacked eating it. Was attended to by rude staff that additional soup will not be provided and arrogant chefs who just look over. Overall a very unpleasant experience. I felt that they have been complacent and disregard their service and attitudes and food standards. Used to be our family favourite however we will definitely consider other eateries. Not a worthy experience to dine here.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Classic tzechar stall who does great dishes like Assam fish head, sambal potato leafs, salted fish minced pork and my personal favorite salted egg pork ribs. Will come back to try their famous XO fish soup!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
Food is good portion, taste average.
Person who take order has attitude problems.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Food quality varies according to the chef's mood I guess- some days are not too bad, other days are not as great. Also, it didn't really help that the customer service was quite bad. Made a takeaway order and waited half an hour. When asked staff politely approx how long more, she cannot seemed to bother to help check on order. Honestly, there are definitely better zichar places to visit that offers better food and much better customer service experience.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Absolutely a MUST AVOID place if you desire some form of service. The wait time for take away was over 40 minutes with no pre warning when the order was taken. Order sequence preparation based on who comes first doesn’t exist when people who arrived and ordered after us received their food before us. The staff were either simply just standing around OR moved like snails to fulfill and pack food that were already prepared and left on the tables. What an experience compared to the many Hong Kong street restaurants I have patronized elsewhere. In addition, the staffs’ attitude were beyond rude. Go at your own RISK!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Food is reasonably priced and good. My normal go to place for a meal. However, the services (staff) could be improved. Expect a less friendly, sometimes indifferent and rude demeanor. Otherwise, okay for a simple meal.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Best XO fish beehoon! The fish was thick and meaty and the soup is packed full of flavours! My ultimate comfort food!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Still like e San Lou Hor Fun, end up drive further to take away ...can try grab food too...enjoy then

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Go at your own risk. No matter peak hour or non-peak hour, the staffs don’t bother taking your order although they could clearly see you standing there at the counter. Super rude and arrogant staffs. Their fish bee hoon is also no longer as nice as before, fish was not fresh and food was served cold.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: i was strolling around the neighborhood and saw upon a food in this restaurant. After sitting down, i ordered the same thing with other guest. the food was "Hor fun", this shop a bit special with a lot of beansprout and fresh fish. I liked the fish, it was fresh and easy on the mouth. recommended to come again.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Bad experience. Suppose to be the pioneering  branch yet the service was terrible.The serving staff questioned me on the number of packets of red chilli that I need  when I ordered  3 packets of  food and requested me to take just one packet instead of 3 packets. Gosh, who was the customer in the first place? I had  been to other branches ie. Holland Drive, Bukit Merah, Jalan Sultan and Clementi (the best so far) and they did not disappoint me. As for the Balestier branch, kind of disappointed with their attitude, and it seemed like they did not improve as I read from other reviews sharing about the staff attitude. Hence they really need to buck up.The food and dishes though were good and consistent with the others branches.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: My favorite zi char outlet which is available in holland village and balestier. Serves Great food great price.must try the egg yolk fish skin and prawn paste chicken. Normally I will order a fish soup with milk base which boast of thick slices of fish. Many similar outlets are stingy with their fish but this chain really puts in generous portions

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
Horrible service! The rude waitress made us wait on a dirty table for 15 mins. When we walked to the counter to ask politely if we could order, they told us to go back to our seats and wait. Very poor service! This is despite the fact that there were not many diners.
Will never return again

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Love the yummy fish soup with milk and wine! All - time favourite! Only setback is the parking nearby are limited

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: My family had a fish head steamboat, la la,veg,crispy noodle all paid for $80+😄

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: The food are delicious, not expensive, served in large portions. Suitable for family.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Came here for famous fish soup.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Food is really good and value for money. Can't go wrong with the char kway tao or salty fish fried rice. Fully recommended.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Tasty bee Hoon and make sure to order the salted egg yolk fish skin

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Add a spoon of X0 for the extra kick. 3.50/spoon only! Generous amount. Solid

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: 45dollar 1 pot... Nice and wine X. O HOT POT VRY WORTH

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Hot, delicious and the right amount of flavor. Their business is buzzing even with restrictions. Always order hor fun or fish head bee hoon, and many others and every one of them taste good!

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Best fish soup in town. Fish is big and the soup base is tasty .

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Very delicious cuisine, but be prepared to wait if u dine in

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content:
My to-go place for Fish Head Soup Beehoon. Always comforting and portion is big. One of the better versions of this dish in SG.

But even with the quality food, it doesn’t compensate for the poor service and attitude from the staff.

I am not one of those that demand 5-star treatment at a Zi-Char stall but the service there is honestly lack-of or non-existent. I had to stand at the cashier counter, in full view of the servers, for a few minutes to get my check. And that was after I hollered to an auntie to get my bill. And apparently that auntie’s priority was to get a fish head served first and continue to hang me. The others saw and nobody acknowledged me. Nobody. Ultimately I had waited long enough to almost leave since nobody really bothered to take my money anyways. Even as someone attended to me, there was no apology or thank you. Simple gestures and none was expressed. Maybe I will do better with GrabFood or Food Panda in the future.

restaurant name: Hong Kong Street Chun Tat Kee 881 (XO) Fish Head Beehoon
content: Probably one of the best fish bee hoon soup in Singapore, richer tasting soup and they give you a generous amount of fried fish

The assam fish head has the right amount of spicy heat but could be a little more salty for my personal taste preference. The sweet and sour pork is nice and I liked the broccoli. The rest if the food is good but not spectacular. Serving size is generous.

A Standard Tzechar Restaurant with air condition. As expected the items are more pricey. $18 for cereal prawn, the prawns are not very fresh but still taste good thanks to the cereal. The prawn is big but there is only 5 pieces !

Service was prompt overall the taste is above avg.
Good service n delicious tze char, signature San lao hor fun lives up to it's name. Minus 1 star because chicken essence frog legs was very tough and rubbery probably because it's frozen
Consistently good. One can always count on them for a delicious meal! Black bean beef hor fun, prawn paste chicken, fish slice soup and cereal squid are the best!

Completely Great Restaurant!!!!!!!
This one is full with singaporean and famous within local community.
No tourist at all.
Service is quite good. (Dont expect expensive restaurant type service here)

Ordered
1) Prawn Paste Fried Chicken (really goodddd)
2) MaPo Tofu (love it!!! Tofu also quite a lot and the taste is just perfectly balance. Not really spicy)
3) HongKong style steam fish (this one really good with very cheap price! Recommended!!!)

A chain tze char outlet which you can find across the island. Though not all outlets serve good food. Affordable tze char fare along novena. Nothing to shout about but its definitely above average. The restaurant was considerably filled on a Sunday night at 8ish when other restaurants were closing for the day.

If you're in the vicinity and looking for some tze char, I'd recommend this restaurant.

A Standard Tzechar Restaurant with air condition. As expected the items are more pricey. $18 for cereal prawn, the prawns are not very fresh but still taste good thanks to the cereal. The prawn is big but there is only 5 pieces !

The furong egg taste crispy and flavorful. The prawn paste chicken was crispy and juicy as well. Service was prompt overall the taste is above avg.
I enjoy my black bean sauce hor fun and prawn sauce chicken alot. The coffee pork ribs was not to my liking as it was too bitter. The price was reasonable and definately will return

The restaurant was packed, probably the reason why 1 of the staff was disgruntled.. she slammed our drinks on the table & was a little rude.
The dishes were delicious.

My first time eating here and the San Lou hor Fun was superb! Portion was huge for $7, value for money!! The home-made barley drink wasn’t too sweet, just right! Will definitely come back again!! Highly recommended!!

Actually I ordered more dishes but I forgot to take pics haha because it's a restaurant that my family has visited for years and years. So sad that the construction has affected its business; covid19 has also ruined it further. Hope more people visit and give them some business. It's a comfortable family restaurant and the food has its standard. Go eat go eat!
Probably the best prawn paste chicken and fish beehoon soup in sg. All time favourite.
Delicious! Black Bean Beef Hor Fun is a must try.

The crowd has return is full house tonight.Anyway we do a booking earlier.Tonight we have orders coffee spare ribs, the meat was very tender, garlic vegetables with oyster sauce,minced meat with dip fried tofu,bitter gourd stir fried with pork ribs in blackbeam sauce,the ribs was  very soft and Indonesian stir fried chicken with sauce not really spicy.

Food is really delicious. The fish soup bee hoon has thick generous slices of fish. The coffee pork ribs is very meaty and soft. The prawn paste chicken wing are very Ccrispy, juicy and tender. Great place for meals with family and friends.

Food is precooked and then fry again for the prawn paste chicken wings
Seafood mee sua is actually hong kong yellow noodle
Gu lor york is hard

Overall the food are overated but the price is affordable for all the dishes we ordered
Waiting time is long after they serve the precook xia jiang chicken wings.
Uncle roger will love the MSG as after eating feel so thirsty
I have been here a few times and each time the food quality never disappoint. Simple yet tasty food. Will come back again!
Stir fried Vegetables was tasty but the steam fish was cultivated grouper. Lemon juice was too sweet.
Staff attitude very bad. Slice fish noodle soup more noodle then soup. Request for more soup even thought we are willing to pay staff gives lots of excuses and attitude. Last time patronising.

Food portion was kinda big for us. My parents, hubby and I sharing 2 noodles (hor fun & meesua), 2 veg, and 1 fish soup for dinner.. very filling. Prices are reasonable. Food taste good! Staff are friendly. Little walking from Novena Square. Will be closed for renovation 10-21 Sep 2018.
Consistently good through the years! The prawn paste chicken stood out the most for me. It was well seasoned with a light and crispy batter.

Food was tasty. We had kungpow chicken, chicken was tender and flavors were good. The claypot meesua didnt really taste like meesua. It was more like ee mian, so it was a little out of our expectations. Also ordered some stir fry veg with garlic. The wok hei wasnt strong enough so it was just average. Service was a little slow but bearable.
One of the best family Chinese food restaurants I visited in Singapore the decor is simple but the food is excellent in service was great

Awesome HK style restaurant! Casual and relaxed atmosphere. Service is decent and not overly tight like most restaurants.

Food is very good. Not overly heavy on seasoning as most places and has a very clean taste to let the ingredients speak. Think home cooking with no msg or added salt/sugar...

Har Cheong Gai was perfect! But skip the chili sauce that came with it doesn’t enhance the dish.

Coffee pork ribs was amazing! Fall of the bone while good crisp outside.

Choy poh home made tofu was yums! The nicely crispy choy poh bits gave great saltiness enhance you rice or noodles to go with the meal.

Samba sweet potato leaves great balance of sambal flavor but not overpowering.

Sam lo hor fun was very “clean” and not overly season. Subtly dish to let the fish and wok hei of noodles shine.

Highly recommended and definitely back again soon!

@iambruisedlee

Highly overrated. If this was a restaurant in Hong Kong I doubt they would have any visitors.

Not bad bad, just very average. Best dish we had was the baby Kai Lan, which was well-prepared and tasty. The rest was a bland mix of averageness.

I’m still sitting at the table and I’m already super thirsty. “May the MSG be with you”, as they say in Star Wars.

17/06/18
Better than average family restaurant. This restaurant has been around for more than 20 years. It is famous for their San Lau Hor fan. Assam Fish Head is good. This restaurant is worth trying.

Family comfort food! Good quality and reasonable priced.. famous for their fish slice noodle and kway teow dishes besides hei ko chicken wings etc.. had the curry fishhead which was fresh and meaty.. enjoy
Always my fav place for crab bee hoon and sliced fish soup. Love this cosy HK restaurant. Expect crowd during lunch and dinner. Do make reservation if you are going in group
Cai poh tofu so good. Salted fish fried rice was yummy too. They are generous with the salted fish. So flavourful
Always nice food! Today's best food is the salted egg crab!!😋

Hearty tzi-char fare. Dishes came in decent sized portions, flavourful but not overly salty...packed with wokhei. Found that their popular 'sam lo hor fun' was just average, a little too dry for my liking. Otherwise prices are reasonable (but on the higher end of the scale) and have a good selection of items. Was there around 7.30pm on a tues and place was quite filled. Food was served after about 20min wait.

Black Bean Sauce Beef Hor Fun $8.
Hor fun so smooth and soft. Beef is tender. Sauce is tasty.  V wok hey type!  Absolutely tasty!

I tried their Sum Lor Hor Fun ($8) before. Also v v good!  Hor fun is always so smooth and soft. V tasty and wok hey taste dish!

So far, I always walked out of this restaurant totally satisfied!

Highly recommended!
The 3-stars dishes on the menu are indeed tasty. But the prices are steep for tze char considering the portion size.

Hong Kong Street Family Restaurant at the corner at Novena Gardens (opposite Novena). We ordered 5 dishes for only 2 pax and ate them all. Very yummy and very suitable for weekend family dinners. Come early to avoid the queues. • Pork Ribs Butter Gourd ($10) // Har Cheong Gao ($10) // Cereal Prawn ($18) // Seafood Yi Mee ($6) // Sum Lor Hor Fun ($7) • Follow me on Instagram to swipe left for more yummy food! • #letsguide #burpple #foreverhungry #singaporeeats #instagood #chope #hungryeatwhat #hungryeatwhere #foodie #foodiesg #hungrygowhere #chope #entertainerapp #sgfood
Their stir fried combo of 3 whites: flat rice noddle (hor fun), sliced fish and bean sprouts is up to standard.
Flavourful and affordable zhi char food. Their fish soup is one of the better ones I have tasted. Mostly crowded though.
A family favourite for its delicious Zhi-Char dishes and efficient service by staff, you can bet we’d be back for more 🥰

Zichar food that is reasonably priced. The cereal prawn and seafood noodles was good. Forget the coffee pork rib, the meat was tough and too chewy. Service is non-existent. Once they take yr order, it's hard to get their attention for service. The ambience is very casual.

Inform staff to check with kitchen several times but did not bother to get back to us. Saw the opposite table who came in way later than us already got their food and we are still waiting. In summary, bad and slow service. Not recommended to go during peak lunch hours if you cannot wait at least 45mins for your food.

I ordered prawn paste chicken, sliced fish hor fun, cereal prawns, ngoh hiang and spinach with 3 eggs which came to a reasonable $65. All were S except for the hor fun which was L. I've eaten here a few times and the quality was as good as ever. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the ambience which is pretty basic and the noise level could be high during peak meal times.
Nice hor fun. Love it. Really crowded tonight. Incredibly popular. Simply because they serve really good dishes. Really good.
Gotta try the Hor Fun (Item #14.4)
Food is well prepared. It's basically good Zhi char in a simple sit-down setting.
San lou hor fun was really good, but the slice fish bee hoon only had a lot of fish slices going for it.

I used to come here often when I was living around that area. Years after, I managed to visit once more and I’m impressed that the quality is still there! The sum lor hor fun is a must for it has impeccable ‘wok hei’. I also thoroughly enjoy their fish soup bee hoon with milk. Service was also very attentive.

Easily one of the best zi char in Singapore. The food is very delicious, falvorful without being too oily or salty like most..you feel good after eating. Service is nice, and you get to sit comfortably in AC. It's not the cheapest one out there (maybe $1 more than your usualy zi char) but for the quality... I'd gladly pay the price. will come back again very soon. I highly recommend the prawn paste chicken!
Fish soup and San lou hor fun are superb. Good quality at a very affordable price. Will be coming back

Famous for their fish bee hoon, however felt I hv tasted better. Generous portion of veggies and soup, but not the bee hoon and slice fish. For big eater, you may have to order two “L” portions as they only offer “S” and “L”. The rest of their stir fries are generally tasty and reasonable, which pretty much can get it anywhere in Singapore.

One of our family’s favourite seafood restaurant in Singapore. We cannot go there and not order the salted fish fried rice and kang king sambal...Food is very good and affordable, service is mediocre but kind of expected for how busy this place tends to be.
