Prefer lunch crowd, a little quicker service. But food is always great.

Food quality is consistently good. Home style cooking and festive food, all available. Good for daily meals and family celebrations.

Parking at the IRAS building next door is plentiful. I have changed to parking in their basement due to all the roadworks. Drive slowly and Look carefully for Novena Gardens entrance to car park. Easy to miss.

Environment is typical Chinese settings with modern twist. Area is quite limited so do make reservation. Food wise can be quite salty and oily but taste is good. Each dish is nicely presented. If one thing they can improve is probably their customer service which I find lacking in terms of friendliness and attentiveness. Otherwise it’s a good place to visit, especially impressive place to go for meat-eaters.

This is the 2nd vegetarian restaurant I would recommend. The food are really very nice and tasty. As it is pretty popular, make sure you make reservation ahead. And do note that they only allow you to stay for 1.5 hrs which is actually more than sufficient to allow others to have a chance to taste the food as well.

It is our 2nd time to dine here. Tried new dishes and we like the spinach broth and yam dessert. The mala fish is a disappointment, it was served cool, not hot at all. Overall, food taste is good. Due to the crowd, staff are not as attentive.

Glad to have found this Vegetarian Restaurant that is just 2 mrt stops from my place. Generally the food is quite nice and the minimalist decor of the restaurant makes U feel relaxed. Will visit again to try more dishes.

Came here with a booking at 530pm on a weekday. Still possible to walk-in, as most of the bookings were at 7pm. Service was good, staff was able to give suggestions and took care to make sure you are comfortable. Quality of food is there. The soup is nice. The sambal cod fish a little overdone to my taste. Do not have any fav dish although they all all good. The best for my companion is the dry laska.

Nice vegetarian food. Not exactly healthy but definitely tasted good when dining in compared to our previous delivery order.

But I think they are quite understaffed. Quite hard to get the staff’s attention.

Good location - will be back

One of the highly recommended Vegetarian restaurant in SG!!!
Nice food with affordable price. Remember to make reservations in advance to avoid from long queuing.
Petai was one of the best i ever try cooked in vegetarian way. Their hor fun is quite special too in crispy fried hor fun.👍👍👍

Unique fusion allium-free vegetarian dimsum! Would recommend the Truffle Mixed Mushroom Dumplings. Unfortunately the information I got via social media direct message, via the staff in-person, and via the online Oddle menu all differ greatly in terms of which items are vegan... Best to verify with the staff when ordering if you don't consume egg and dairy. Hope this can be better clarified. Conveniently located near Novena MRT Station Exit B.

One of the better Chinese vegetarian restaurant. Personal favourites are the peking duck and sambal petai.

Waitresses are super attentive. Food and ambience is very good. However, some dishes can be quite pricey.

Booking is required to secure a table on 1st and 15th days of lunar month.

Food is very good, taste and quality wise. Sambal petai is very spicy but delish.

Normally I m not a fan of vegan food but lotus made me craving for vegetarian food. It’s more like Chinese fusion style and all of them are tasty and flavorful. I would make my effort to come for great veggie food.
We were there to celebrate our Mother's birthday. The staff were kind and made it a wonderful experience for all of us. The food is delicious too!

It's a new atmosphere. Better when it was in Quality hotel. New a la carte menu. The chilli crab bun was super delicious! It's made from oyster mushroom not mock meat. It has dim sum options too. Give it a try.

Came here on a weekday afternoon for lunch upon a friend's recommendation. We arrived at about 12nn to find the restaurant packed with customers! Thankfully we had made reservations. A nice comfortable setting where you can have a relaxing lunch with friends and/or family. Staff are not quite so attentive though and they seem to be short-handed. Food took a while to arrive, maybe also because of the crowd.
For 3 pax, we ordered a Grilled Fish in Sichuan Mala broth, a serving of mixed vegetables and a serving of Mala Crystal Bao. Portions were just right for us. I did not quite fancy the Mala broth - it was not spicy enough. Though the friends liked it, where one commented that the "fish" was done almost like a real fish. Hmm.. I am not a fan of plant-based meat.
While we had 2 dishes that claimed to be Mala, I did not think there was sufficient spice at all to be classified as... Mala??
Nevertheless, the environment was nice and made for a good choice to have a catch-up meal with friends.
Conveniently located on L2 of Royal Square @Novena.

One of the better vegetarian food here in SG with very reasonable price.
Must try are the Buttered Abalone Mushroom & Caramelised Yam Dices. Cannot stop once started.

Not recommended. Tried their parents' day set menu. Food was soso and portion was small. Overpriced ($230 for attached w 4 teas). Service was not very good considering that it's a restaurant. Elemen is so much better.

Ordered the following
1. Tofu homemade spicy XO sauce
2. Laksa
3. Truffle Fried rice
4. Kang Kong

All dishes were very cooked. There was an explosion of flavour when the Tofu entered my mouth. Laksa soup was smooth, light, super tasty.
Amazed by the unique dim sum. I ordered the afternoon tea and some dim sums. Loved the signature mee sua squares and truffle mixed mushroom dumplings♥️
Such a shame that I just found out this restaurant recently. The food was so good that you cannot tell there’s no meat at all. Mala grilled fish is the must and dim sum at lunch must try also!!!
Great Chinese vegetarian restaurant, fast table service & awesome variety of dishes on the menu. The dry laksa is highly recommended. Will come again.

Tried black pepper lion mane and stir fry brocoli. Interesting texture for the lion mane, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, different from the usual way of cooking lion mane. The black pepper sauce is not that prominent, can't really taste the pepper. Brocoli is fresh with some fried ginger slice and the sauce is not that salty. Service can be improved especially the staff manning the cashier counter.

They have a 2pax promo now where you get to choose 6 dishes + 2 bowls of rice + dessert. All for $39.90 before GST & tax. SUPER VALUE FOR MONEY.

Although, for a vegetarian restaurant, their one vegetable dish that we had (long bean) was not good. The long beans were quite old and too hard and fibrous when you bite into it. Please order another Vege to try!

Found their service to be prompt and good, probably improved since there were a few complaints about this from the reviews months ago.

Must order:
Butter Abalone Mushroom
Crispy soy nuggets
Truffle Hakka Abacus Seeds

Don't order:
Long bean with chai po
A very delicate type of vegetarian dishes that we tried in the restaurant. Refreshing menu and rather interesting. Well recommended for authentic vegetarian foods

They have put in effort in making their menu interesting with fun description and nice photos for their dishes that appeals to the palate.

The interor decoration of the restaurant is acceptable.

We are not impressed with the 2 dishes we have ordered. The butter abalone mushroom is nicely fried and crispy, however its too sweet and we do not like it marinated with curry. The ma po to fu is Sichuan Style with a very strong mala taste. We had mo po to fu from other restaurants which is more fragrant and less spicy.

Amazing and thoughtful customer service! Restaurant listened to the feedback given when being emailed (responded within the same day too) and the food was spectacular (both for takeaway and dining in)! Not a disappointment, even when my meat-oriented friends are being dragged along. The yam cube dessert and deep fried mushroom were the highlight of the meal!
Not a big fan of veg food but this place surprised me.  The star dishes were the abacus and cod fish. Looks and taste great!
Really pleasant experience. The food are really tasty and unique. Something special for the taste buds
Nice ambience with good variety of food. The  vegetarian carrot cake is good. Tried their Tom yum fried kway tiao and fried Laska.
Presentation & taste of the food is good. However the staffs seems to be under and were struggling with the dinner crowd.

Grilled "Fish" with Sichuan Mala Broth

First attracted by the photo and now charmed by the taste!!!
Very "FISH" !!!
Goes so well with the Mala Broth
Spiciness is just right,  watch out for the hemp pepper!!! It will numb your tongue and lips!!! 😫

Luckily the Ice Blended Soursop calm down the numbness  😅

Tried Blue Pea Flower Nasi Lemak @ Lotus Vegatarian. This is one of the best vegetarian nasi lemak you can find. The sambal is nice and not too spicy. Furthermore the sambal was put inside a small plate which I always hope other restaurant can follow this method because this cam prevent the oil from sambal flood into the rice. Thumbs up for the food presentation.

It was a vegetarian restaurant. We ordered grilled spicy fish and the taste was okay but to me abit spicy. It will be very good for someone who prefer vegetarian foods as the quality no doubt is very good. I am more of a meat eater 😊
Love their current 重庆烤鱼 item! There's a tomato based version for those who can't take the spice, or remember to ask them to 加辣, if you like your dish a little more fiery!
Good food, Good embience, but some stuff was not so friendly, cashier was so loud handling the customer on the phone. I think you need employee training.

Interesting place for plant based and vegetarian dishes. Very good range of rice, noodles, dishes and dim sum. Food is pretty decent - like the Hong Kong Ee Fu noodles and the rojak. Good range of soups as well. The set meal for 2 pax is also a good option that includes dim sum and a combination of other dishes and soup.

Buttered Abalone Mushrooms, Mala Fish and Mapo Tofu are a must try.
Nasi Lemak is also top notch!

Great food, great service!

2nd review dine in 13 aug.
Special call out to the fish in tomato broth , using bean sheets , served with toufu , tomato, mushrooms and white fungus , it’s really addictive .

fried shredded yam salad  was crispy and light .

1st review Ordered via food delivery dried laksa, diced mushroom
With toufu, fried banana fritter with red bean and steam bean curd roll.  The dried laksa was very good , flavour and aromatic .

I can’t believe that I have not put up a review of Lotus Vegetarian! We have been enjoying their food since 2020 when I took out from their Ubi kitchen. And of course proceeded to enjoy the lovely and bright ambience at their Novena restaurant when it opened.

Today, I stopped by to pick up some dinner. Decided to try something new, cos always eat the same reliable favourites - dry laksa, all the tim sum esp fupijuan (bean curd sheet roll), chasiewpow, jianpow, shuijing pow.

So we had dry laksa (haha couldn’t resist), French beans with radish, mapo doufu and cordecep soup. Everything is as delicious at home as when eaten on site. 10% discount for taking out too!

Update 10/7/21
Taking the chance to dine in before 5 people can eat together… it’s quiet tonite on sat nite with less than half the tables filled. But I’m sure business will pick up once HA is lifted, so gotta book or wait for seat.

Had the nasi lemak and mutton curry. Both were delicious. Nasi lemak was tasty without being overbearingly rich. Bleu pea rice was fluffy, chilli was sweet and spicy, fried fish pieces were fragrant, lightly blanched lady fingers were dressed in chicken rice chilli, and fried “chicken” pieces (bean strips) were crispy and tantalizing!  Again The mutton curry was tasty but light. There was a generous amount of potatoes and “mutton” pieces in the soupy but not diluted curry which we drank up!
Nice setup for a veg restaurant. Food is good and I like their variety  of soup .
Sumptuous vegetarian food. Had the chicken rice, nasi lemak and the buttered abalone mushroom. Chef puts a lot of effort in gettimg the taste right. Recommended.
Delicious Dim Sum and alot of others ala carte local dishes!
Even though food looks good, taste wise it was okay okay. The food was pricey too.
Very good vegetarian food. Fancy. I loved the tofu and the "cod fish" especially.

I'm a long-term vegetarian, and I like to taste the vegetarian restaurant Jiayao in the whole island. This restaurant is one of my favorite visits in the past, but this time I'm very disappointed with their snacks. Among the five snacks I ordered, four of them were filled with the same material, and even the taste and taste were the same! I've never been angry while eating like this time! Because their other dishes are not bad, I am willing to give them two stars! I hope they can see my comments!

I really like the spacious feel of the restaurant.
Came during dinner time and the dim sum was all sold out. Other dishes we wanted to order was sold out.

Food here is generally alright, we liked everything except the trio platter. Just skip that as it was not very nice.

Dry laksa is nice and I like the wrap as it reminds me of peking duck and their dessert yam was served in a amazing view with dry ice and smoke pouring out
Spacious and clean restaurant with friendly staff serving good quality vegetarian food. Quiet and cosy setting. Great for family and friends gathering.

Dim sum is good, we like the dim sum, but some suggestion:
1) should have tea pot tea instead of tea in a cup, Chinese 飲茶 style.
2) please cheer up your waitress, they look in bad mood, when serve should say please enjoy and when we say thank you they should say you are welcome . Basic manners must apply! I wish you all the best. I guarantee your business will be much better if you can improve dinning services.

First time here. Ordered 4 of their signature dish. Was so impressed with the quantity, quality and price of the dish that I signed up their membership. Will come back for more and hope to share more detail
Food here are really yummy, I recommend the herbal soup, vegetarian creamy soup, and snack sugary yam （糖霜芋头）.

A pretty awesome place that serves vegetarian food. They have a huge variety of dim sums and also set lunch at decent prices. We order an executive lunch set for 2 pax and order another dish. It was very filling and does not leave a oilly after taste. We will be back again for such to try the other dishes.

Tried the fried fish with green chilli (ijo?) set.

The fish was well fried and tender. However, the portion was a little bit too small. Taste wise, it was a rather sensational experience!

Worth a try.

My husband ordered Tom Yum Fried Rice from here for us and asked the lady multiple times to not add any seafood/fish aside from prawns into the rice. When he got home we found seafood in the dish, what a waste of food and money as we cannot eat.

You should really look into ur food portion. Food delivered was only less than half of the box.
And pricing was not comparable to the portion. I hope u can improve on that.
Also we ordered to break fast and obviously not enough for even 1 person share.
Rather for a kids portion.
Truly disappointing.
Love the chicken rendang and perkedel, will definitely come back to try other dishes.
Hidden gem at the basement of Square 2. Ordered the green chilli chicken set super yummy. They are Halal certified and serve Thai food as well!
Love their beef rendang and BBQ chicken..Their homemade chilli is super duper yums. definitely highly recommended! Must try!
Beef Rendang is extremely tender! Pekedel is cripsy on the outside and fluffy inside.
The food is yummy and authentic. They have healthier choice like brown rice. Good to know they don't use MSG
Ever since the change of staff, the food portion become smaller :/ Price stayed the same but still tastes more or less the same
Super nice beef rendang... juicy and the spice  level is great
Your green chilli chicken damn sedap. I love patronising ur stall
Served precooked BBQ Chicken which was hard and cold.
good food and affordable, will definitely come back again!
Good.

Quesadilla felt empty unlike other outlets. Ingredients were unevenly spread too. The others were okay. Speed was fast tho, received my food in less than 10mins even though there were other customer(s) before me.

I love Guzman Gomez's burrito bowl! Filling and tasty. Will try to request for more onions😍 in future as we used to be able to scoop the amount we want, but due to Covid they now prepack them (garnishes and sauces) in separate small containers. Love my burrito bowl with plenty of 🌰

food quality and ambience is similar to other branches.

tried mexican cola for the first time, the sweetness is so distinct, it’s not my favorite 🤗
For the price and quality of food, you’ll find nothing else that compares in Singapore. They even have Jarritos. The staff is also great and make for a very positive experience.
First time trying here. Good food. Love the burrito bowl and soft tacos.

I dine here at least 3 times a week. I love the food. However, the staff aren't consistent with their serving. There are days the rice will be so much more and hardly any meat. Another time, their burrito can be pretty light.

I just had this for lunch with my family and it was not bad. It’s basically classic Mexican food and it’s good, just that we don’t particularly enjoy eating Mexican food so it was okay. The fries was good, crisp on the outside and soft in the inside. Taco was excellent, and nachos were good. Just note this, if you are thinking of getting a Burrito regular sized, know that it has a ton of beans and rice inside; portion overall very big! Service is efficient.

My daughter vomited and suffered all night after eating the burrito bowl delivered in the evening. I couldn't complain because I was in a hurry to go to the hospital, but it is a very angry experience. I enjoyed it as a delivery food for a long time, but recently, the taste differs every time I order, so I tried not to eat it, but it became the last burrito bowl. Pay attention to the quality of your food.

minis promo for burrito seems smaller than usual 🤔
limited seats for dining in
staff didn't know table numbers during serving
but at least there's table service 😆
Nice burrito bowl but wish there were more tomatoes.

Presentation can be better improved. The beef portion size (which requires top up) was even smaller than the chicken (which requires no top up).. the taste wise is okay but can do with much more meat as only vegetables can be seen in the tacos.

I think I was discriminated against here. I am a regular of Guzman y gomez outlet in Yishun North Point. I always received good service and food from there and expected same from here. I went in at around 11.50, much before lunch rush. There was only one other dine-in customer. Even after 25 mins I didn't receive my order, while customers who came in after me kept getting their orders. When I finally complained, they gave me my order without cutlery or tissue. Will not visit this outlet again.

Horrible experience from fhis outlet! Staff are disorganised, they actually forgot about my orders! Apparently I am not the only frustrated customer that's waiting incessantly long. You guys need to put in a system of checking order fulfillment to have a basic level of customer service.
Very average food, it's slightly pricey. The burrito was very bland, the rice in it was bland. The only thing good on the entire menu is nacho fries

I placed my order via Deliveroo. I realized i had the wrong item order immediately after i pressed the sent button. I then immediately asked Deliveroo to help cancel my order via live chat. But the Deliveroo chat told me the order could not be canceled as the delivery was already on the way. How can the delivery be on the way 1-2 minutes after the order was sent in?

I tried to call the restaurant five times, but nobody answered the call. This will be the last time i order from this restaurant.

First time trying this mexican food chain and I must say Im pleasantly surprised! Ordered from foodpanda but the food was still fresh! Got the mild nachos with grilled chicken. For $16, the price was quite expensive but it was really filling which was unexpected!! The guac was delicious too :) Will definitely try their tacos and burritos next!!

Default Order: Burrito Bowl (different variants)
Times ordered ready: 40+
Food Quality: Great
Timeliness: Excellent, never delayed
Taste: Excellent

Recommendation: Spicy Chicken Burrito Bowl with additional pico de gallo

Good place for an introduction to Mexican food. A little pricey but flavours are strong and good. Nachos and fries are great. Unfortunately they do not have salsa here so the strong acidity and spice is missing

Best Mexican food in Singapore!

To be sure, there aren't many options for Mexican food on the island. Nevertheless, Guzman y Gomez food is generally high quality and eminently edible ... Though it may not compare to taco truck food in LA!

I stick to the spicy beef option for most dishes with the burrito or burrito bowl being my preferred choice. The quesadillas are also decent.

If in Singapore and craving Mexican food then GYG is your only choice. Thankfully, they have multiple outlets across the city to satisfy your craving.
First time here. Nice place and crowded on a weekend lunch period. Ordered the Burrito chicken wrap and bowl chicken. Recommended to have with spice. Nice overall!

Staff were very professional and service was top notch even if it's a more fast food style place. Love the fries, especially the chipotle seasoning and soft chicken taco :)) I don't normally eat tomatoes but it's really delish as they take out the tomato seeds and its so nice together as a whole taco
Used to quite like the food at GYG but the standard at this outlet has just fell off the cliff. Had the burrito bowl which had a pathetically small portion. Food was rather cold. Disappointing.
Not much to say about it except it is just super tasty. Love their soft taco with grilled chicken or steak!

On the GYG website it says the sauces are "free at every GYG". However, when asked, staff said its chargeable.

This outlet used to have great service but i think they got a new manager/supervisor somewhat recently and its just been downhill from there.
Always good. Value, clean tasting lunches. Chicken burrito bowl ftw
Can't go wrong with a good ol burrito bowl :-) Food's great, and thank you Kelvin and team for the warm welcome always!

A little "expensive" for the portion you're getting. Food tastes okay. Quesadilla had very little cheese which was quite disappointing. The fries were fresh though (which I really liked). The Churros were quite good but nothing special about it.

The best compliment I can give this chain is that it's the Jamie Oliver of Mexican food. Proudly underwhelming, uninspired, overpriced yet somehow, you'll find one everywhere. While i can see how they might appeal to the undemanding and uninitiated, there is definitely much, much better Mexican food out there (and yes even in SG).
Tasty food. The salad was nicely done. The burritos was delicious too.

First time trying with the wife as the reviews sounded promising. Ordered a spicy beef burrito set and a spicy pulled pork bowl set. Both were very disappointing... Very little meat in both, just lots of tasteless rice and beans... Miserable amount of salsa given. Food was barely even warm considering we were dining in... Chips were obviously stale. Not sure if they forgot to put the spice but both the orders were not spicy at all... "Chipotle" Fries, while cooked well, crunchy outside soft inside, tasted completely plain and devoid of any seasoning... Not sure if the outlet ran out of salt or what... The only thing that we both managed to finish was the lemon tea... Have tasted real Mexican food and this is not even close sorry. Went to McDonald's after...

Hi there,

I love your food and there's no doubt on the quality. But recent my 2 delivery orders missed one item each. Last time set menu fries was not packed and today chipotle mayo was not packed. While understanding busy delivery orders, it is important to ensure customers to receive what they have ordered. Would appreciate more attention to pack better next time. Thanks.

My takeaway order had been missed and I needed to wait for a long time until staff noticed. Then, they forgot to provide utensils for burrito bowls.Not sure if it is due to staff shortage, but unless you dont remind them, they dont seem to bother tracking the things in order. Food is not bad but service is lacking.

Food is fine. One staff was very rude and mocked my accent to other employees as I was ordering. I guess she thought I couldn’t hear her. If the owner of this restaurant sees this, pls get to the bottom of who this is (appeared to me a manager as she was holding paper, female, in her 20s?). Looks like some re-training and disciplinary action are needed. Very bad experience.
Great food for the price. Hard to find food Mexican fast food in Singapore so this place never fails to satiate that craving

It's a classic mexican fast food place, just that it's quite conveniently located right next to Novena MRT station. We had the burrito bowl, and the nachos fries, both of which were pretty good. It's the kind of food that I'll have for a quick lunch, but I'm not sure if I'll enjoy a proper sit down meal here necessarily.

Food via delivery was always good, but somehow dining in turned out to be a horrible experience. Didn't take long for them to come up with our food but it came in cold for my friend and I with much lesser meat than usual.
Best to avoid dining in I guess.
Always manage to get the place to sit. However the pricing has stayed flat but the quantity has reduced.

First time eating here and I was not disappointed at all the food was delicious especially the burrito bowl. Staff was very friendly. The place was clean. It was an amazing place to dine in. I would recommend this place!
My first experience  trying mexican food was at vatos urban tacos & was utterly disgusted by them.  hence was a little decisive on coming here. Glad i came ,the quesadillas & food here are delicious!

Whenever I am homesick for some solid 'great quality' tex mex - I look no further than Sydney stalwart GyG.

The staff at the Novena branch are courteous, happy to take dumb questions, and exceedingly speedy with their order fulfilment.

Eating in, also a great experience (now that we can)

Overall, great outlet, great staff, five stars!

My to go order was missed and I ended up waiting for 20 mins. The person packing the food was right in front of me and didn't bother to enquire about my order number but instead avoided looking up at all. Only when I asked then they realized the miss but tried to avoid acknowledging it by saying they will start preparing it...which took 2 mins to be ready.
Good, staff are helpful, would recommend, tho needs more seats
A bit overpriced for the food... Fast and efficient for some Mexican themed food.
delicious food and great service from staff , definitely will come back again 👍🏻👍🏻
Food is good. Service is fast.

I ordered 2 veggie burritos for takeaway today - 1 was alright but unfortunately the other was a soggy, deconstructed mess. The filling was falling out as I was unwrapping the burrito and the tortilla wrap was soggy, broken and very unpleasant to eat.

Rating 2 stars for inconsistency.

Sometimes I want to be induced into a food coma. When I need that, this is where I come. Pork burrito does the trick. Eat one and a nap is sure to follow. Puts me to sleep faster than my wife chatting in bed.
Service was prompt. Food is as expected, delicious and fresh. Limited seating due to distancing requirements so go early to avoid crowds.

This rating is rounded up from 3.5. The food is fresh and fast and the sauces to add to the dishes are delicious, but there was hardly any chicken in my burrito, it was mostly (plain) rice. Disappointing for Mexican, but OK if you have a craving in Singapore.
Just had the burrito bowl with pulled pork for lunch. Really good and the pork was so tender! A tad on the salty side but the corn chips helped!!

Tried the fried fish with green chilli (ijo?) set.

The fish was well fried and tender. However, the portion was a little bit too small. Taste wise, it was a rather sensational experience!

Worth a try.

My husband ordered Tom Yum Fried Rice from here for us and asked the lady multiple times to not add any seafood/fish aside from prawns into the rice. When he got home we found seafood in the dish, what a waste of food and money as we cannot eat.

You should really look into ur food portion. Food delivered was only less than half of the box.
And pricing was not comparable to the portion. I hope u can improve on that.
Also we ordered to break fast and obviously not enough for even 1 person share.
Rather for a kids portion.
Truly disappointing.
Love the chicken rendang and perkedel, will definitely come back to try other dishes.
Hidden gem at the basement of Square 2. Ordered the green chilli chicken set super yummy. They are Halal certified and serve Thai food as well!
Love their beef rendang and BBQ chicken..Their homemade chilli is super duper yums. definitely highly recommended! Must try!
Beef Rendang is extremely tender! Pekedel is cripsy on the outside and fluffy inside.
The food is yummy and authentic. They have healthier choice like brown rice. Good to know they don't use MSG
Ever since the change of staff, the food portion become smaller :/ Price stayed the same but still tastes more or less the same
Super nice beef rendang... juicy and the spice  level is great
Your green chilli chicken damn sedap. I love patronising ur stall
Served precooked BBQ Chicken which was hard and cold.
good food and affordable, will definitely come back again!
Good.

Come here for a quintessential Malay breakfast! Mee Rebus and Lontong were available when we got here at 10am on a Thu. Lontong was good and decent and the Mee Rebus was definitely above-average. Worth a try! This place is hidden find indeed!
Great local Malay food. We came with our 3 kids, tried the Mee Rebus and the Gado Gado. Left very satisfied. And all for a very affordable price! Will come again.
Excellent Gado-Gado and Mee Siam
Very good and affordable mee rebus.
Excellent Malay food

(Translated by Google) Excellent Rice Rice! Hidden gem!

(Original)
Excellent Nasi padang! Hidden gem!

Five stars for ambience and portion size!

The Malayan Council at Windstedt is all about the vibes, an atmosphere so nice you’ll definitely enjoy chilling there.

Food portion was HUGE, it was our first time there and we definitely ate our fill, have two mains along with drinks and a complimentary side!

Service was good, food tasted good and we even got complimentary cakes to bring home. Price point definitely worth a mention, this place is good for occasions as it’s on the high side. Definitely fitting for occasions! :)

There for a reunion visit of our secondary school premises. Service was not the most efficient as we were served a satay platter instead of a satay pizza as we had ordered. The ambience was relaxing and food was good. Although it wasn’t a busy night, staff did not really pay much attention to us. Would still come back again.

I love the classy and classic ambience it brings... Truly a place for a date with our love one. Abit pricey but for the quality and quantity given is worth every penny. They are so generous that they gave us a free side dish.

Very generous food portions and personable service. I enjoyed the smoked duck pasta a lot - rich strong flavours that dance in your mouth. And I had a nice big chocolate shake (not pictured) to wash it all down.

Had a great lunch with my husband and celebrated his birthday there. The environment was peaceful as there's a few people at that time. The foods were good and the portion was enough for 2 pax.  I wanted their baked oyster coriander but sadly, it was unavailable. They gave us complimentary chicken wings and cakes. It was sweet of the staffs and customers there to sing birthday song for my husband haha. The malay supervisor was friendly but the other staffs were a bit quiet. It would be a perfect 5 stars if they had ask if i finish my plates before giving the cake because i still had some food left.

TMC was a surprise find for me and my wife. We were looking for a place to pass the time while waiting for our daughter to finish her dance class, and chanced upon this resto.

Food is really tasty. Coffee is really good. Staff is really friendly and customer-centric. Ambience is quiet and serene.

Bathrooms though were not too clean, so hoping that can be solved with periodic maintenance.

Will definitely revisit the place to try out their main dishes.

The food portion is huge for main course and good for sharing. Taste was ok but nothing wow us. It was full house when we visited and the service was a little underwhelming. The restaurant is obviously short of hands. The staffs are very strict to covid measures, which is certainly good for us. Overall experience was ok. But visit again? Maybe no.

Very lovely ambience for a relaxing dinner. friendly staffs whose services are really awesome. Food was marvellous in terms of taste as well as presentation. Food portion is big and value for money. I'd suggest to order bit by bit if you're not much of an eater. Definitely coming back again with my family

Beautiful ambience. Food is delicious, service staff was excellent - so professional. Waited pretty long for our food to arrive; my food arrived an hour later while one of our friend's food was delayed by almost 2 hours (I'm attributing it to Ramadhan confusion) but the service staff brought complimentary fried chicken and cakes for us to 'alas perut'. Will come back with the family post ramadhan :)

Went to this restaurant on Monday with my family for lunch.

We ordered 2 Smoked Duck Lemak Cili Padi Linguine, 1 Laksa Goreng Barramundi, Cereal Fish and Chips and Malayan Satay Supreme Pizza for mains.

We got complimentary Malayan Wings for starters and Ondeh-ondeh cake for dessert.

All the food was very good and tasty. Portions are big and filling.

We were served by Firdaus, the Manager and Alexa, who rendered us with good service and suggestions.

Will definitely come back again in future, God willing.

First time to the restaurant and we had a great time.
We had top notch service from Ash & Fir. They were friendly and efficient.
The food was delicious & big in portion. All were served within minutes.
Dessert was absolutely delicious.
We had complimentary chicken wings & cake. It was very generous of the restaurant.
Will definitely come back

No problem with parking, ambience is good, nice and quiet surroundings. We came during the fasting time and we were the only table for lunch. Main courses are big portion. Perhaps for the barramundi dish can improve on the presentation. The mushroom sauce is similar to the mushroom soup in taste and texture. Liked the ondeh cake as u can can bite the bits of gula melaka within. Pizza crust is biscuit like texture.

Service is acceptable. Food portion is quite big, however its just average. Do try the soft shell & mudcrab fried rice. Skip the cereal fish and chip and truffle fries. I was told that there is always complimentary dessert, but I didn't get it as the staff claims that they are running short of it. However was given complimentary chicken wing. Price is slight high $$$. But good thing is the service charge is included in cost of the dishes.

Overall food is not very warm probably due to huge crowd.

Truffle French fries not very crispy, would be better if it’s double fried. No truffle taste.

Fish from Fish and chips does not look appealing, slightly pale if you look closely at the picture. Would prefer if it’s crispy type of batter.

Seafood Pizza tasted normal.

Crispy salmon is quite disappointing, small portion and tasted like those sweet and sour fish from Cai fan stall (not even tze char standard).

Malayan wings tasted normal. The restaurant even gave us one more serving as complimentary. Thank you!

Better tasting one would be Lemak Linguine. However would only recommend this for sharing otherwise is too lemak to finish it.

Lastly, we ordered one serving of cake and the restaurant kindly gave us another serving as complimentary. 👍🏻Thank you!

Nice place to dine in. However food can be better.
Third time coming to this outlet. Good place for large gathering if book ahead. Mains portion is very large. In-house cakes and dessert is the best.
Interesting fusion food. They are really generous in giving food freebies. Portion is huge and one main would be good for two pax, unless you’re really hungry.
One of the best Halal restaurants in Singapore. Great food and service. Portion sizes are relatively big so good to share.

Im really fussy when comes to food..
And i came here to try for the first time.. i heard is nice.. 😏 i dont need to comment much but ill give more than 5 stars!! Absolutely wow! Truffle mushroom soup, im dying for that!!🥰

But wait, my husband waited for his food for an hr.
Yes their waiting time is damn slow. Not enough manpower to serve outdoor customers.

Get to know the chef missed out his order.. kinda sad but luckily my dish portion is quite big so i shared with him.. hope it wont repeat the same thing to others..

They are severely understaffed. The staff tried their best, but couldnt do much. The wait time for food is horrendous. Cutlery is dirty - not just watermarks, lipstick stains on cup, leftover food on the spoon.

Food is good.

4 stars for food, 0 stars for service.

A pleasant evening with family...celebrating wife's birthday. The food was incredibly marvelicious & the dessert....Superbly delicious..
Thanks to the Supv Firdaus & his team on duty wif 5stars service...will definitely recommend my friends & staff to dine again...MasyaAllah.

We picked TMC @ Winstedt for our staff retreat lunch and had a wonderful time thanks to the team of Ady, Zin and special mention to Shazz and Alexis! The food and ambiance were good and some of us even ordered extra food to take home. We had to make some last minute changes to our seating arrangements and Alexis was very accommodating. She always had a friendly and welcoming smile and attitude and was full of energy throughout. Well done, Alexis and team! 😄😄😄
This TMC has a chill vibe. It has both indoor and outdoor dining space. Food is fantastic as its other outlets. They also are capable of housing events.

Have tried all TMC/TFC outlets. But Winstedt outlet, countless times…but first time review 😂.

23 Oct, 345pm

Food: Delicious CONSISTENTLY. Never disappoint me every time. Portion of food is alot, and they gave complimentary plate of wings.

Atmosphere: Nice ambience and cosy feeling. Great for couples dating or want some quiet meals together.

Customer service: As usual lead by 1 superb supervisor ADY together with JESTER and AMAN, they’re friendly and helpful as always. Although they are busy with wedding prep event which starts at 5pm, they still put the EFFORT to ask patrons if food was alright and if we need anything etcs 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼. Bottomline is, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Yes its a little bit pricey, BUT for the quality of food, food portion, service rendered etcs will justified the price. They do give vouchers too. If you are lucky, at times they will give away cakes, its sooooo delicious 🤤. Today i bought their durian pengat cake, A MUST TRY.

And since we’re here for my wife and mine belated birthday, TMC gave 2 complimentary cakes and ice cream scoops!! Isn’t that GENEROUS??

May TMC prosper and grow even more in years to come. 🤲🏻

It is always our pleasure to dine at the Malayan Council.  It is our 1st time at the Winstedt outlet and were pleased with the outstanding service and food served.  A special shout out for Ms "Misha Omar" for her spontaneity.  Really had a great time dining at the restaurant.  We will surely be back!
Great Halal Wine on the special day with my hubby. Good Food and Good view and serenity.

Being a secondary school alumni of this location, our group of ex-classmates will always try out the establishment at this location (which has gone through several changes over the years). This time, the Malayan Council i hope can last longer as it was the most crowded as compared with previous few establishments.
They served what i think was malaysian/indonesian fusion food. I had the more classic tahu telor as was quite full that day and my mates had the warm avocado salad, sambal goreng pasta and seafood tanghoon. Overall, service was good and prompt, nice ambience too. Food though, i find it average at best, maybe caused we had high expectations to start with. Hope they continue to improve on their offering.

I can never have enough to say about TMC.
Customer Service - TIPTOP. Fast and personal.
Food - Fusion and put together very well.
Ambience - The Windstedt Branch is by far my favourite. Very bright, cozy, family-friendly, and simply GORGEOUS.

The Beef Ribs Roti Kirai
Braised short beef ribs, glazed and homemade secret ingredient sauce serve with roti kirai
$39.00
never disappoints.

The cakes, where should I start.
The Ondeh-ondeh, the chocolate cake, all melts in your mouth.
Not too sweet, just nice.

The owner Hafiz, and the staffs are all very friendly.
And we even got a free slice of cake for birthdays and anniversaries.

The price is quite a setback but for the price you pay,
you will definitely get every cents' worth through the glorious food, ambience and service.
Came here to attend A wedding lunch, foods not bad but service is not so good maybe lack of staff, just A few serving almost 100 peoples.

First visit to Malayan Council for my birthday celebration and on top of the generous portion and quality food, the excellent service from the staff who served us is clearly why we'll visit again. Thank you for the lovely drawing and cake.

Such a beautiful place to dine in, with the playlist being on point all the time. Everything we had was so good, left the place with a happy tummy. Received a wonderful service from Mr Ash from the Windsledt outlet. We had a few food on the house and left the place with more freebies. Talk about a company that believes in the more you give, the more you'll receive. Wont hesitate to come back again!

Super awesome dine in experience from the moment I step in until I leave the place.

Food plating is instagramable. Food is delicious and very tasty.

A cosy place for catch up with love ones.

My children love this place. Service staff are warm and friendly. The food is good and portions are generous. I enjoyed the duck and lychee salad.

So far, all our experiences here have been positive! Def recommend.

Sorry, no pics.... Too busy eating!

The atmosphere was calm and relax. The waiter/waitress were bubbly and friendly to all the customers. We had a great time and wonderful food during our last visit for my spouse's birthday celebration. As usual, a complimentary cake for the birthday person.

Attended a wedding there. It was intimate & cosy. Though only comment for improvement would be to check the quality of the food as we were served seafood (prawns & lobster) which I personally felt was not too fresh. Other than that staff did well to host everyone, check on all tables & ensure we were well fed. Thanks for the experience!

The restaurant is beautiful! It looks like a wedding venue too~ thank you for the superb customer service and I'm really thankful for the complimentary appetizer and cakes. Such a lovely and generous restaurant 💕 really appreciate the gesture. The waiters were very polite and had good service too. Enjoyable dining experience ~ always a good meal at the malayan council

Had a reservation for a birthday celebration. Food was great! The drinks were expensive but felt that it was worth the experience and turned out to be great. Got a couple of complimentary items too, most likely due to the birthday reservation (Malayan wings and put piring cake). Upon payment, got an additional 2 complimentary cakes (ondeh ondeh and put piring) to bring home, not too sure why though but loving the freebies 😁

Though service can be slow when it gets crowded (hence the 4 stars), the ambience was great for the occasion. Overall, will definitely be back for more special occasions.
Dinner serving is awesome. Great ambience for a meet up.

Many many thanks to Ash, Ady and Alexis for the great hospitality. Always feel so welcome @ Malayan Council and food, as always, is amazinggg! So if you are a foodie and an Instagram addict, this place is for you, people!

Went to the Winstedt outlet. The service don't even deserve 1 star. Very bad experience. Went to celebrate a family member's birthday but ended up waiting 2 hours before we finally got our food. Very disappointed.  The restaurant had a birthday celebration going on, so we would've understood a slight delay in preparing our orders. But the restaurant paid more attention in preparing food for the birthday event with little regard for the other paying customers. We saw more than 20 customers cancelling their orders due to the super long waiting time. The restaurant could have been better organised... or dedicate different sections of the kitchen to cater to the different types of customers (i.e. event booking and walk-in). Service sucks.

Worst service ever experienced. Waiter served dessert right after our starter. We declined having it and he rolled his eyes. It wasn’t a busy night but didn’t refill our cup of water. Requested to make order for takeaway but didn’t come back. Returned the same plate of dessert with melted ice cream at the end of our meal. Requested to change the ice cream. Came back with messy plates smeared with the melted ice cream around the plate, and added new ice cream on top of it. Served without spoons. Had to wait for spoons. Embarrassing cause I brought my bosses to this restaurant. Never coming back.

Dined here for the first time with a group of friends. The ambience and food were great but the service was even better. We were well looked after by the crew; very friendly and attentive.

Likely not a typical occurrence but they were very generous on the evening we visited. They kept serving us food we did not order and then explained to us they were on the house 😂

Food quality and portion was great as always. However, the crowd that weekend was bustling and that made the main course arrived late, an hour late to be exact. Ambience was nice, staff service was tip top, they always try to accommodate requests at their best. Location-wise, not that easy to get to but you can drive or take a Grab down. It's located not too far off the Newton Food Centre.

We came in for a late dinner on Monday 17 Jul 22. Despite not making any reservations, the team still accepted our group of 3.
We were served by AYU who was very pleasant and accommodating.
Hats off to the team for their amazing service!
The food was awesome and the portion was humangous. Each main course is filling enough for 2 pax.

We had two consecutive bad experience at Malayan Council, both at different outlets. Didn’t want to patronise the place again after our first bad experience but since we were invited to a family’s birthday dinner, we thought ‘why not’ to giving it a second chance. Sadly, our second experience only reinforced our views on the restaurant.

The outlet at Windstedt was severely understaffed and it reflected poorly on their service. None of the staff were available to attend to us and a few other diners who, like us, have been raising our hands for some time to get their attention. My husband was directed to the counter instead when he walked up to a staff to make additional orders. He ended up going to the counter but even that, he was made to wait a good 5-10 minutes to be attended to. When we requested for our desserts to be served, the dessert plates and utensils were placed on our tables, but the cakes only came about 20 minutes later with half melted ice cream. We saw that it was already prepared on the counter but it wasn’t served to us. Extremely disappointed as the cake surprise was simply ruined by the long wait. We would like to highlight that we are not blaming the staff working that night but hope that management would look into the understaff matter seriously, especially during weekend service.

Malay cuisine with a modern twist. Love the quietness on a Tuesday lunch, just 6 in the restaurant including the 2 of us. Nice aircon restaurant for hot day. Price is a little high I find though they did a pleasant surprise at service and take-away. We ordered :-

Lychee mint
Iced long black
Cereal fish & chips 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
- no pic but the cereal fish was very delicious and came with a lot of fries
Prawn Tahu Telor 👍🏻
- delicious but perhaps look into the proportion of tahu to egg crisp
Chicken Wings (comp) 👍🏻
Durian Cake (comp)

Thank you for the lovely gesture !

Visitation : apr 20, 2021

Food is unique and portions were big, but not mind blowing and price is on the steep side.

Ondeh-Ondeh cake is a crowd favorite with gula melaka bits in between the layers!

Staff are also attentive and polite!

Amazing experience for my birthday celebration two nights ago! Food was delicious as always, portions were huge too. The lambshank mandhi I ordered was tender and soft. Ondeh2 cake tasted great too. Always loved the Malayan Council hospitality, as experienced at other outlets 👍🏼 Thank you to the friendly staff for making sure we enjoyed our dinner there!

Ive been to the bussorah outlet a few times. Decided to celebrate my birthday at winstedt this time. It was simply fabulous. Our server was new but she was so bubbly and friendly it was a joy to have her host us this evening.

An excellent place to host farewell.  5 of us visited the restaurant at Windstedt. Was impressed with the service by a serve staff Siti. Very warm and bubbly personality. Good in recommending thecashtypes of menu to choose both for main and desserts.  Malayan Council must be blessed to have her as server . Credit shod go to the cashier fir her waym personality.  Overall we had a great time there. We will definitely patronise the restaurant again. Thanks to them and the wide range of fusion food served

Generously huge serving portions, food tasted quite average, slow service as restaurant seemed under staffed. Service quality by staffs also sub par. Was given complimentary wings and a slice of cake without asking though.

Wow came here and eat at 4pm still they serve the food item hot and yummy.

Chicken wings is must :)
I like their Mee Soto
Mee siam was too sugary sweet.
Awesome Nasi Lemak and Nasi Padang!

Interesting Nasi Lemak! Good choices available. I like the flavour of the rice and it's chicken. The combinations is interesting. I do find it a bit pricey but they make up with taste. Will try again when possible.

This place has a home cooked feel about it. The staff are friendly and understanding but not overly stiff.

I ordered classic basic nasi lemak and chose my own sides.  I feel that it may have been more economical to just purchase one of their sets. The beef rendang was soft and the sauce was nice. What I do appreciate is that it had less salt in all of their food.  They make their own Chile which was not too spicy.

I take one star off because 1 plate of food plus 1 drink set me back $10. I won't be able to afford to eat here that regularly.
A very surprised find out of such quaint place for very nice nasi lemak! The Color from butterfly pea didn’t affect coconut rice at all and over such a pleasant looking and great tasting dish!

For its quality (very decent nasi lemak) and air-conditioned setting, the meal is fairly priced. And the folks serving behind the counter are friendly too! It is definitely worth a visit if you’re in the area.
Amazing nasi lemak and loved the a la carte options. And the fried chicken — crunchy and fresh! Super sweet service from the women working there too. Thank you! Will definitely be back.

Quick and decent meal.
Rice: not fragrant enough
Rendang: average, wished it was more tender.

It seems like there are different sambal to choose from. I had the sambal xo and felt it was awesome.
Chicken curry and beef rendang are tough, nasi lemak no flavor at all, i didnt finish and left, waste my $$$

Delicious butterfly pea dyed Nasi lemak. Set with chicken wing (choice of regular or turmeric) is a good buy.

The sambal is perfect, ikan bilis and peanuts very crunchy and yummy. Liked the food so much decided to pack it home for family. Will definitely be back!
Very nice Nasi Lemak, better than other Chains. Always the comfort food when we come to United square
Not bad! I tried their setC which is rendang beef set. Recommended. It come with blue colored nasi lemak!
Great food and friendly staffs. Will come again. The chili is homemade and awesome!

One of the best nasi lemak ever. I am not even exaggerating. I had the rendang set with achar instead of sayur lodeh. Beef Rendang was tender and flavourful. Fried egg has runny yolk just the way I like it. A generous portion of nuts and anchovies. The most important piece of this plate of deliciousness, the sambal. There are 4 sambal to choose from, unable to decided the lady gave me two to try out and even offer a top up later. In my opinion, the portion was perfect, i had a delicious lunch. There are a lot of customisation options available so you can build your own perfect plate of nasi lemak. Highly recommend this place. Definitely coming back.
Nice Nasi Lemak that goes well with the fiery-kick XO sambal. The ayam masak merah is good add-on to complete my breakfast 🙂
Good value nasi lemak sets! Blue pea rice was delicious! Love the beef rendang and fried chicken sets! Highly recommend!
Fantastic nasi lemak at a great price. Beef rendang is tender and not too salty, blue pea coconut rice is delish. Thanks for the great delivery order

I’ve been to Sedap several times and the food never disappoint and is really really sedap (mouth watering); especially the chicken wings, beef rendang, otah otah, etc. Recently Sedap also serve salmon fish head curry which was surprisingly good and delicious (it has kind of more softer & jelly-like parts compared to other fish head). Definitely a must try dish for my next visit.

Walked in just to try. Thought it would just be another nasi lemak eating place. Surprisingly good. Ikan bilis was good, not salty. Crispy hot chicken wings. Blue rice and sambal were good. Good service too. Will be back.

Nasi Lemak is an all-time comfort food. Love the variety of side dishes offered at Sedap! My favourite has to be the steamed otah, so yums! They recently opened at Galaxis too which is nearer to me, so happy! Thank you for the good food and warm service.
Food, tasty.  Service ... definitely not coming back.
One of the best nasi lemak that similar to Malaysian’s one! Generous portion, reasonable price and awesome customization available
Very delicious nasi lemak especially the sambal tumis. The side dishes are equally delicious too. 👍🏻 to Sedap.
Loved the nasi lemak taste and especially the chicken wing. Sedap!
Best nasi lemak in the world. Must try when you are visit singapore!!
Great rendang and otah! Love it. Friendly staff. I love how spicy my beef rendang is. Will visit again! :)
Overrated. Wished I had stuck to the food court next door,  where nasi lemak taliwang has a stall.
Blue coloured nasi lemak rice! Must try!
Delicious value for money great ingredients combination
Horrible portion.  Threw away the food after seeing the pathetic portion and no more appetite.
Been patronizing for the past 2 years. Friendly staffs, amazing and affordable food.!! Keep it up.!!
Needing a nasi lemak fix and thinking of Sedap once more!

Delicious food and tastes authentic
👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻staff are also very patient

(Translated by Google) Best Nasi Lemak ever! Chicken wing was juicy and tasty and hand-made Peanuts & Ikan Bilis and Achar were yummy. You can choose different level of sambal chili. I took with blue coconut rice, Kukus Kerabu. Beautiful presentation and hospitality of the store owner was the reason of my recommendation! There are 3-4 outlets on the island, but Nasi Lemak is here! Is recommended. SG5-6th place ~

(Original)
Best Nasi Lemak ever!    Chicken wing was juicy and tasty and hand-made Peanuts & Ikan Bilis and Achar were yummy.   You can choose different level of sambal chili.  I took with blue coconut rice,  Kukus Kerabu.  Beautiful presentation and hospitality of the store owner was the reason of my recommendation!   アウトレットが島内に3−4店ありますが、Nasi Lemakならここ！をお勧めします。　SG5-6位〜

(Translated by Google) Rendang and Muar otah are very good. So is the rice egg flower.

(Original)
Rendang and Muar otah are very good. So is the bunga telam rice.

(Translated by Google) Nice nasi lemak, especially the brain.

(Original)
Nice nasi lemak, especially otak!
Loved the Ayam Masak Merah 👍🏻

(Translated by Google) Friendly service, yummy padang rice

(Original)
Friendly service, yummy nasi padang
Have a Yummy nasi lemak at Sedap!

Loved having dinner here with my friend

Tom Yam (clear) soup was superb. Such a clean taste. The tartness was just right. The fluffy crabmeat omelette was wonderful. Enjoyed the stir fried soft shell crab too; very flavourful. Didn't like the stuffed chicken wings though. The meat was marinated well, the stuffing was a bit dry and not as well flavoured as it could be. Green curry chicken was a great portion and the gravy was thick and yummy with rice!

We came at around 8.30pm to 9pm on a weekday evening and were surprised that we were allowed to still come in for a meal this late.  The food came quickly.  The chili spiciness was just nice - unlike some places that make your eyes water just by looking at the dish.  The dishes are a bit sweet, but that seems to be how Thai food is.  The atmosphere was relaxed and we didn't feel hurried to leave even though it was late.  Great service from YiXin and Sue.  Thank you very much for being so accommodating and friendly.

Had our dinner here.
Hard copy menu price was outdated, so scan QR Code can see the latest price.

Crowded during dinner time, but staffs working efficiency, fast action to sort out the seat for us.

Table arrangement quite close to each other, so perhaps is good place to eat but not stay long.

We ordered some simple dishes, overall all taste are nice and yummy.

Personally feel the mango sticky rice little pricy.

A wonderful experience. From entry to end. Was attended to the moment arrive at Restaurant. As prior reservation was done, brought to the table immediately. Lucky to get a window seat!
Vast variety of food on the classice menu style. Provides an overall easy to browse pages with pictures illustrations for their popular dishes.
Food and drinks came quick. All were freshly cooked and had uts own taste, not too powerful or overpowering in spices.
Staff was attentive throughout, clears dirty dishes as and when emptied.
Will totally visit again. Good place to bring clients for a meal.
Delicious Thai cuisine and efficient service on the whole. The seafood clear Tom yum soup was appetizing & not too spicy. Prawn cake taste nice.  Was a lovely dining experience.
1st time trying this place, recommended by friends. Few good dishes that I like, including the prawns omelette, which is not that oily. Prawn cake is nice too. On the whole, recommended with 4-stars.

Service was good. Crackers served as appetizer / snack came with chili sauce was perfect match, tasted good. The main dishes like pad Thai, belacan fried rice and clear seafood tomyam was also served within short time, tasted good too.

I and my friend and the kids dined for lunch today. It was the first time in our lives that a restaurant server can speak rudely. We found a hair strand in the tom yum soup after having 2 spoons…. She was insisting that its a lemongrass strand… because she could not find the hair strand in the tom yum soup. She kept saying seeing is believing… After all that fiasco that took place, i happened to find the hair strand and there was no sorry or whatsoever from her. The way she spoke to us is not nice at all. She even mentioned that she will not remove the tom yum soup from the bill. We clearly told her its not about the bill.. we just want to inform you that their is a hair strand inside the tom yum. We ordered alot
Of food. Surprising to hear that tone of speaking. Then while paying at the counter we spoke to the owner… he did not even apologise and mentioned its a lemongrass strand. I told him i already showed your staff its a hair strand and she acknowledged it.
Waste of time to even go to such restaurants.
Service has dropped tremendously.. used to frequent this place in the past alot since funan center.
Hospitality : 0
Quality of food : 0
Pricing: overpriced
Service: 0
Taste: 0

A very good lunch sans the stuffed chicken wings (cannot compare to YingThai's - lacks finesse and flavour). The food suits those with zhòng kǒu wèi (strong flavour) as it is well-seasoned but not too sweet. Especially love the baby kailan and very fresh fish.

Super disappointed by the tamarind prawn soup with vegetables (item 18A). For $15.90++, it had two tiny measly prawns. Veggies were cabbage, broccoli and carrot - which were too raw. And the soup was too spicy to drink - even though we had requested "less spicy" at the point of ordering but told that it is not spicy.

Thankfully the stuffed fried chicken wings redeemed the meal somewhat - these were juicy and flavourful. Not cheap either though.

Not great for a first experience, but we will give it another shot (without this soup).

Great food but slightly expensive.

Tom Yum Prawn Soup is very aromatic and spicy and was the best amongst the order.

Red curry is also very good and not too spicy with amazing flavours.

Pandan chicken wasn’t good as the meat was chewy and not succulent. Had to leave it.
We tried a number of Thai restaurant, the food here are pretty ok..the omelette is good but 5pcs of Thai fishcake for $18.90 is expensive...

Food is good and service efficient. I ordered Thai ice milk tea, iced lemongrass, basil minced pork, Beansprouts and salted egg + chye poh egg.

The only dish I find lacking is the egg. It was too oily and I felt quesy after consuming it. I had to use napkin to soak up some oil and the napkin was soaked through.

Everything else was very yummy.

Amazing food, every dish was superb! Would definitely come again! We ordered fish green curry, shrimp pancake 3pcs, scrambled omelette with minced pork, stir fry kai lan, Thai iced tea and a coconut shake.
5 star rating for a long standing restaurant, 3 decades. We set for a vegetarian meal, no regrets. Keep it up and will become my regular spot for Thai food.
Scrumptious thai food! The pork belly is a must have!! 🔥🔥🔥 staff was friendly and even recommended us dishes to try when asked! 🙌🏻🙌🏻

Ordered:
- grilled pork which has the very good balance of the fats and meat. I absolutely love this and will definitely come back for this (only if I’m forgoing my diet 😂)
- clear Tom yum which has a mild sour  and spicy taste. Felt that i might enjoy it more if it’s more sour and spicy as it tastes just mehhhhh. Lots of squids, fish and mushroom tho!
- omelette crab where the egg was very very fluffy yet crispy on the outer. But I can’t taste the flavour of crab and I had this dish thinking it’s just plain egg (my cousin said it will be better to order the prawn omelette so that u can see the prawn meat)
- pad Thai tasted like the normal pad Thai (honestly can someone share with me how a plate of amazing pad Thai should taste? With wokhey??? 😂😂😂)
- kailan which tasted quite clean yet doesn’t have the glassy taste (if you are like me who hates vegetables, this is a perfect option for you cos it doesn’t have the vegetables taste 😂)
- Thai green tea had a very strong pandan taste and normal Thai iced tea was a little sweet (but I like it) and has the dry tea after taste (which I believe is normal to have)

Ambience was good, but it’s not enticing enough that would bring me back so 3 stars especially since food was decent

Check out ig: @oyinshii

Authentic thai restaurant with extremely great flavors! Staff were friendly and we strongly recommend the steamed fish, pad thai and yom yum gong.

Fantastic meal here at A-Roy Thai. Was a Sunday night around 8+ but the restaurant was still bustling, will recommend to make a reservation if you come during the peak dinner timings.

The meal itself was delightful, not the regular local style Thai food but according to my gf, it had more Northern Thai influences to it but more importantly, done well.

Prices are not cheap, 1 appetizer, 3 mains and 2 drinks set us back around $90+ compared to the regular Thai food places but this is money well spent.

The lemongrass salad was fantastic, a must order (the staff don't tell you but you eat it with the wrap on the side). Tom yum kung was good, not mind blowing but definitely above average. The Grilled Pork was done very differently, in a good way, a spicier way actually.

The service was friendly and the food came out surprisingly fast. The grilled pork took a bit longer but the rest of the dishes came first.

Would definitely return! But have to budget myself else it'd really burn a huge hole in my pocket!

Nice cosy joint for authentic Thai food. Will overall recommend with below dishes tried:

-Crisy garlic fried pork belly : really good recommendation by the staff. This is not on the menu but has fantastic flavours. Wasn’t overly fatty as well.

-steam seabass with spicy sour soup

- Chili Kang Kong is pretty standard.

ordered a crabmeat fried rice.... didnt see any crab meat but tasted some chunks of meat that tasted like those kind of dried meat.. my friend ordered a tom tum fried rice, no taste of tomyum just taste like tomato fried rice :') price point was okay for that area (since it's novena) but $13+ for fried rice is not too good esp since didnt taste any crab 🥲
Excellent Thai food. The pictures says it all. Great service

The food is good
The feel of Thailand
Haha

Love the Phay Thai…
Nice authentic Thai food in Singapore. Enjoyable dinner with family
Food is good and tasty. claypot seafood noodle is so so.

For a local spot in novena , this spot is really good! The large selection and everything came out hot and fresh. A spot we want to expore more. Their coconut jelly dessert is available for to-go at the counter and was really good and refreshing. Pricing was ok but we enjoyed the food enough. It was $114 for 4 people with dessert. Not bad and will be back. Enjoy !

Food smells very good when walking pass. Complimentary prawn crackers and Tom yum soup was good. Drinks were quite nice too. Ordered the butterfly pea lime soda and the Thai milk tea. The rest of the food were ok at best. Garlic pork belly and Poo Ja (shrimp and meat in crab shell)  was too peppery, Crab meat fried rice was bland and did not have wok hey. Not worth the price.
The flavours were ok but the quality and freshness not really there. The best dishes were the beef Thai green curry and the fish cake.

My family has dined at Aroy Thai for over 20 years from when they used to be at Siglap and Funan. I’ve had the food from their East Coast outlet quite recently too but it was our first time at the Novena branch and the quality was even better!

We were there on a weekday for lunch around 1.40pm and thankfully there were quite a few empty tables. Service was really prompt and our first dish arrived less than 3 mins after our order was placed! We had the pad thai, garlic kailan, seafood tomyum soup, grilled pork and stuffed chicken wings. Even though we had asked for the soup to be less spicy, it was still pretty potent so it’s best to ask them to dial back on the spiciness if you’re not someone who can handle it well.

The portions were also pretty big and we had some leftovers. Very glad that the quality has stayed great over the years!

It was a beautiful Sunday and my friends and I decided to go for Thai food after our hiking at Macritche Reservoir. One of our friends decided to bring us to Velocity where she was frequent at A-Roy Thai Restaurant. We were there at 11am where the restaurant was just open. We were ushered by a friendly waitress and directed our seats at the corner. First impression counts though. I was pretty much happy the way the waitress welcomed us, so much poise and professionalism. The ambience was nice and cosy. I ordered the Thai Milk Tea and I love it so much. The flour just right and not too sweet. We ordered 3 dishes which they are beyond delicious and authentic. Love the Thai foods here...definitely you must try! I shared some pictures of the foods we ordered. As a whole experience at this A-Roy Restaurant, I will give 5 stars.

The food here is super authentic. It reminds me of the trips to thailand in the past. I tried the otah (the one in the coconut). I felt that it was really special. The otah had more "coconut" taste in it and it was more flavourful than the other otahs i had. The rest of the food are okay. The quality is there. Prices on the high side. The staff were very attentive as well. Remember to reserve your seats or be prepared to wait!

I had high expectations for this restaurant, but it was not as good I thought. The place was noisy, and the food was low quality. For example, when I ordered pineapple rice, I expected rice with pineapple, but turned out to be yellow pineapple flavoured rice. However, the drinks were quite yummy. It only took about 6 minutes for our food to be served. My overall opinion about this restaurant is that it is noisy, the food is ok, and it is usually crowded.
Authentic Thai food with generous portion. Ambience is nice and staffs are attentive. The price is on the more expensive side than other Thai restaurants, but the authentic taste is worth it.

Went there for family celebration. Food is ok, cooked decently for most dishes. Cuisine isn't much to my liking for some.

Seating is a bit congested so if you have a large group (>8 pax), expect to split up.

Mostly longish tables too so sharing food can be a bit messy or troublesome.

We were not hungry but wanted to eat something before going home. One of my Mom favourite restaurant. The starters is always welcome crackers which we both loved. The fish head ohta (not sure of the spelling) is nice. Loved the mango salad. Tom yum here is very good - best shared.

Authentic Thai food.
My top favourites are:
1. Grilled pork neck, very juicy.
2. No88A prawn yellow curry is a must too.
3. Omelette Cha-om

The Thai food is pretty authentic and ingredients used quite resemble those found in Thailand. Tried the green curry and soft shell crab with curry. Good range of items on the menu. Staff service is decent. Prices are on the high side, but food quality is pretty good  as

Best choice of real authentic thai food! I couldn't find any thai restaurant better than them. Whenever i have the craving for thai food, they will be the 1st to come in my mind. The only place to find vegetarian spicy and sour tom yam clear soup etc. Highly recommended and sure you won't regret 😀

Went there for my friend's birthday dinner.  The staff who took our order was quite friendly and introduced us a few popular dishes.
The stuffed chicken wings were ok, not something fantastic. Prawn cake was nice.. Green curry didn't seem appetizing to me but my friends enjoyed it. The mango sticky rice was good.. mango was sweet and rice was soft and warm.
I had lychee milkshake but it tasted more like blended lychee.. watery not nice.
We also ordered red ruby and something like cendol. The red ruby dessert had something that tasted like essence.  Don't recommend it.

We finished out dinner and sat there to chill and chat but the staff were eager to settle the bill and send us off.. they could tell us nicely that they are preparing to close for the day instead of throwing very obvious hints like mopping the floor.  :-/

Wonderful thai food!! Everything is wonderful, especially the lemongrass salad. We ordered: olive fried rice, stuffed chicken wings, Kang kong, fried fish, Tom yum soup, pad gra pow, glass noodles. The balance of sweet, sour, spicy and salty in the dishes were great.

Desserts and drinks also recommended!
Best Thai food in Singapore and it's not even close. Been a customer for over a decade (when they were at Siglap and Funan). The staff are super as well.

Very nice service took the menu to come serve us to speed up the process! Thai milk tea a must to order!
Love the service and the food!

i would.say the.best thai food here, it has been for sometime never disappoint. the pricing is not cheap. the issue here is the plastic plateware. it is a shame such delicious food served not on china plateware. thats the only improvement needed. service was fast and lunch crowd build ip fast. come early

Most Thai restaurants in Singapore are either 1- fancy and pricey 2- down and dirty or 3- cooked for non Thais so not authentic. A-Roy Thai is different. It is just like the Thai food you would get in Thailand. That's because it's run by a family from Udon Thani who bring the chef in from their home town and keep the food real. The Isaan dishes are best but the dishes from throughout the country are all pretty good. A family member is usually there (ask for Chayut). Beers are cold. Service is fast. Please enjoy the best Thai food in Singapore
Loved this quaint little Thai place. Food is authentic and good! Especially loved the shrimp lemongrass salad! Almost everything is good. Will come back for the Pad Thai!

The food is better than most thai restaurant in Singapore. Was very surprise their north eastern thai dishes (larb moo) is very close to what you would have in thailand.

Fried pork was slightly hard, and the marinade was hardly present. Fish cake was so-so.

Their stuff chicken Wings was rather good though. Crispy on the outside, tasty on the inside.

Food is only slightly more expensive as compare to most thaifood places. Golden Mile Seems to charge a premium for it.

Overall every good Experience, will still return.

Looks authentically Thai but the truth is in the pudding. Mixed reaction for me. While the taste is overall pretty OK but the authenticity for 2 of the dishes - otah n grilled pork seems a bit lacking. Still I liked the grilled fish n tarmarin soup. 3.5 star for now. Will revisit in future and try the other dishes.
One of my favourite thai restaurant. Reasonably priced and very extensive menu. Not too crowded on weekdays. Recommended.

Slightly over priced for what they are offering. Their recipes actually does not have Authentic Thai taste... It's kind of Chinese-Thai taste. Coconut milk shake is totally artificial flavored not even a single ingrident of coconut. Look out for other Thai restaurants in city if you have time...
The food is good but is consider expensive as compared to other Thai restaurants. First time try and find it too expensive.

Will happily go back to eat the set A with the fried chicken wing. Added on: Eggplant & curry veg ✅nice crispy anchovies and peanuts. Most of the food was cold by the time I was there about 8pm, but was still good. They were still frying certain food items but mostly sold out.

$3.50 for a choice of A, B or C basis set. Not the cheapest, but addition of sambal goreng for $1, and the same for a piece of Otak was much more reasonable.

Coconut milk rice with a drop of pandan leaf juice giving it a slight green hue and stronger fragrance. Chicken wing was overcooked and dry. Sambal sweet. Everything else was real normal.

Average. So I don't understand the constant line seen here. Thankfully fast moving.

Not sure if they will be increasing their price, but the quality of the food has not dropped since lots of things happening since 2022, Noticed that they changed their stall location, and that the newer generation has taken over the stall, the Chicken wings are the best to pair with their fragrant rice, and their sambal is top notch as well.

Will definitely visit again.

Decent nasi lemak served with green fragrant rice. Coconut taste is present in the rice, chilli is not overpowering and ikan bilis complements the dish quite well. Fried chicken wing was not too tough nor soggy. $3.50 is also a decent price for the meal, which is slightly above standard to those nasi lemak stalls going for $2.50-$3.

I arrvied at about 11:45am, no queue. $3.50 set comes with 1 egg, 1 chicken wing, peanut & ikan bilis. Added Otah $1.

Rice has mild pandan & coconut fragrance, not over whelming but just nice.

Chilli goes well with rice, not as spicy though to me.

Chicken wings is crispy and well seasoned.

When I saw the long queue for this, i knew i had to join in to check it out!

This is "Hi Leskmi" which is quite an unusual name that sells Nasi Lemak.  The stall uses an Indian name, owned by a Chinese guy, selling Malay Food. Talk about Racial Harmony!

Rice itself I feel is not really fragrant, and the Chicken Drumstick itself while Crispy, is nothing special. Sambal Chilli is sweetish. The whole meal however comes together quite well and is very filling. Not really worth queuing up for tbh.

This store used to be decent before covid. Its standards were already dropping in 2019 but decided to give it a try again.

Rice had no coconut taste and fragrance and was dry. Food ingredients were barely warm and nothing spectacular. Expensive too.

Hopefully can relook at what went wrong in the last few years..

A typical nasi lemak at Whampoa. The queue is Long, cause of its pricing(pretty affordable). I’m a fan of nasi lemak and I must say this is just an average nasi lemak. The rice can be better(slightly mushy when I ate it) but it’s side dishes are good.

After a 2 year break (thanks COVID) had a chance to try this again. Have to say I am very disappointed as the price vs quality and quantity has dropped by so much. There is much better fare to spend your $ and appetite on in this place
Really the most fragrant rice and chicken wing for Nasi lemak! 👍🏼
During my recent visit, I find their sambal and coconut rice standard are not as good compared to when they start up.

Noticed they changed to a slightly inner store (same row, opposite side beside Shirley desserts)
but standard still same, Rice is fragrant, chicken wing still has the crisp and tender texture (fresh),
Rice is very fragrant. All is good but the chicken wing seems soggy at the skin and the flesh is hard. Service is also very fast and good.
Best nasi lemak in Singapore. Rice is fragrant, chicken wings are crispy. Everything on point.

Super unfriendly, only want exact amount. If need change he won't let you buy and basically forces u to get extra dishes so he doesn't have to give you change. Lastly it's only so-so never understood why there's always a queue there anyway
I spend $14 for 2packets. Ask for more chillies  didnt give and definitely not enough to cover the rice. Will not visit this stall anymore. They are so lousy!!
