These guys are super rude and arrogant. Both the younger and old guys are rude to the customers. First off the nasi lemak is just average but sometimes there is a queue. I think he has enough business and that made him very arrogant and atrocious. Bad service and very bad attitude.
Rice is hard. Fried chicken got smell. Otah and egg is edible.
Food is good. Wings are extra crispy. Long queue always.  Be prepared for the wait because its worth the wait.
The nasi lemak is really so so only. The young man behind the stall is rude & unfriendly. A waste of stomach space, time & money.
Nice Nasi Lemak. Long Queue although quite fast moving. Understand the stall caught fire recently.
Very tasty and best nasi lemak I’ve had.
Long Q but the food is just above average. Food is warm though, this is a plus.
Authentic nasi lemak at a very reasonable price
Nice
Food is ok but expensive
Best Food & Best People! AWESOME
Great food for great price!
Long queue. Must be not bad.
Good
so-so
The food is decent
gv a try lads
Good taste
OCK is no longer only serving curry puff and fishball. They selling coffee, mee Siam, beehoon and many more. They even have sitting area. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Tried their Mar special mala mix mushroom. Is cold n a bit soft but still nice. Doesn't hv much 'ma', too pricey for mushroom $3.90. whras mala chicken only $3. Is this bias? 😅 Haha..

Expect crowd during peak hours.
Super fast service.
Dine-in area available but to abide with the current regulations during this pandemic.
A lot of items are selling fast here especially during lunch time.
Packed during breakfast hours too.
Delicious, good quality breakfast with cheap price, long queue but fast service.. need more chair and table for dine in..

The two Chinese ladies are so rude, so impatient! The one at the cashier, I gave her $10 for $2.40 meehoon set, she gave me back $2.60. I stunned for a while before mastering courage to ask her nicely, eh how much is the meehoon...she straight away replied me you gave me $5 right? The answer is like giving her away. She then threw $5 on the counter for me. They need to be fired!!
Poor customer service , the Chinese lady staff was very rude.

Cheap cheerful and they are everywhere!!! Someone should bring this franchise to Melbourne please!!! The kopi could be slightly a bit less sweet but is still pretty good! Love the sotong and also had their curry puffs!! if only I had a second stomach!
Outlet has more varied selection of fried beehoon and noodles. It provides seating area too. Makes a lovely pit-stop before continuing with rest of journey.
One of the more famous snack brands in Singapore. Fun fact, most of their employees are senior citizens! Their food may not be special but their staff will certainly make you feel at home!

my favorite curry puffs in singapore! love love the batter. i love the mushroom puffs more (because im not a curry fan). also they recently have kaya puffs, which are amazing!! there is this sesami green bean fried ball that i like too. this one is right next to old curry times. their menu is slightly more varied than other old chang kees.

im so dissapointed . sometimes im coming here and buying something.
yesterday i buy the owl coffee and find the currypuff coupon
but i want to give that to my friend in korea so im tear off that coupon
and im going there and ask about using it.
but they are snicker. they say just using not fold .
how rude they are ...
i have enough money but i dont go there anymore
if you find any coupon and then find another old chang kee

Curry puffs crusts are very thick but crispy. Enjòyed the different types of dried bee hoon like satay, plain white, mee siam and Laksa. Drink are also available together with other finger food such as fish balls, held together by a stick.

Buying snacks for customers but system maintenance cant issue receipt. Waited 10mins system stil not up. Ock should consider having manual receipt as backup so as not to lose some business as a result
The staff attitude there is very bad.especially the malaysian workers.i will not go back there again.they were rude to me
Good when you need a quick bite. Curry O, deep fried Squid and dry Laksa are my regular choices.
Great place for small snack. Fried Gyoza is my favourite! It's has outlet all around in Singapore.
You can eat dry Mee Siam with hot coffee here or Curry puff with coffee.  Nice.
Velocity branch: Great place for breakfast.  Expect a queue. Local Coffee is good!
Great for snacking with seating available if snacking on the go is not your thing. The Bee Hoon with beverage is a great bargain.
Seats are very limited though food is not bad, their tea & coffee are good
Best place to have breakfast.. nice tea and don't miss to taste free biscuits..
Every Wednesday morning they serve a special peanut congee. It’s very good.
This outlet have seating and there also sell coffee, mee siam etc.
The staff is rude and doesn't understand English well. I won't visit again.
Most of the fried food is nice, but pricing getting higher.
My favourite place to fulfill my craving on authentic singaporean Curry Puffs.
Damn shiok fried stuff!! Curry puffs are pretty good as well.
Great experience. I ordered a vegetarian dish and it was tasty .
Cheap food but service abit slow resulted in long q in the morning before 8 to 9 am
Delicious curry puff and breakfast menu, quick service
Good for a quick snack, situated close to the bus stop and MRT.
Not bad. Will go again.
Very nice selection of food and hot drinks
The service is poor. The person who served with the name “TL” is very impolite.
I always buy chicken mushroom puffs when I pass by
Would do well to learn their p's and q's.
The tomyam noodle soup is the best.
There are table and seats at this outlet
Snacks tasty n hot
The snacks are so good...
Fast and fuss-free experience
Good Satay beehoon
Nice foods and good service
I've the mushroom puff
Yummy!
Limited seats
Value for money

(Translated by Google) Curry corner must eat

(Original)
咖喱角必食

Shop has a great variety of Malay food, looks very legit and old school.  Nasi Lemak sold out before 1030am, so i try the Lontong.   Gravy is flavorful and serving is generous.  Missing the sweet coconut flaks and felt incomplete.  Rice cake also not the chewy type and lack texture. Vegetables also a bit overcooked and gravy is not hot as it is not kept hot in a pot but part of the Nasi Padang spread.  Had tasted better lontongs in Toa Payoh stalls.  But can eat if you like your lontong vegetables to be well cooked. Coffee from the drink stall is good though.

Will be back to try other offerings of their Malay food.

Curry puff is good and has nice spicy kick. Tried both the sardine and potato version. Good for $0.60 and happy to know I’ve got a place nearby!

Bergedil (potato patty) was also yums for $0.50 each! Recommended!

Veggie cucur was also good snack.

Sambal belachan is not as spicy as I’d expect.

Will definitely consider trying their other dishes as they have quite a queue.
Delicious nasi padang. Good items finish early. Long queues at lunch

Went in the morning to try their nasi Padang and it definitely deserves 5 stars. Food was delicious, portion was perfect and best part was the affordable price! The staff there was really friendly too!! Have yet to try their noodle section; looks really good too!!
Definitely a must try place! Affordable nasi Padang, mee rebus, mee siam & many more. Food was so good which you won’t be disappointed 😍

While having an assortment of food to choose from, they are all both affordable and delicious. The stall owners are also very friendly and the relaxing ambience of the place paired with the food will have you coming back for more. 10/10.

Excellent place with a wide variety of food !! Out of all the food places i’ve tried in SG, this place sells the most affordable yet delicious Nasi Lemak.Highly recommended. Friendly vendors and a very lovely environment to dine in or takeaway. 11/10

10/10 best nasi lemak and one of the best lontong dishes I have ever had in my life ... environment is very comforting and brings abit of nostalgic vibe for me ... will definitely come here regularly for my breakfast and lunch
Lovely dishes with wide variety to choose from. Definitely affordable and vendors are extremely friendly!
Food selection of vegetables was amazingly good. Sambal chilli is very spicy and tasty!!!
Wow!! good and nice food.So sedap not expensive 11am people to start Q.Must come early before 3pm all thier food will gone.Recommended Place!!!Thier Curry Chicken Must Try...
Not bad nasi Padang, quite affordable as well. Located in a coffeeshop setting not standalone.
Very affordable and also healthy
Reasonable price and nice food.
Good and cheap halal nasi padang at kim keat. Carpark at blk 76 in lorong limau.

The Penang char kway teow has wok hei and really good . The staff here has attitude , the management has to step up on training .

Penang prawn mee broth is nice but ingredients seems dry and shrunk in size attributed to repeated cooking .

Newly opened foodcourt with plenty of seats. Teh C is such a big cup costing only $1.80. Penang fried kway teow is well fried but popiah is a big let down. This place is fully packed after 11.30am so if you want to enjoy your food please come early.

Have to agree with some of the reviewers here. The cleaners slam the utensils and talk way too loudly. The fried kway teow staff has attitude. I stood in front and the fella just ignored.

So I left and ordered the claypot rice. The young man disappeared for the longest time before he gave us our change. We then indicated we would like to purchase the drinks that came with the meal. The fella directed us to another store some distance away. And never gave us receipts. So we hard to make a second trip because the drinks stall asked for proof of paurchase.

First and last time at this lousy place.

Not happy to work, then don't. Customers are not responsible for your perceived lot in life.
Worst claypot chicken rice I've ever had. Just some pieces of chicken (with a lot of chicken skin), rice, and sauce being kept warm in a claypot. The rice wasn't even close to developing a crust.

Its terrible here, the cleaners clear the trays and utensils and literally SLAMs them into a dirty box. Its so noisy you cant eat in peace. Imagine whacking a dirty bowl really hard into a big black box filled with dirty bowls. Horrible place my first and last time here

Not much variety only fried carrot cake, oyster eggs, char kway Teow, claypot rice, Assam laksa n prawn noodles.
Tried the fried kway Teow, Assam laksa n prawn noodles.. I still prefer the one at Jurong point

Has frequently visited this Centerpoint Malaysia Chiak for Penang Laksa and Prawn noodle. The usual auntie is very friend, however today there's a new very fatvyound punk was not. Ordered a big bowl Penang Lakes, this fat guy gave soup just barely cover the noodle. When I ask him little more soup,  he told me I cannot give more,  this is company policy, if you want more you'll need to pay for the soup. Sorry I cannot help you. Wth? I wanted to give 1 star,  but luckily the other senior staff who came back from outside and I asked him for little more soup he top it up without any hesitation. This is the first time I've ever encountered such situation after coming here like 2 years plus, probably my last visit here. :(
There was some sort of plastic ap in my takeaway claypot rice. I almost choked on it. I think my rice had melted plastic inside. Only realise this after I ate half of it
Tried the fried oyster, and fried noole, not impressed. I also tried sugar cane, its standard.

This is the worse outlet with the worst customer service by their staffs!

As if walked in customers will know what is left for us to order when all your sign boards are lit up! Staffs have zero respect to walked in customers as they did not even bother to turn and face customers!

To the staffs, if you are not interested to work, you better quit your job and don't affect the branding Malaysia Chiak!

1 star is Over Rated
Claypot rice. Good taste. Next best to eating it in M'sia

Horrible service attitude and lousy food. Google states opening hours till 10pm. When arrived at 7.50-8pm, cook from the fried carrot stall mentioned that the claypot rice stall cook is having his meals rudely. So we ordered the Penang fried kway tiao while we waited. But taste of the CKT was way below average.

After the cook finished his meal, he just informed that his stall is closed! He should just mentioned it’s closed when we asked about it and we do not need to even order the Penang CKT!! Waste of time.

Place is also dirty with dead cockroach under the table. Horrible cleanliness.

Seriously Fei Siong group should manage the staff better. And UPDATE YOUR OPENING HOURS!!

If there is a zero star, I will give that. Young man forgot my ckt orders when there are NO customers around. Collected my money and continue playing game till I check on him 15mins later.
Claypot rice prepare by the fat guy is so so. Not enough meat and lap chiong. Not fragrant compare to hawker centre.
Expensive and really bad tasting food. Don’t bother calling it “Malaysian” food, standard is really incomparable to authentic in M’sia.

The ckt was not too bad, but could have used a bit more wok hei.  Waiting time was about 10 minutes, and you can get a ice lemon drink or a lime juice for $1 with every order.

Some reviews commented on the claypot rice.  We did not try it, but there was a table that ordered 11 portions.

My honest advice to the two young guys from fried kway teow and penang prawn mee stall, if this work is really that difficult for you, you can actually stop working here and move on
Terrible attitude against all customers
1. keep talking bad about customer in front of them
2. not even bother to take order from customer (pity the boss)
3. keep messing up with customer orders, customer need to wait another round because of the mistake (I don't understand because all customer ordering fried kway teow only, and it is like just 3 to 4 orders, but you still can make mistake?) plus you did wrong but still showing attitude to customer? (pity the customers)
4. one of the customer in front of me asked for non spicy, the staff from penang prawn mee shout very loud saying that can not choose no spicy, but when i get mine, it is not spicy at all (just because you want to do all orders in one go, you tell customer can not choose?)

At last, the food really so so only, so no more next time
No reason to get yourself insulted there for a food that not delicious and not to say very cheap

ordered oyster omelette and it took about 50 mins to come. when we asked the stall owner, he said he forgot about our order, and did not give an apology - not even a sorry or anything.
when we got our omelette after about 60 mins of waiting, we only managed to find 4 oysters inside. mind you my mother paid $6 for that omelette.
the stall owners were very rude the entire time and took everything for granted. ruined family night and wasted our time.

Had the clay pot rice. Serving is disappointingly small & is nothing like the picture,  Dried pork sausage & salted fish was not added, let alone the spring onion.
Taste is OK tough
Tired the fried carrot cake in dark sauce.. all I  can taste is only the dark sauce sweet taste..

Worst food portions ever, when confronted they tell you that the food is being weighted to be fair. We paid $8 for a $2 portion. Sure we understand the high rentals etc but charging $8 for subpar food and horrendous food portions not even fit for a cat is just too much.

The attitude of the hawkers are horrendous as well.

Malaysian food is cheap to begin with, cut with the pretense. Not recommended unless you are too rich and want your mood to be spoiled.

It don't even deserve one star at all. Lousy attitude especially from Char Kway Teow stall guy who just care more about looking at his hp then cooking. Know it could be due to high rental but the portion is just miserably small and the taste just doesn't do Malaysian food justice. Definitely 1 of the worst food places that I have been to. 😡

Worst place ever.
Tried the Fried Kway Teow, tasteless.
Told the black shirt guy (supposed to be the manager) that I wanted it extra spicy, he didn't even bother.
There were supposed to come together with a free drink which I didn't get too.
Other stall workers were great except the one that serve Fried Kway Teow.

If can give negative I will choose to give -10 star.
Please don't known as Malaysia Chiak it bring shame to the local Malaysia food.

Char kuey teow- chilli wouldn't be blend in the kuey teow...You will be eating the char kuey teow like French fries where you will need to sip the kuey teow to chilli sauce for the spicy flavor.

Don't ever eat the char kuey teow...it is yucks.
Wanted to have Char Kuay Teow at Great World City branch. As I am unable to digest beansprouts and requested without it, but aas told they can't do customisation. First time in history!! 😐
A must try Penang fried kueh tiao!!!

Oyster egg with 3 oysters and more corn flour than egg.

Claypot chicken rice is soya sauce rice.

Not worth the money
Had claypot rice and sesame chicken yesterday. Delicious but not a lot of meat.
Limited stalls. Food standards and stall are below expectations.
Accessible everyday food
Various options of food, isn't overly crowded during weekday lunch hour
Average food...low grade outlet
fried kway teow and claypot rice stall  attitude problem. look like i owe them alot of money.
Claypot not bad, but not alot of meat
The 1st stall fried osyter totally cannot make it!!!!!! Lousy
Not to mention poor attitude. Fly found in fried carrot cake! Terrible!
They not paying attention so I ordered from other store 😂
not halal
The char kuay teow is a must try!
Nice good and reasonable price
Lousy quality good and yet overpriced
super disappointed... i wont come agian
Ok food for local.
Like their food
Unhygienic food
Rojak serve cold  and all cut in big size. Service is worst, ask for you tiao rojak but given big plate rojak. Kopi is like drainage water, not much Kopi taste.
A bit too salty for me personally, but considering the price and the place,  this place is good for quick meals.
Mee Tai Mak + Sugar Cane Juice ❤️❤️❤️-18/8/2022

(Translated by Google) Dirty, unhygienic, and eating again with hands that used to touch money. Anti gave me the smell of the eggs, so when I got home and checked it out, the smell came from the eggs.
money is too bad

(Original)
더럽고 위생적이지 않고 돈만지던 손으로 다시 음식을 합니다. 안티가 계란냄새를 맡고 주길래 집에와서 혹시나 확인해보니 계란에서 냄새가 나서 버렸습니다ㅡ
돈이 너무 아깝네요

Great porridge with a variety of choices including porridge with black chicken!

Apr 2022: another visit and porridge is as good as first visit.

Apr 2022: yet another visit in the same month! This time I tried the pumpkin porridge base and it was good! I think I got one of the last bowls and so the porridge was thick and yummy!

Happy to find this new favorite porridge place! The porridge is thick and flavourful. Fast and good service from the staff as well. They have pumpkin porridge option but felt could have more pumpkin taste. Nonetheless still really good and would be coming back for more 😄👍🏻

It's okay, nothing too special about the porridge. No wok hei taste and one of my prawns was completely mushy, think their seafood is not very fresh.

Pretty generous with the ingredients though and the staff here are very enthusiastic and professional (esp the young boy who was attending to the tables)

The sliced pork porridge is thick and flavourful. We ordered a set hence there were you tiao and soya bean milk. The fried fritters and soya bean milk were average. The claypot liver had a few thick slices of liver but they were bland, only the sauce was nice. If you like porridge, then this is the place for you as there are many different choices of porridge (seafood, chicken, scallops, pork etc.)to select from and the dishes came quickly. Service was good.

I am not a fan of porridge but this place cooks up a yummy bowl that I would come back again.

The you tiao was surprisingly still crispy despite been left at counter for a while.

I had the mixed pork porridge which was really a mix of meat, internal organs, pork balls, fried, boiled into a flavourful bowl of porridge.

Wished I had the option white pepper, chives, oil. It was all added before served. Soya bean milk was a little sweeter than I would like.

Was introduced by my sis that their porridge very nice and alots of varieties.
Mainly porridges but have some side dishes too.

We ordered with set (YouTiao & SoyMilk), the portion quite big, n their porridge more “thick” so easy to get full, most impt is yummy 👍
Price is reasonable too.

The shop is in the middle of others restaurant, first timer maybe need some time to look for it. Shop design is simple but is ok, I guess their main point is provide good & delicious food.
The porridge is salted and the portion of the dish is very small. Especially for butter garlic lala, think only have less than 15pcs, and its not worth it.

I tried the following
1. Century egg & lean meat congee
2. Ginseng chicken drumstick congee
3. Fried intestines - a let down, crunchy and tasteless.
4. Stir fried garlic dou miao

Come here if you prefer thick porridge. The set comes with fried fritter (you tiao) and soy milk (not sweet).

very nice congee and i went for set meal. will go again. staffs are very friendly and efficient.
very crowded place and seating area quite small.
Feels like home cooked kind of food . The variety of congee is a dream . They have cheesy popcorn chicken congee to the favourite century egg congee. I chose claypot chicken today .
Surprisingly nice porridge with many variety and tasty.  Many nice side dishes.  But price slightly on the higher side.

Just had 2 bowls of Mixed pork congee and a bowl of youtiao with mom. Conclusion, overrated and expensive. Weird smell coming from youtiao, there isn't 满粥, only 2/3 filled and a few pieces of meat. Worst is the fried intestines, like chewing rubber.

I have been here many time. Friendly staffs with good service. Their congee ho jiak, the gong pao liver also tok kong! Best dish to go with the plain congee and you tiao. The chicken feet was so yummy that I can eat non stop.

They are under Li Fang congee which I only found out when I saw their signboard. Like what many had mentioned, their pricing is more expensive. I still tried because their menu is quite interesting. The black chicken porridge is quite nourishing but annoying with the herbs hidden in the porridge, so go for others if you are not herbal fan. We paid like $30 for 2 pax. If you think of it as a meal at a restaurant then this price makes sense but if you wanna compare with hawker or coffeeshop then don't come. Overall we enjoyed our lunch there. 😊

This has got to be one of the best congee stalls I’ve tried so far. Thick porridge. Chock full of quality ingredients. Costs almost twice as much as your typical hawker centre porridge but I guess you get what you pay for.
Small portions for the price. Porridge was otherwise tasty but lukewarm and had little ingredients.

The porridge is really good but it's over priced. The portions of the dishes, especially vegetables are really small. A plate of veg at about $8 is only enough of 1 person. So if you order a set meal say the grouper fish slice porridge with a bit of youtiao and a soya bean drink and you add a veg to it, it'll cost you around $22 without the ++.

Usually come here for porridge. But thought i try their tim sum. Variety is not wide, but quality is good. I had pork ribs. The portion is generous n taste is delicious 😋.  Had the spring roll; crisp n fresh. They have a new item, if you like otah n in mood for the fusion of it, come try their cheese otah. Taste of otah remains with added chewy cheese. 👍

My toman fish porridge set with added egg was ordered through GrabFood.

The congee is good. The thinly sliced ginger added nice contrast against the congee. However there was little toman fish slices in my bowl (4 slices to be exact). When I finally got to the bottom of the bowl, there was also the shocking absence of any egg.

Even after delivery, the oily stick chunks remained acceptably hard (not exactly crispy) instead of softening. The oily stick chunks were quite ok after soaking in congee.

Soy milk was as good as their congee. Pleasant tasting and at 30% sugar, not perceptibly sweet.

I probably would order again, but this time, avoid adding any additional items.
The porridge here is very good. Many varieties. Try the minced meat porridge. The set is additional $1.8 where you get one soy bean and youtiao. Goes well with the hot porridge

Good congee specialist in the Novena area. Wide selection with some dim sum and side dish options. Congee is smooth and quite flavourful. Could do with more 'wok hei' for greater impact. Nonetheless, one of the better ones around.
Love the porridge. It tasted very good but took sometimes to get the order. No queue but waiting time about 20 minutes plus to get the order on lunch time.

Savory porridge! Tried the pork meatballs with sliced pork - TBH ingredients weren’t to shout for, but the porridge made it up for it :) think they cook the ingredients in the porridge to let the marinate and sweetness soak through.
Ingredient portions were pretty generous. Price-wise - depending on ingredients, betw $5.50-$10plus.
A congee place that not only gives traditional flavours but also "out-of-the-box" flavours like Iberico pork, cheese popcorn chicken, wok hei prawn congee etc. Worth trying out.

Price is slightly high as considered for porridge,however they are located inside a shopping mall so prices are considered reasonable in this setting, the quality is good and youtiao is crispy. Props for creating dishes suitable for all ages.
nothing special for the price tag, and they charge GST separately. small portion, only 4 small slices of grouper fish for $12.8, and instant coffee for $2.3 is a bit ridiculous.

Had very high hopes for their porridge but we were so wrong. The youtiao were chewy and slightly tougher than it should. The intestines weren't freshly fried which was sad coz we were looking forward to it. The chicken leg in my ginseng was really soft  but bland, thought its supposed to be ginseng based. Not coming back.

Ordered 1 meatball and sliced pork porridge, and 1 pumpkin sliced chicken porridge, have to say both are quite nice and the ingredients are fresh, prices a bit on the high side though. But will eat here again.
Porridge with collagen…. Pricy but taste great and “feels” healthier after eating!!!!

This place has good pork congee if you are in the vicinity of town. The chap who took my order was polite.
You have to pay extra for egg to be added which I did not.
Congee is always my comfort food.
Love the place; very bright, without the +10% and stuff. Definitely an excellent place to hang out for supper.

Hou sek!
Congee lover here. This is quite tasty. Steep price for congee though.. i would expect slightly more with that price but okay.. craving satisfied.
Very tasty porridge. Used to go to hans for porridge but now this is the go to place. Best porridge in Novena imho
Although the porridge was ok. The staff added spinach even though we didn't ask for it and passed it off as standard
Stroll Through A Few Rounds & Finally Decided To Settle Down Here For Lunch w Some Expectations Of Coz~ However, Service Disappointing, Food Disappointing!!😔😔😔
Great place for a wide selection for Cantonese Porridge. Always tasty and piping hot..
Taste not bad.

Great portions for the price, was never disappointed with the meal,  enjoyed the minced pork / scallops / chicken / fish porridge that I've tried so far. Just wish there were more drink options than soybean. Still love the soybean and fried goodies that came with!

Porridge was flavourful and velvety. I liked the fried wanton skin but it softens quickly so could not really enjoy for long. Porridge ingredients were substantial. Seating are stools so it is a quick eat and go kind of place. You get a 5% cashback with favepay app. Wide selection of porridge, price is alright for a shopping mall eatery. A little pricey.
If u want awesome porridge,u gt to come here!
Love it, will come back again!

Awesome place to get a variety of porridge combination. This shop has a lot of unique porridge that you might not find easily elsewhere. Price wise it is also pretty cheap, the service itself is also good and fast. Overall a good place if you are craving some porridge.

I tried this after noticing many older folks patronising this. Had the Tioman fish +century egg + egg porridge. The porridge base was certainly good, and the onsen egg was a nice touch. The fish slices were thick and fresh, but there was a freshwater fish taste to it. If I did not include the add ons, the amount of ingredients in the porridge would have been a bit little. The you tiao was too hard and a bit too chewy and the oil used to fry it was not very fresh. I would eat the porridge again if I’m in the vicinity and have a craving, but $11.30 for a porridge meal is pricey.

All the porridge we tried were delicious & we could feel the difference in each variety.

Ambience may not match an expensive restaurant but the price is kept low which makes good value for your money.
Porridge prices are on the high side, expect about $9 per pax. However, the porridge is flavourful with lots of ingredients.

Creamy trio egg porridge
Thai style fried tofu

Expensive porridge that doesn't really justify it's price. Huge variety of porridge type though.

The three eggs porridge tastes very weird. Like the healthy soya bean and you tiao. But other than that, no diff from eating porridge at hawker.
Sells cheesy popcorn chicken porridge, which was a fusion well-done
Nice seafood congee the taste is different from other seafood congee must try hard to describe juz try it
Flavourful porridge that was still warm even with takeaway. Love the crispy wonton skin they give with every order. Cam purchase a set with youtiao and drink also.

I would give it a 3.5🌟 but Google does not have that option.

Location is really good and so is the ambience nice and cozy.

As per attached pictures from the menu they have wines from France, Italy, Slovakia, Australia, Spain and New Zealand.

The selection for Hard Liquor and Cocktails is not extensive though.

Food seems to be fairly priced and very interesting food from Philippines is on the menu.

Service though was certainly not friendly 👎 and needs loads of improvement. There was 1 staff however who seemed to be friendly.

For those who sit at the huge Barrel (drums) kindly note ⚠️ , they have wheels and may roll  down the slope, you got to be cautious as drinks may spill over in the direction of the slope.

The restaurant seems to have a steady stream of customers.

It's a good idea to check with the restaurant on their food and drinks promo.

Since seating inside the restaurant is limited you may want to call the restaurant in advance and make reservations.

Located at Royal Square ground floor. From outside may not be obvious and gives more of a bar & wine establishment vibe which they do offer, but I'm addition also serve Filipino dishes. They also have options for typical western food like pasta, etc. Milkfish is not common a dish in SG so this would be a good intro to Filipino food.

Food was generally tasty.
I just wonder why a restaurant will serve beef steak and the beef they serve comes with lots of fats. The chef must be saving the restaurant lots of money by doing so. Ordered some food for new year. Pinoy female Staff was very rude. Horrible service. Female pinoy Staff do not care about customers. Must send them for conmmunication and service course.

Passed by & the smell of Pork Sisig caught our noses. Ordered 1 to try and loved it!
The lady staff was really friendly & polite too!

Awful experience.

1) standing at the entrance, waiting to be seated. This lady looked at us but ignored us.

2) the other staff (uncle) escorted us in after waiting for 3mins. While seated, I raised my hand for a good 5minutes but nobody came to us. One of us shouted excuse me, order! This staff lady in photo saw and heard us but she just did not care. Most probably she thinks she is only in charge of serving drinks and not taking orders. However, she also does not inform her colleagues to take our order.

I understand that you are understaffed during the peak hour on a Friday dinner. But your service could have been a lot better. This lady really just looked at us and ignored us.

Taste is just ok. $14 for a bowl of lomi is overpriced for me, must be because of the generous portion of meat. Think more chicharon and fishballls could be better. But all in all, I still love La Cafe!
The food was not too bad, really loved the dessert!

Good new experience with authentic Filippino food in this cafe/restaurant.

Affordable alcoholand bar food!

Sisig is nice. Beer is ice cold and good price.

Just manage your expectation. See menu and actual order. 🙂

It was our first time to visit this restaurant

I like the ambience and location of the restaurant.

Portion and taste of the food is good
Price was comparable to others
Customer service was almost great, just observed that not everyone is happy to serve.

Got the lunchtime menu items of bangers and mash (sausage slices and mashed potatoes, which was not what the picture showed), sirloin steak and chicken and pork adobo. All 3 items were mediocre at best. Everything was covered in brown sauce. Couldn’t taste anything of the meats at all. The sirloin steak was too tough and a tad dry. Same with the braised chicken and pork adobo. Braised meats should not be tough. The sausage slices just tasted like rubber. I would never be back for the food.

The menu was old and dirty. Pictures were terribly grainy and not representative of the items. The wooden bottom upon which the hot plate for the steak, was broken.
good food, good wine, good environment, good boss but not the Philippino stuff, rude and no common sense to clear the table for us
Good service, well-priced menu and the best halo-halo ( Filipino dessert, like ice kacang but way better because it has more fresh ingredients ), in Singapore!  Cozy place :)
Alternative place to find Filipino food. Ambiance is good. The food choices are limited but enough to satisfy your cravings for Filipino food.

Very good Filipino food overall. Drinks on promo were affordable. I would come back again. I would love to see the service improve though. I hope the owner(s) are taking the steps to improve after seeing the other reviews here regarding the service.

Food (mains) here are good. Authentic filipino food. Desserts can be improved. Reason for my 1 star rating though is the service. (1) Experience from dinner some time back: We ordered mains (rice and sinigang) and desserts. The desserts were served first. I told the server that we’re having desserts after our meal. She was unhappy about that and said the desserts cannot be taken back to the kitchen and we should have told her earlier that we’re having the desserts after the meal. Uh okay? Isn’t that the normal sequence of a meal? (2) Experience from lunch today: We ordered 2 dishes with rice and drinks. Drinks, rice and 1 dish were served first. 15 minutes later, noticing that the next table who came after us got the same dish that we were missing, i followed up with the server. She checked with the kitchen and came back to inform us our dish will come after 15-20 minutes. No apologies whatsoever. Just informed us to wait. So to give her context of how long we have been waiting, I told her the table that came after us already got the same dish. At this point, the server blew up and raising her voice told me that if I wanted, she will take the dish from the other table and serve it to us.  Of course I said no. Before I could say anything else, she stalked off. From our table, I could hear her complaining loudly to another staff/ manager. Dish was finally served but the rice and the other dish had gotten cold already at this point. No one (no staff or manager) came to our table to explain or even just to understand what had happened. Originally, I let the first bad experience pass and gave them the benefit of the doubt but after today’s experience, it’s clear (at least to me) that the management need to be made aware of their staffs ‘customer service’.

Pop by for lunch by myself since I am in the area. Staff was polite and patient. Ordered the set lunch of Pomodoro Pasta with chicken skewers. Add on the mushroom soup. Meanwhile my phone battery almost flat, they really tried to find if there's a suitable charger for me. Appreciate that! Soup came and taste good with fragrance of Truffle oil. Could be better if it's thicker. Main course came, pasta is cooked just nice and 3 skewers of tender chicken in teriyaki sauce.
Very relaxing ambience, good service and nice decent food at reasonable price! Will come again, keep up the good work
Very cozy and pleasant place. Very friendly staff. Special mention to the beautiful and sweet singer from KL  and her guitarist from Manila, kababayan... sorry forgot to get their names.
Wonderful place to hang out with friends
Great non greasy Filipino food!
Lovely place for family and friends. Very accommodating staffs, tasty food and great drinks 🍺  We will surely recommend this place.
nice food and chill place to have dinner with your family, friends and loved ones! will come back for more and hopefully desserts and live band will be available the next time round 🙏🙏🙏
Value for money..(Filipino) food is good, nice place to chill.. drinks r limited

No question ask, good Filipino food and value for the money! The owner itself is friendly and took time to greet customers and ask how's the food. However the Filipina waiter doesn't seem to be accommodating, we have to call her how many times and after asking question she will leave right away!! We understand that they are busy but just our 2 cent, they need to pay attention on basic customer service.

PS: All desserts are not available when we visited.

Great food at very reasonable prices.
The French Bean is very crunchy.
Has Asia and Western menu and plays contemporary background music. Great join to relax.

food was good. a little bit pricey.
We pop out for lunch, there were only 2 costumers at that time. and its not busy.
we called out to the filipina (black hair around 40-ish) waitress, and she seemed not very happy abt her work. lol. very impolite and impatient. i asked her to take us a photo before we devour our food lol, but she just waived her hand and walked out. i would’ve understand if the store was busy, but it isn’t. lol
very poor costumer service. smh.
Nice ambience to have dinner and some drinks after to catch up with friends
A great place to chill-out with friends and the food is very nice and authentic phillipinos cuisine.👍👏🙏
Fineline Band every friday!!

I Love Colourful NOVENA. I spend most of my daily time at Novena & Newton Area since July 2016. Novena & Newton consider my 2nd home place which I just love my work as salesperson. Wishing everyone to have a dream home at Novena & Newton area. Do engage me if like to know more about Novena & Newton.

At first I though they serve French cuisine by their name but they are actually kind of western & Filipino fusion. Their Filipino food are nice and reasonable pricing but their western and pasta menu are much more expensive though they are also rather good. They have live singing on some days which I don't really enjoy as they are simply too loud for such a small setting.

The waitress was polite and the service was fine. The "chef" was smoking outside when we arrived and when we left the place.

On a Saturday 11am they were out off burgers ALREADY. Really?
I do not know if they really did not have the meat or if they wanted to make us order something more expensive.

This is a nice cosy place with attentive service.  I had a fish and chips which was not bad at all. The pricing is typical of cafés of this type.

The location is great and it has a nice view of Thomson Road and people walking by.

If you were in the neighbourhood and wanted a meal, this would be a ideal place for a family meal. Recommended.
Good value for a pint of beer and good outdoor seating area. However service was slow and seemed like an inconvenience to staff. Could do better.

Very good service. Crowd is a mix of posh and pro.
Brunch on a Sunday isn't crowded here and just the right time for chillax after eating. Must try adobo here! 🇵🇭👍😎

I went into the cafe during weekend lunch. Waited 5 mins for someone to direct to be seated then I had to asked the staff who is just solely doing the coffee whether we could sit at the table. Then we sat down for 5 mins look through the menu and decided what we wanted to eat and raised my hand to ask to order and another staff saw my hand so I put down my hand. Then after awhile thinking that the staff would come over to take my order but he disappeared. So after searching for the person and waiting for someone to come and take our orders for 5 mins. We decided to leave. Service is HORRIBLE. Wasted like 15mins.
Good, tasty food. Price is reasonable.
Nice place where you can find Filipino cuisine. Nice retrace for afternoons and evenings
poor service, food are not serve how it looks in their menu( there is no meat in bihon) when i asked old waiter he said need additional charge for the meat...🙄
Cozy and warm. Staff nice. Price is reasonable. Food is very good. Can recommend to host a lunch or dinner.
Wonderful Filipinos food. Great service and great selection of wines and liquors.
The food is quite good but the air is bad. My hair and clothes are smelly which stink me and my bag throughout the the time when I was there and when I am traveling back.
Good place, nice food , good Service , thumbs up for the staff there specialy to Miss Inky
Good food and a good service from Uncle Wilson. Thank you so much for the great service.
Great staff and live band and atmosphere and quality of wine and food and price.
Filipino joint in novena, worth checking out
Small cosy cafe/bar. If you are not familiar with the area, you might have a bit of difficulty finding it.
Good service.. great food
Staff are friendly. Good place to chill out.
Best Filipino food in the country

Ate there for the first time today. Good food. Wide variety to choose from. Great service.

Decors above the counter remind me of my childhood. The two milo tins and the two pressure lamps.

Will go again to try other dishes.

Best curry chicken in Singapore.

The menu is so extensive that we had troubles choosing what we wanted! We settled for the classic curry chicken which doesn't disappoint. The portions are very generous. It goes very well with plain white rice, bread and even roti prata.

Overall a very satisfying meal and would come back over and over again.

Visited this place on a Friday afternoon around 1 pm. Asked for a table of 5. When we were ushered inside, we had to ownself combine 3 tables to seat ourselves. No menu and order list were given to us. We had to look around for the menu and order list to write down our orders. When food arrived, there was a discrepancy in the food. We ordered the same food but one of the dishes came with missing items. Food was decent. So many fked up things in one meal. Unpleasant dining experience. And the audacity to charge service charge when we literally had to self service ourselves throughout the whole meal. Do not recommend.

We had a nice meal at Curry Times at Novena Square last week after our appointment. This is a retro theme cafe with good variety of local food.
The place is spacious and clean with good safe distancing measures in place .
We enjoyed our sapid nasi lemak with chicken wing and curry chicken. The food was appetising and the curry tasted great to our liking. The only disappointment was the very long wait to be served with our food after placing order .

3.5 stars. Ordered the chicken curry with prata and yam paste. The curry was delicious, thick and flavourful. The prata can be crispier. The yam paste was at best average, tasted powdery, not the authentic orh nee.
This place has seen better times. In the past, they used to serve iced gem biscuits non stop. Now, due to covid, the place is pretty quiet. The food is average now, but the portions are plentiful.
I love Curry Times. Traditional old-school food done well. Pardon the photos of half-eaten food. Too yummy to wait before digging in.

Second visit here. Cosy atmosphere with friendly staff. The menu has more dishes now as compared to the past. We had the chicken curry with prata and dry laksa mee goreng. Both cost $8.90 each. The curry was delicious, with the right amount of potatoes and chicken. Wished there were more curry gravy though. The prata could be more crispy. The dry laksa tasted good too, with fish cake, chicken and a few prawns. The noodles would taste even better with a stronger laksa taste. I still prefer laksa with gravy. Would definitely go back for the chicken curry and nasi lemak.
Tried their signature curry chicken rice and it tasted amazing, will come again. I really love their decor and presentation, where tradition meets modernity.

Photo on menu looks delish. Actual dish plating looks 👌. Disappointed over the small bones in the rice and meat. Cabbage little off taste and black fungus not chewable.

Besides this dish, my colleagues commented that the food standards dropping. I will give my last round soon as I believe F&B needs supports.

Service & Ambience were fine & good.
Food portions were appallingly disappointing. Especially their Signature dish - Fish Head Curry. The size of the fish head doesn't justify for the price of $29.90++.

Curry was lacking in fullness-of-flavour - tasted diluted. Have frequented this place and enjoyed their fish head curry for many years, until today.

Hope something can be done to reinstate the quality on this Signature dish.

A place for some home cooked inspire meal. Service is good but a bit slow due to staff strength. Curry beef with prata & chicken rendang nasi lemak taste good. Burbor chacha taste nice but all the sago stuck into 1 lump. Chendol too sweet without taste of coconut milk.

Loved the old school vibe that the whole place exuded, from the plates and bowls, to what the servers wore, to the interior design.

Food was authentically Singaporean. Enjoyable even if it was nothing in particular to shout about.

Dry laksa hor fun - interesting taste and nice.

Curry chicken - curry seemed a little bland. Maybe needed more coconut milk.

Curry puff - side dish from the lunch set that we took. Old Chang Kee curry puffs never disappoint.

Coffee chendol - I wasn’t crazy about it. Think I’ll stick to a traditional chendol in future.

Clear chicken soup - came with the set too. Yummy. Reminds me of what my grandma made years ago.

Our first time experience to try the main. Food is really great and service staff is friendly and attentive. Wide selection of food from snacks to main course. Great for tea break or proper meals.  The place is clean and deco is retro so quite interesting. Peak hours can be packed so do go slightly early before the peak. Their coconut buns and curry buns is a must try too!

I have seen this around for many years and I regret not trying this earlier! We had one Hae Bee 5 Treasures which is huge in portion. Loves the Hae Bee rice balls and the soya chicken. Ordered one curry rice bento which came with lots of chicken (thigh) and curry. Even the potatoes are perfectly cooked and soft! We were so full we can’t finish everything. Will be back!

This place was empty compared to Yishun branch. Yishun was pretty packed!

I tried their chicken nasi lemak before on the Yishun branch but here in Novena I tried the otah and hebie bun.

The otah was just okay, I didn't get the fish texture because it's too mushy. The the bun was soft enough but the amount and the taste of hebie compared to the size of the bun made this hebie bun became too salty.

Vote for the best chicken nasi lemak in town!
Retro theme local food cafe with good variety of curry dishes. Rice is a little dry. Tried coffee chendol but doesn’t blend as well as expected.

Service dropped tremendously! Takeaway order was delayed by 20 mins, 1 big sized Chinese female staff named Fangfang and 1 skinny elderly female staff surname Loh frowned and brushed me off instead of apologising for the delay! As if the restaurant never pays them salary, or they thought no end of themselves.
Great variety on the menu. Decent prices. Awesome curry bun (eat it when it’s hot!) and Dry Laksa.

Nice place for local fare though prices are a little on the high end for things like prata. The chicken curry is nice though the chicken taste like frozen chicken - fresh chicken would have taste better.

This outlet is more spacious than some. Here you can enjoy the signature curry dishes comfortably in the nostalgic decor to resemble Singapore in 1960s. The portion of the curry chicken is pretty huge and delicious. The curry is the thick kind, goes well with bread too. Other dishes I have tried are the curry chap chye, nasi lemak with crispy fried chicken wing and ngo hiang. Stick to the curries, they are good.

Arrived 12.35pm. There were 3 groups in front of us. Nobody seemed to be leaving the restaurant. As we were running out of time to start work at 2pm, we decided to take away. After ordering curry chicken and rice and curry chicken with bread, and one kosong prata, we were told the wait will be approximately 15mins. As we waited, we wondered why it took longer than expected.  Curry chicken and rice are precooked. Why so long? Maybe short of manpower.
The curry was good. The chicken were generous in portions. We were not disappointed.

Ordered the salmon otah n their signature curry bun and it was pretty good. I like the fact they warm up the food so that it can enhance the taste. Best part is between 2.30-5pm, any bun or coffee/tea is only $2.50. Worth to pay.

Nice ambience & cosy place for a quick bite. The curry bun is to die for. So fluffy & moist. One is not enough. Breakfast set is cheap & good. Serves traditional all time fav such as roti prata, mee curry etc. Price is reasonable.

Jan 2020
Came back to try different dishes.  My wife had the curry chicken with prata and enjoyed it. I ordered the rendang chicken nasi lemak.  The chicken was okay, but the rice was lumpy.

The grass jelly drink was a little weird tasting in that the jelly tasted a little off, but the coffee and iced lemon tea were okay.

Service was efficient.

July 2019
Pretty decent food and decor, and nice place to grab a tea or coffee. Love the buns, especially the coconut and curry ones.

Tried the mint chicken, onion omelette, curry chap chye and the $2.50 set which came with a hot drink and roti prata.

The mint chicken curry was full-bodied and the meat was tender; I would recommend you try this if you are looking for something non-spicy. The onion omelette was a generous portion and tasted like how you would expect an onion omelette to taste. On the other hand, the curry chap chye was a let down, being too watery and just not lemak enough.

The roti prata was crispy but tasted like it could have come from a frozen pack, it was served with curry which was pretty good. For $2.50 with a hot drink, I might return and have it again as a breakfast or afternoon snack.
Nice food at very reasonable price! No wonder it's often very crowded during lunch hour.  The curry chicken is a must try.
My 4th time here and I ALWAYS order the fish maw soup. Usually busy so customer service might take awhile but the staffs are friendly and nice. Good for an old school taste.

Now they have a wide spread of food. Still love their curry bun and the heh-bee-Hiam bun. If you patronize in the morning, Bun with drink is only $2.50nett. We ordered multiple dishes for late morning and the chap chye given was disappointing, just a one person's portion. Sambal petai was good though. Well i must say that's acquired taste.

First time here, Ordered their signature curry chicken and I would have preferred if their curry was slightly more spicy. My friend and I dropped by at 6:30 and the curry served was lukewarm at best so that could be why it didn't taste as good but I would definitely revisit to try more of their other dishes!

Quite a hidden restaurant in the mall. Overall the food was good, especially the curry. Not too spicy and eat with bread or rice. The otak otak is different shape than I expected. Haha. Will visit again

Popular lunch place so there’s usually a queue. But you can get a table quickly if it’s just 1 or 2 pax. Ordered the daily special tomato chicken noodle and was told that there’s only the dry version (though the menu shows it with soup). Found it ok only. Star dish was the cold tofu (which my friend recommended) - nice mix of tangy and savoury flavours

Food is not bad, quite nice actually. But for the price, portions are quite small.
Food came within 5 minutes of ordering.
Free cookies!

The curry is very tasty, and healthy (no coconut milk!). The dry laksa is tasty and fragrant. The salmon otak is unique and good quality. Chicken curry hor fun is very well made too, with a lot of ingredients - fish cake, chicken, tau pok, tau gay, hard boiled egg, okra...
Was also pleasantly surprised that their hot chrysanthemum tea is brewed with real chrysanthemum and served in quite a large mug, and not too sweet.
Great food and prices, great and fast services, have vegetarian choices, all curry and chilli tastes great
Wow. Amazing curry, soft potatoes, nice sesame filling ball, and fluffy prata. Highly recommended.

While we enjoy the food, the establishment hasn't moved ahead along with the Government's reviewed measures that customers do not need to rescan the silly 'safe entry' when it's already been done at the shopping mall's main entrances. Please keep up with times and do away with this silly hassle.
Used to be awesome before Covid but many great dishes vanished and now it’s still good food but with a less nice selection and unless you are close by no longer worth the trip

Honest to goodness local fare. Always enjoy
Their traditional curry chicken with a slice of roti prata.  Other faves of mine include the dry laksa. And of cos, while waiting for your mains to be served, why not get an Old Chang Kee curry puff?

#cafe #cafesg #localfood #localfoodsg #rotiprata #chickencurry #oldchangkee #jedidiahtan

Stopped by at Curry Times operated by the Old Chang Kee Group. Was looking forward to a curry bun filled with aromatic, rich and tangy curry that made their puffs so popular in the early 1970s. The bun was a soft and sweet but the small dollop of potato, chicken and curry mixture wasn't much to go around. It tasted like the result of mechanization. Still an amicable afternoon tea snack if you wash it down with the "kopi".
Service has always been friendly and personal. Curry chicken is worth going for on a damp weekday evening .
The food comes out really slow. Several tables who ordered after us got their food really quickly even though we ordered the same thing.
Tried the signature curry chicken with bread. Yummy.. the lemongrass drink is too sweet though.
Delightful décor and scrumptious meals. Quick service. Robot waiter available with trays.

Good food with a little home taste. Try the braised beef $15.90 sharing portion. Haybee hiam bun $1.50 is excellent. Generous filling. Note this is halal restaurant. Strictly no "outside" food allowed. You may not eat your own birthday cake there.

Understandable.

Brought my 3 year old and 1 year old to your Novena Square outlet last night. As they are extremely fussy eaters we brought food we knew they would eat but we were told “no outside food allowed”. Your waitress had just served 2 plates of rice for them whilst I was preparing to order dinner for my wife and I then she noticed the food we brought for our kids, proceeded to reject my explanation that it was for our fussy eating kids, and promptly removed the kid’s rice from the table. It was 7pm prime dinner time but you only had 2 other occupied tables of customers in the whole restaurant yet your waitress still saw fit to prevent our kids from eating knowing this would cause us to leave because she can’t even make a no outside food policy exception for a toddler and an infant. Way to go Curry Times, way to go. So much for touting yourselves as a “kids friendly” family restaurant. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

Ordered one Roti Prata Kosong  and other with egg.  The curry is nice and tasty.  Hot soya milk not so sweet but has tinges of soya favour after taste.
For rice or noodle, ranged from SGD 8.00-SGD10. 00. A bit on the high side. Reasonable for a weekend treat.
Always love the chicken wings. Home cook taste 👍
Ambience good. Quite quiet. Warning for sinfully oily flavorful food.
Slightly overpriced for what it is... we had chicken curry mee siam which wasn’t bad but the portion was miserable.
Great tasting food at affordable prices.
If you looking for Lok Lok taste Same like JB then you must try this restaurant… especially the oil fried mushrooms … and their Satay sauce is the best to eat with anything …

Comfort Food ! Love the simplicity both of the restaurant and the food. Quality is good and clean. Occasionally Chef will serve you satay and chicken wings and some happening pork strips all deep fried ! Yummy! Buffet served at $25-26 per pax, comes with free flow drinks, ice cream, coffee and also crackers! You can choose your items and just let it boil or put a white peg on the plate to note that you want them deep fried . Look for Kelly who manages e restaurant there. Totally cheerful and nice. Wish there were more outlets like these. Pure and simple everytime !

Talk about good value for money, this place is definitely it! All you can eat and drink on loklok, steam boat and grill. The staff are super nice and attentive. You can order using the paper sheets and also they'll come around with any newly cooked dishes. The satay is really good and the alecarte are worth a try as well!

Foods so so only but still ok
Service not so good also. Will recommend go and try but might not be go next time. End up didn't expect price $33+ per person

Most people there are having Malacca Lok Lok/steam boat. I went there specifically for the Hokkien mee and prawn mee. Prawn mee stock was really rich, unlike most places. It’s an aircon coffee shop with friendly staff.

Borders close but you can consider dropping by this place for some Malaysia Lok Lok! I feel it’s quite authentic. They offer fried and steamed Lok Lok dishes. Thumbs up for their fried Lok Lok dishes, it was delicious.

Crowded but the staffs were still very attentive to every request of customers. Lots and lots of selection, the prawns were really huge, and it’s peeled! Favorite items included fried crab stick, sliced abalone, luncheon meat, enoki mushroom, cheese tofu and satay! Occasionally, the staffs will also go around serving fried items like seaweed chicken, satay, nuggets, chicken wings, fried tofu skin and etc.

Very satisfied after eating and 3 of us in total drank 9 cups of drinks!! For the buffet, it includes free flow of drinks, from hot beverages to canned drink, and even home made drinks like ice lemon tea and lime juice.

Note: Buffet is for 2 hours! Ice cream is also served at the end. 👍🏼

Bad service.. they're trying to control your food intake knowing that it's a buffet hotpot.
Reason from them: no pending orders,  but paper was handed over to the staff.

Tips:
Sit inside if you want good service, bad service, sit outside..
They're passing around some satays etc.. if  you are inside..
Ask for the ice cream and fruits, it's free flow but they won't tell you and didn't inform us.

Feels like I've crossed the border! 😆
Malaysian feel interior and lok lok skewers with selected soup base or satay sauce.
Choice of buffet at $28+ /adult or ala  carte with 80cents per stick for basic meats and veg,which are pathetically small in portion! Eg one slice of meat on one skewer, two pieces broccoli on one skewer.. There's also premium zhi char dishes which cost more, and BBQ marinated food for you to BBQ next to the lok lok.
Refreshing idea for a meal,but slightly pricey to have a full meal.

Food is good, and has a lot of variety to choose from, you can also pick the Lok Lok you want and ask the staff to fry for you. The staff are nice too. And they have this chicken satay it's very very nice will recommend. The bad thing is about the clip that you clip on for the fried Lok Lok is a bit dirty... Overall good place to eat. And they have a 20% discount when you like and share the page and one of their post

Leaves a lot to be desired.. the white beehoon was the biggest let down, no taste at all... I guess if you came for the Lok Lok only it’s passable but not for the other things on the menu.. Whole family stomach feeling weird now.
Love this place for lok lok. Great soup bases. Value for money given 3 different ways of cooking

Great service. Lady waitress/boss very good in recommending and sharing on what’s available and how to cook.

Although 2 hours time limit they are flexible.  Anyway an hour plus we are all done.

Love their satay and satay sauce. Fried chicken wings taste good as well although everyone goes for Lok Lok. Their herbal soup tastes good. All came out with full stomach and no food wastage.  Free flow ice cream (my youngest ones love it) and soft drinks.

Will return to check out other dishes.
The satays are nice. The fried items are surprisingly not oily. The lok lok sticks are great. The soup based are refreshing. And the service is awesome.

$24 bucks for chicken rice for 2.  Chicken is stone cold and still bloody.  Rice is dry and hard. Cashless now so inconvenient have to pay thru the app where they capture your info and then annoy you with marketing.  What a disaster RWS has become.

10/10. Staffs friendly and accommodating. Will come back for the angry bird again.

30 June 2022 : back here again after 2 years with my family + master chef and sad to hear no more angry bird. but food is still awesome. Lady boss still very friendly and shop hygiene upgraded alot. Cheese tofu is now my new favorite thank you. Highly recommended.

The food here is OK. You can have them fried the item you want or cook it yourself in the soup of your choice. If you plan to eat a lot, you can go for unlimited stick and it comes with drink and ice  cream

Food was decent,  variety ok. Prices subjected to 10% svc charge but quite reasonable. We told the person is our first time, and they patiently explained the menu items and how to order. Also came by to check if we needed soup refill. Would love to come by indulge once in a while. Also quite nice on. Weekday is not crowded and they did not rush us to leave after eating.

~Reached at 7.30pm
~ordered soup base and waited 25 mins to arrive
~owner offered some fried seaweed chicken and satay for ground to share.
~ordered lok lok waited 20mins to arrive.
~ordered chilli for 4 times didn't come
~ordered fried food and my prawns went in but never came out. Inform them and waited till 9pm but nothing came out.
~ordered prawns for a few rounds but only manage to eat 2 prawns for the 2hours there.
~ordered pork belly for 6 portion but only less than 10 tiny shabu slice came out. Ordered another round of 10 but less than 10 pieces came out.
~customers were asking for progress status of food but cashier and cooking staff all hide in kitchen with only one young helper outside clearing tables and heading the front for the 2 person.
~not a place to patronize.
~understand is covid and we are not to handle food. But at this rate its going, i think its more worthwhile to save your money and cross the border next year to eat. At least you can get what your money is worth.
~costs is 26.80+.. 3 pax added to 88 dollars.. First time i had buffet but felt like a waiting game.
The name is 'Lok Lok' which diners dip food skewered with sticks in melting pot to cook, the variety can be better. But price and dessert variety is alright.

Since we can't go Malaysia, chance upon this lok lok place. They open late! So for all the supper eaters like us!! Do order the satay sauce when you are there! Friendly lady boss. We choose ala cart as we didn't felt we could eat alot.

Do go for the buffet if you're a big eater, much more worth it !:)

We had the chicken soup and peanut sauce. We also love the bbq option. Must better than the other coffee shops fried greasy options (ps they do have option of fried as well).

Will definitely return back with friends once dining restriction ease!!:)

Great place and atmosphere!!! Price is definitely worth it, food is awesome, fresh and hot and the staff and boss are super friendly. Very proactively served us the fried food, ice cream, fruits and just a very good experience that I would highly highly recommend to everyone!!! Super duper worth it so must come and visit!! Good price, good food, good people.

Avoid at all costs.

Service: absolutely terrible, especially the lady boss (tall). Gave attitude and black faced to first timers who was unfamiliar with the ordering system. Charge 10% service charge for lousy service.
Food: mediocre. Penang hokkien mee was soggy. Lok lok variety limited and unfresh. Ala carte 0.80 for one single beef ball.
Soup base: More like salted flavored water. Mala soup base was diluted++.

The only saving grace is probably the airconditioned environment.

Seriously, there are better lok lok places to dine at.

First time going to buffet shop, what u order u won't get it. First ask the waitress y we order so much and come out only this few they told us still preparing please wait as the shop had a lot of customer. After eating n waiting for one hour plus we saw quite a lot had left or sitting down chit chat so we decided to order one last round before settings the bill. We felt very disappointed what we order not even half of it come and the staff already cleaning or prepare to close shop kind of attitude. So what I think if u worry people eat a lot please don come out do buffet

If you’re used to satay celup in Malacca and the lok lok vans in Malaysia, then the food here isn’t going to quite hit the mark unfortunately. The next best thing until the borders open... but not the best thing. Also opted for the buffet on a weeknight and the total bill came up to about $66 which didn’t feel worth it overall.

Went for the lok lok buffet, there were a large variety to choose from. Service was excellent as well! Will definitely visit them again!
Damage: 26.80
For Satay peanut sauce +$6 for the table.

1 particular staff gave really bad service. Saw a few tables of customers were uncomfortable with the services too.

Advise first timers to read the comments before heading down, to get a sense of the type of service you will be getting.
Many items and soup base to choose from. Paid about $32nett a pax for buffet on weekday. Service was good but can’t say much about the taste of the food.

My favorite lok lok buffet place! It's $26.80 on weekends/public holidays and has a wide variety of items to choose from. Some items like prawns may not be the freshest but I'm not complaining because I feel overall it's worth it for the price! Many condiments to choose from to create your own dipping sauce, and drinks and ice cream also included! Can choose two soup bases and the Tom yum is my number one fav!

Lady boss is friendly and staff is helpful. Food had variety and its good for family gathering. With 5kiddos that quick picky eater is surprisingly a good place for mummy enjoy food and kids can do their own food eating and services.
The satay sauce is nice. Variety available is not really attractive. Dont go for sell BBQ. The stall and do for you. It's much better. 😊

Love their Lok Lok buffet! I always ordered their satay sauce (+$6) as it's very thick and hot, suitable for dipping your lok lok in. The lady boss there is very nice and friendly, don't be surprise if she recommend you on how to eat :)

The staffs are nice too! One of them who just fried the nuggets and chicken wings (SERIOUSLY crispy and tasty) went to every desk to offer them to the customers. I took some of course.
Service is extremely bad especially the ladyboss. Totally different with Melaka structure. Menu is very confusing, the segregation of buffet and ala Carte not writing clearly. No next visit anymore!
Wide variety of food! Comes with drinks too.. love their satay!! The BBQ meat portion comes in pretty big portion so careful when ordering..

I'm always wary about restaurants or food outlets that claim to be Ipoh or Penang or Malaysian. This again proved to be the case. Food was mediocre at best. Takes a long time for the food to arrive. AC is insufficient for a lok-lok place. Also, lady boss talks too much unnecessarily. Will not be returning or recommending.
Affordable and nice. They fry your lok lok too!
Worth the money to go for a buffet! Owner was very nice and attentive to constantly check on us and topped up our soup without asking. She even gave us satay! Chill and pleasant to eat 😀
Can’t go Malaysia now, at least can come here
Value for money. Its an affordable unique buffet very neat way of eating using the malaysia style of lok lok. They will help you fried your food as well as steam boat.
Very nice place, clean and bright. The lady boss was very kind and thoughtful. Kept checking on us throughout the nite. Food was decent and will solve your cravings for Malaysian food.

Had supper with my gfs and towards the end of the dinner, we discovered an lizard-like animal in one of our soup bases. We immediately took photos before she tried to clear the evidence away. When asked, the employee serving us insisted its perfectly fine to drink the soup and then suggested to give FOC us the soup base. We were flabbergasted to hear that because we were not expecting a free meal or discount but an explanation from the lady boss. When we pressed the employee to ask her lady boss to come forward to speak to us, the lady boss refused. The poor employee went back and forth to speak to her boss. Eventually, the poor employee came back for the last time and told us the the meal will be free. We insisted to pay for the meal but we want to see the boss. After hanging around for 5mins, we left because the employee cleared the plates. The lady boss is still nowhere in sight. Never coming back here again. First time and last time. NEA should check on their food hygiene!
Although it is not fully air conditioning, it is comfortable eating there. The staffs are friendly n helpful. They will personally served you fried food that just came out from the kitchen.

Lok lok varieties and selections not much and prices a bit on the high side for ala cart menu.. For those who loves lok lok and big eater.. buffet is more suitable..
Ambience wise normal.. location not bad with other good eateries around..

Didn't manage to reserve a booking.
Took awhile to get seated on a Friday night.
Be it cooked food or fresh food, all are great!

Lok lok that is more hygienic than the ones you find in Malaysia cause you get a brand new pot of lok lok base to dip your food into.

Decent selection and a good place to go if you're craving for lok lok. They charge by a bundle of 100 pieces or you can go for the buffet option where you get free flow of drinks and ice cream too.

Pastries are nice, but most things here are a bit more pricey than they're worth, in my opinion.

I'd add this to my list of places in Katong you should try, but not necessarily one you'd want to frequent.
Very good service. The quality of the Lok Lok is just ok. Would recommend the satay, satay sauce and thai fish cake.

Love their bakery. Freshly made on spot.
Beef bourguignon melts in your mouth. Do take home a loaf of bread to enjoy at home. :)
Some of the worst service i have encountered. Trying to tell u how much to eat. People order 1 maggi, gave half a maggi
the lady service was terrible. She has no patience at all and she expects u to know what they are offering when it's ur first visit.
Good loklok buffet, best for groups. Taste of Malaysia while we are stuck in Singapore

Ok to satisfy your Malaysian hawker food cravings without going over the causeway you could count on fei xiong group.  This is one of their branches that's compact enough to squeeze in multiple stores. Price point is very reasonable in Singapore context. Food quality is passable. One of those no frill tummy fill eatery. Coffee and tea is surprisingly cheap. If you are in City Square and want some hawker style food. You may give this place a try .

Let's be fair and honest, the food quality has dropped due to the inflation and the spike rised of food cost, I can accept it, the most is visit lesser since there are other alternative around the corner, that's not my main focus today.

Something I want to highlight and cannot tolerate with, is the attitude of the staff at city square mall. I am a regular customer of Fei Xiong Group.
I always patrol their stalls at different places all over Singapore, specially Encik Tan at Vivo, Malaysia Boleh at AMK Hub and Jurong Point, Nam Kee Pao at Grandstand and Plaza Singapura and Malaysia Chiak at  Centre point, all the staff I have met never show any attitude problems so far except the branch at City Square Mall.

I have had encountered a few incidents prior to my sharing today. It was a very unpleasant experience and affected my lunching mood each time.

The staff I would like to bring to the attention is the staff in charge of Claypot rice/Bak Kut Teh, this man is always very rude and impatient while serving customers.

The other one is the staff preparing the wantoon noodle and ban mian, skinny male Malaysian who simply ignored my special order and showing sign of attitude.

This was what had happened, I discovered that I was paying $0.90 for my takeaway, hence clarified why not $0.60. after knowing that charged per container, I decided not to separate my noodle from the soup. He was a bit unhappy but refunded the $0.30. What made me feeling frustrated was my curry noodle was ready,  but he told me the ban mian wouldn't be ready so fast but have to wait, fine🙄.

So I stood aside, while waiting, I only saw one customer collected the wanton noodle, no one else. Next one was my turn, question is, why would he wants to delay my ban mian? Why can't he prepare both at the same time?

The worse thing is, after I reached home, I saw that the curry has nearly dried up due to the delay on the waiting time and I also didn't get the breast meat I specially ordered which he promised to serve, instead I got a chicken wing with 2 tao pok and two tiny pieces of long bean, which I really dislike chicken wings. Ended up I added luncheon meat to go with the beehoon.

I had the feeling that this staff did a "revenge" behind the scene to his customer after being requested a $0.30 refund and causing some trouble to him. Obviously this is an attitude problem!!!

The above scenario was only one out of the so many incidents I had encountered and why should I not sharing this with all of you so that I am not the only one but you can also try to experience it yourself. Good Luck!!

这槽真的不吐不快！City Square Malaysia Chiak的员工，特别是肉骨茶和云吞面/板面摊位的，实在没有职业操守，不懂得尊重自己的职业和身份，态度恶劣也嚣张，这种的态度，这种的员工，放在什么地方都不受欢迎，记住你的脸了，看见有你的脸出现的餐饮，绝对不会光顾的。 好的要分享，坏的也要说说，你们也可以好好的去感受感受, 祝你好运！！

Had the kuey teow, chendol, and popiah.
Forgot to take the photo of the kuey teow.

The chendol was pretty authentic tasting. Similar to the one i had in penang. However, the ingredients are found to be lacking in quantity. The green jello and the red beans were very much missing and only had a very small quantity.

The char kuey teow was not bad. Except it was missing a key ingredient namely the lap cheong. Chinese sausage. Other than that, 70% alike.

The popiah was decent. Not fantastic but okay.

Not sure why we have to keep our own plates here since it's more a restaurant than a hawker centre.

Char Kuey Teow was decent. They did not allow me to make any changes like “no chilli”. Wanton Mee was a little too sweet, but it did hit the spot. Ban mian was good, but also sweet. Chendol not quite worth the calories. May return if crave for Malaysian food again.

Update 27/9/2021 - The food standard has dropped a lot. Not sure what happened, did they change recipe or changed owners? The claypot rice, claypot sesame chicken and claypot klang BKT tastes totally different from 4 months ago.

Great tasting food but some of the staff here are seriously rude to another level. Foods here taste somewhat like Malaysia and the prices and portions are very reasonable.

Three stars because of the staff’s attitude. Very conveniently located near the Farrer Park MRT (Purple Line). One can expect to spend less than $20 for 3 claypot dishes and 2 drinks.

If I could rate this zero stars which is the rightful rating.
I should have read all the bad reviews before coming here.

Super bad attitude n bad horrible expensive food.  Paid $8/-for 3pcs of punny pork bones. The Bak Kut Teh stall guy..treated me like i owe iit to him to accept my order. And he wanted additional $$ fot soup refill.
To all tourist and locals,  my advice is NEVER PATRONISE THIS PLACE.

I had the Wanton Mee and Chendol, the chendol was acceptable, don't think they used gula melaka. The wanton mee was bad, mainly due to the soup, like they kept around for too many days. The pork looked beautiful, but tasted bad also. Don't order the wanton mee. The staff was also rude, but that seemed to be keeping with the quality of the place.

Was initially here just for the dried ban mian. However, the chicken rice does seems to look appetising so gave it a try as well.
The chicken rice is average, but the ban mian is still pretty good and packed with flavour.
Did not try foods from other stalls as the portion seemed to be a little small.
Overall, the place is a little small so it is difficult to find seats but the ban mian is definitely worth a try.

First and last time that I'm paying money for such food, terrible attitude and service.

Ordered through Grab for self-pick up. Noticed a couple of my items missing but there was no staff to clarify.

Very hard to get the attention of any of the staff. Finally managed to get the attention of the staff manning the claypots, he rudely told me that all the food was packed and I should check.

I had to raise my voice and tell him that my items were missing. He yelled for another staff before he found my missing items.

If this was a grab delivery, my order will definitely have missing items.

Foodwise, curry chicken noodles had a lot of oil. Counted at least 10 tablespoons. (Gave up after a while)
Chicken rice, char siew rice, ban mian, claypot rice all so-so. Nothing stood out

The self-claimed traditional Klang Bak Kut Teh cost $6 n it's served by a mini pot which is already quite small n the soup is not only half filled but come with 3 pieces "thumb size" of pork, 3 sliced of canned mushrooms n countable bean curd skins.. I'm wondering what's filled in the management mind with such a disappointing biz concept on their dishes, half filled also? First n last visit for me 🙏🏻

Came here just for the not so 'Malaysia' Malaysian food, but the claypot staff is freaking rude. I even wondered if I owe him money? or probably his boss nvr give salary?😂
if you see this comment, pls don't come.
