This is my second visit and decided to try this po pian, it is very pricey at 2.50$ and is definitely one of the top price in town. However, although the presentation looks decent, but the filling looks not packed unlike most of other, the filling is always fully packed. Also, the main ingredient, turnip are not well cooked and tasted quite bland and dry. Nothing much has put in the filling to justify the price. Definitely will not try again as you easily get a better one anywhere else. Also, the stall holder don’t even bother to ask if you need to add chilli which is usually asked by all others to avoid any misunderstanding.
Today revisited this outlet and tried the curry chicken noodle. Curry is tasty and chicken is tender. And it comes with several stalk of long bean which are uncooked. Not sure if it meant for human or otherwise.
Generally, while food wise is mostly reasonable but attitudes of the staff taking order is generally rude or at least unfriendly.
Just for those who wish to try to fried kway tew, do not that the stall only serve with chilli and if you want non spicy version, then too bad.

The food standard has dropped a lot like a totally different recipe. I doubt if they change owner or the staff is new. If I were to give rating, last time was 9/10 now is 1/10. Taste like they just simply stir the panmee with plain soya sauce. Not worth the price paid.

Staff are rude and have attitude problems. Not customers-oriented.

Extremely rude & unpleasant staff. The plump woman manning the drink stall shouts at customers. The younger lady running the wanton mee stall is very rude too. Very impatient & frequently snaps at customers.
I wonder if the boss did not pay them salary on time? The staff there will simply spoil your day. Will never ever return again

Decent prices n good local food.
Staff are rude n impatient however can get on after payment n dig into your meal right after. Ample seats around a break from shopping.

Nice place to have some hawker fares. The wanton Mee is pretty average, the current chicken noodles is good0,, chicken rice is good. Chendol is great too. Good clean tables and the cleaner is quite efficient too

Have their claypot chicken rice. Overall is at the standard (ie presentation, taste-wise etc) but I would still prefer those heated using charcoal. Anyway, it’s a good to-go option if u miss eating the claypot rice!

Staffs attitude is very bad and rude! I think she need to send back for training and Management need to teach her how to behave and respect to the customer. One of the Chinese girl who work on Chicken rice stall on 8/8/2022 at 4.20pm.

Been here few times, but this is worst experience.  The bkt is pricey, but the taste is horrible. The soup is little,  the meat was cooked too long. In fact,  it tasted like overnight left over. Last time to this branch.

Miserable portion of chicken in chicken rice filled with bones. Tasted  horrible, totally not worth $7.50

Am not surprised at all with the negative reviews.. Visit at your own risk.
Wouldn’t mind with attitude, yet 7 SGD for only TINY portion of meat in Bak Kut Teh, and there’s barely meat but fat.

A refreshing addition to the City Square Mall food options.

Wanton Mee: noodle is springy. Sauce was good. Wanton is so so. Soup is bland.

Curry Mee: Soup gravy is good. Noodle is nice. But overall, lacks the punch.

Overall: Recommended to go and try.
Cheap no frills favourites from Malaysia. Claypot rice has got the burnt rice bits but missing out on the salted fish.

Started patronising due to good deals available on shopee. Tried the char kway teow and love it. Popiah is huge, very worthwhile if using shopee voucher bought at promo price, else taste wise is just ok, nothing to rave about. Haven't tried other food but the curry noodle definitely smell good, will try next. Staff are not with the best attitude but also not as bad as how some have described. At least I didn't encounter. About 5 visits made.

Went there on 18Apr 7pm. Penang Char Kuay Teow were dry and light in colour and not dark. Not much taste . Price not worth to pay for as little items in the Char Kuay Teow. Not really authentic as claim from Penang.

This is just at the entrance when you exit from Farrer Park MRT into the mall. Was quite surprised that there is a food court here. Definitely a strong competitor to Food Republic at the top floor. I think this is similar to Yishun North Point. The Bak Kut Teh tastes similar. Only 2 pork ribs & a few slices of meat. The saving grace is the sambal belacan. It really got kick. Chendol ($2) is less generous than the one I had in North Point.
Sitting capacity is small. Might have trouble finding seats.
Worst attitute the staffs over here. All staffs should have name tags so will be easier to name them out on their lousy attitute. Please put a nametag on each staffs for easier complaint.

Claypot chicken rice taste is average, very few pcs of chicken for the amount of rice. Bak kut teh pork is tough and only 3 small pcs with 3 thin slices of fatty pork. Soup has an unpleasant, overpowering medicinal taste of some particular herb. Chendol portion is small with few red beans but quite good coconut taste though somewhat lacking gula melaka. Overall don't bother unless you want to feel angry.

Really bad attitude from the wanton char siew stall server. A customer was in front of me, behind me there were tables and chairs...also have to keep a distance from the person in front...instead of asking me nicely, she gave me a blackened face and said:' why can't you stand here and pay here!'
I was still right in front of the stall and was only towards the right side.... I could not hear her when she asked for my order as she was preparing noodle and asking with her head faced down. There and then it started this bad attitude.
Perhaps the server might be feeling down that day but please never direct this to the customer. Food is mediocre and service attitude was so bad. Will not return again.
For lack of economical choice, this place fits the bill. Food is OK but not superb.

I liked Malaysia food very much. Been supporting these outlets since it opened. However. I realized the standard of food dropped. The taste deteriorate. Eventhough after I suggested to the black shirt manager. The food did not improve. It came to the point that I finally made up my mind. Not to patronise the food stall anymore. Reasons being :
1) pricey. And portion is disappointing. Eat but cannot fill the stomach even with the large portion bought.
2) food is served with few or little tiny portions of meat and prawns or just 2 prawns. Few bean sprouts and few scattered eggs only for char kway teow or prawn noodle.
3) charged for every single box when asked to separate mee from soup for takeaway. When you did not make plastic bag availabkw for packing the noodles.
4) less than desirable attitude of the staff. That when you stand in queue in front of the cash register. They tend to ignore you and do their own cooking and delivery orders instead of politely asking you to hold on a while. This happened when I was at singpost at 1030an. Non peak hours.

In view of the above. My decision is not to patronise these stall any time in the near future. As for the price and portion. I have better options to fill my stomach somewhere else.

Thank you for scrimping on the portions thereby maximising your profits during this period.
Good luck for your business.
Helpful staff, friendly service, decent prices for portion size. Food is certainly not bad.
The management should really look into the serving and attitude of staff. So pricey to pay $7 for this!
DO NOT BUY THEIR BAH KUT TEH. I just had one here, $7 with rice. There isn’t much meat, mostly bones and mushroom. This should be regarded as a scam for $7. Never coming back again.

Staffs attitude is very very bad ! I think she need to send back for training! Hope the management can take action for this branch ! This not 1 or 2 times like this services !!!!!!!!!!! Bad !!!!!!!!! Not recommended coming !!!!!!!!

1) it was chaotic for customers to queue to order the various cuisines. It is frustrating for customer to know that he has to re queue for the food in another line in the middle for something that was advertised in the first stall. There was absolutely no signage to say which queue for which cuisine ?

2) Staff tells customers off very rudely when it is obviously not the customers’ fault but the poor signages for not indicating the correct queue for different cuisine.

3) if nothing is done to improve the system and the unacceptable service, it is unlikely for anyone to support this stall

This place should have a 0 star rating. All staff who take order and cook have bad attitude in accepting your order.
Worse is the wanton noodles counter. Saw the lady rinsing her fingers into the pot for cooling the noodles twice. Very unhygienic.
This place does not accept cashless payment. Whatever cash that she handled went into the water for cooling the noodles.

I always have a soft spot for Malaysian food BUT this is by far the WORSE dining experience for me! Very lousy staff attitude (like u owe them a living!) and naturally you will never get good food with a lousy cook! I've never post anything in social media but this lousy experience prompted me to warn others about this! If the boss even care enough about their business, they shd either train the staff or fire them all. Or maybe the boss is the problem, abused the staff and make them so unhappy. Whatever the cause, if you are looking for THE WORSE FOOD and THE WORSE ATTITUDE, u can definitely experience them here in the fullest form! I feel so disapointed with these unfortunate attitude when my memory of food providers in Malaysia are mostly warm and provide very good food! NOT HERE! have some pride please! Siakswei!🙄😒

the quality of customer service is totally out ,food nice the almost like malaysia ,but the price and quantity in the portion  are very little i bought kuay teow goreng for 6.80$ the contain look alike 4.50$, arrogant staff quality of serving is out.

The highlight of my visit to “malaysia chiak” is always the char kway teow.

Sprinkled with bean sprouts it was a delight and my greed would show whenever  I left my plate completely clean.

But not this time.

It has turned soggy and I left half uneaten.

I won’t be returning unless standards improve.

A plate is now $5 up from $4:50.
Decent claypot chicken rice, not much to rave abt. Purchased coupon from shopee at $4.30 as the original price is at $5. Waiting time at least 10 minutes or so during peak hour

Seriously, the staff are very rude. I was looking forward to a happy good meal but the staff’ attitude denied me the wish.
(Actually, not even one star becos the staff’s attitude sabotaged the nice food experience). The whole team needs to be replaced soonest.
Very rude staffs! In times of pandemic like this, many F&B establishments needed support. But please bring the support to other establishment who value customers, definitely NOT Malaysia Chiak.

Price was OK, portion is just nice. The Penang Char Kuay Teow is average, fragrance is lacking, kuay teow is decent. Prawn is fresh. The chendol is also average, the bowl is small, enough as a dessert for one person. The Klang Bakut Teh is interesting. Price is reasonable and overall taste and quality is above average. Served in a heated claypot, the dish remains warm throughout the dining. Few things that is notable are the rice that is not warm and the tau kee is chewy (fried and soaked). There are a few pieces of different cut of ribs, pork belly as well as some button mushrooms. Broth is mildly spiced and tastes better with garlic. Do get the extra youtiao for added texture.

Very bad staff attitude. Requested non spicy Char Koay Tiao for my kids but the staff refused to accommodate the request even there was no other customer. Reason being it is a “standard” taste for Msian CKT with chili! The Bak Kut Teh tasted terrible with low quality ingredients. Won’t go back for sure!
A bit difficult to find seat during peak. The claypot rice is not bad. Chicken rice is fragrant, oily & nice. Chendol is quite miserable without much ingredients. Overall still ok.

i give it a 5 as it exceed expectation of 2.5. in malaysia, i give it a 3.

char koay teow is spicy and have wok hey. not as oily as found in penang but decent. personally like spicy.

curry mee is ok like commonly found in pasar in malaysia. should provide sambal for us to add spiciness.

At today 8.05pm , i was trying to order a char kuay teow from the stall and asking a plate without a beansprout as i not a fan of that. And the lady just told me that they couldn’t make it with a bad attitude  . I been here for a many times as they never say no before until today. Definitely will not recommend any of friends to here anymore . This will be the last i will be here .
worth to try the char kway that and chendol
No regrets with the claypot chicken. Flavourful and generous serving of braised chicken. Nuggets of salted fish also found in the rice. Yum. Though I wish for more lap cheong every time.
